column1: Associated Masters/QC Notes: Hide Related ISRC's for Immersives/Stereo
column27:
*User story:* As discussed on previous refinement we will hide the Related ISRC's going forward in the Associated Masters tab and QC Notes. We want to hide the same related ISRC from repeating and showing again for both Stereo and Immersive, and this will prevent needless confusion

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on Immersive master type, and/or WAV

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Remove blue 'i' icon and the menu it displays for Related ISRC's, for Immersive and WAV masters, in QC Notes and Associated Masters section both

STAGE product G010003198417C

!image-2025-10-09-02-07-12-067.png|width=532,height=192!

Test this on UST also

Also, make sure the mismatch is still displaying correctly
column369: 10/Oct/25 10:36 PM;venu001;Will test this in STAGE with above product;;;

column1: A3 Export: Prevent source copy/CT 4202 + clip selection
column27:
*User story:* We should prevent combinations of clip selections and source copy CT 4202 from being Exported.

*Pre-conditions:*

User is exporting audio or video assets via A3

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user ONLY selects CT 4202 in dropdown menu
AND user selects either clip option "Program Only" and "Preview" (video)
OR user selects either clip option "Default Clip" and "Custom Clip" (audio)
-AND user clicks Export-
THEN -hide A3 Export button and- -BE to- display "hard block" error message above Export button in red text, and prevent Export: "{_}ERROR:{_} {_}Clipped asset + source copy CT combinations are not allowed. Source copy conversions output the whole master as is. Please select a different CT for a proper converted output, OR the 'Full' version for a source copy of the asset.{_}"

 

WHEN user selects clip options "Program Only" or "Preview" (video)
OR user selects either clip option "Default Clip" or "Custom Clip" (audio)
AND user ONLY selects CT 4202
-AND user clicks Export-
THEN -hide A3 Export button and- -BE to- display "hard block" error message above Export button in red text, and prevent Export: "{_}ERROR:{_} {_}Clipped asset + source copy CT combinations are not allowed. Source copy conversions output the whole master as is. Please select a different CT for a proper converted output, OR the 'Full' version for a source copy of the asset.{_}"

 

WHEN user selects clip options "Program Only" or "Preview" (video)
OR user selects either clip option "Default Clip" or "Custom Clip" (audio)
AND user selects multiple CTs for Export (CT 4202 included)
THEN display "hard block" error message above Export button in red text, and prevent Export: "{_}ERROR{_}{_}:{_} {_}Multiple conversion types have been selected, one of which is source copy. C{_}{_}lipped asset + source copy CT combinations are not allowed{_}{_}. Please confirm you need a source copy of the selected master and submit in a separate Export job{_}"
 * _Ex:_ User selects CT 1 and 4202, and all 3 clip types (Full, Default and Custom)
 * 10/3/25: Confirmed with GMP on UST call to switch from warning to error...this is to simplify the logic.

 

WHEN user selects a DDP asset for Export
AND user selects source copy CT 4202 (alone or with other CT's)
THEN display "hard block" error message above Export button in red text, and prevent Export: "{_}ERROR:{_} {_}A combination of DDP + source copy conversion has been selected. The source asset is 'DDP' audio, which will result in an unusable '.trk' output. Please use CT 1 instead, to convert/output the .trk to a WAV 16 bit 44.1k{_}"
 * When we implement DDP support for physical destinations/flow, this AC will not be included/relevant for it, since we are using CT 4202 there. This AC is purely for digital flow purposes.

 

_Other test case:_ Select clip options or CT, see if other is turned off, then de-select to make sure other option is clickable again

column1: A3 Physical Export: Audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray support for Sony Ci
column27:
*User story:* We will add audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray master support in Export, to send to Sony Ci workspace substitutions for manufacturing plants.

UI will differ between Sony Ci and Direct Mail Delivery somewhat, so there will be 2 tickets. Decommissioning for some plants won't happen until we add support for other physical masters.

-_Important: do we add virtual support?_ Split _ticket between adding Virtual side master support, and then this one having to do with just the destination and audio DDP._-
 * _When creating, for virtual, we will just show "Audio Master DDP [master ID]" as it currently does in A2/legacy interface_

 

-+_How to phase remaining support/future stories?_+-

-Full master DDP-

-Full master DVD DDP/Blu-ray (if this can be combined with DDP above, lets try that)-

-Side-linked virtual masters (Vinyl included?)-

-Combination of masters-

 

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on product details page, whose config can link to:
 * Audio DDP
 * DVD DDP
 * Blu-ray
 * Virtual Side audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray

User has permission AOMA3 EXPORT and proper view/execute access

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

+_UI tasks_+

New destination "{color:#4c9aff}*Manufacturing Plant - USA - Sonopress Audio - DVD - Bluray (Sony Ci)*{color}" should be displayed in A3 Export; this will be gated by permission AOMA3 EXPORT PHYSICAL SUPPLY CHAIN ({_}same permission as for PKGF export{_})
 * We should not use CES permission since this is not a CES plant

 

Continue to gate A3 Export button behind AOMA3 EXPORT permission and proper view/execute sec group access

In Export interface, display in order (with collapsible side number):
 # Audio DDP
 # DVD DDP
 # Blu-ray

 * Sort files lexi-graphically/alphabetically
 * +*Wireframe*+
 ** PROD product 19075878812; linked to audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray (PKGF too)
 ** STAGE product 88985379702 (double-sided CD product)
 ** STAGE product 19075801322 (audio DDP + DVD DDP)
 ** For future implementation, when we start sending different masters together, in one Export job, here is a list of viable combinations:
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP
 *** Audio DDP + Blu-ray
 *** Audio DDP + Side Virtual audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray ({_}DB team confirming{_})
 *** DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 * Legacy reference, to US Sonopress destination; STAGE test product 88985379702
 ** !image-2025-01-15-18-52-13-331.png!

 

Do NOT add audio CTs as part of interface (we will only use CT 4202)

Display both Standard and Consolidated as radio buttons, and default the selection to Standard.
 * _*01/02/2025:*_ Went with keeping design generic, after discussion. Default can change for plant in the future, so it has to be set up somewhere (ISC Japan for example does not accept Standard). UI team can decide which looks best (dropdown, radio buttons, etc).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHEN QC Notes exist for audio DDP
AND QC Notes are not approved
THEN gray out QC Notes option
AND gray out DDP option
AND display message "QC Notes have not been approved for master(s): [masterID]"
AND block Export (make Submit button unclickable)
 * !image-2025-01-15-19-11-17-151.png!
 * STAGE test product 88985379702
 * GMP confirms Approval is necessary; STAGE product 88691922552....(Approval is necessary for CES; when QC Notes don't exist, it does not block an Export to non-CES plants. We will change it with this ticket, and {color:#de350b}*we should test this once we have CES support*{color})
 * !image-2025-02-03-00-19-00-415.png|width=529,height=88!
 * "Include QC Notes" option to display above CD Text options; STAGE product 88697506582
 * !image-2025-01-15-19-34-47-656.png!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Add 3 CD Text options as radio buttons (refer to 1st image above for legacy display):
 * CD Text (AOMA Generated)
 ** WHEN AOMA Generated CD Text does not exist
THEN display _[Add CD Text (AOMA Generated)]_ as link below
AND maroon-colored message in screenshot below (Saving is enough to allow this option to be selected)
 ** WHEN user clicks link
THEN user is redirected to legacy CD Text menu interface with DDP data loaded
 ** !image-2025-01-15-19-22-00-413.png|width=531,height=107!
 ** STAGE test product 19075884022
 ** Not applicable to Master-centric Export, so no need to display there
 * CD Text (Native)
 ** Is displayed +_if an asset of type DDPCDText (176)_+ exists (BE to check this and send to UI?)
 ** This is potentially already in AMP
 ** STAGE test product 88697176832
 * "Do Not include CD Text"
 * WHEN CD Text is not approved
THEN do not allow Export to be submitted
 ** Refer to linked DPSA
 * Refer to 1st picture for CD Text wireframe

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Display "Include EMD Tracks" option on interface, when _*emd_filename*_ column is filled (BE to check this and send to UI?)
 * !image-2025-02-06-04-09-21-977.png!
 * Selecting this Exports EMD track to an 'emd' folder
 * Unselected by Default

 

+_BE tasks:_+
 * Check packager _*ISCAudio*_ for Sonopress USA (audio/DVD/Blu-ray) and as a reference
 * *Top parent folder:* productArtist_productTitle_productNo {_}(Ex: InaMuller_IchbindieLive_19075801322{_})
 ** *{color:#4c9aff}For master-centric Export:{color}* Replace above parent folder naming scheme with below audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray specific folder naming scheme; delete above folder so that it doesn't duplicate twice. Keep below folder naming.
 *** We can include master artist and master title for audio DDP? For any DDP proposed naming scheme, w{+}e will only be naming folders{+}; _*leave files as*_ _*is.*_

 
 * _DDP Packaging logic:_
 ** *---> Audio DDP specific sub-folder:* AUDIODDP_audioDDPMasterID ({_}Ex: AUDIODDP_5244786{_})
 *** If a product has a virtual side-linked DDP master, and it has multiple components, and each component is linked to a different source DDP master, then A2 Export uses the source DDP master ID for the folder-naming (NOT the virtual side-linked one). It will be multiple DDP folders in this case. Should we keep this? OR do we change it to the virtual side-linked one for A3 Export?
 ** *---> Disc/Side folder:* DISC_sideNo ({_}Ex: DISC_01{_})
 *** This can be multiple folders based on number of discs/sides of product
 *** DDP audio (naming for this will always be {_}IC+number.trk{_})
 **** If user chose Standard, there will be multiple tracks based on track Seq; _*Ex:*_ _IC01.trk,_ _IC02.trk,_ _IC03.trk, etc._
 **** If user chose Consolidated, there will just be a single track which has audio for entire Disc/Side; _*Ex:* IC01.trk_
 **** Below files are all unique per Disc/Side
 ***** CDTEXT.BIN (optional, based on user input)
 ****** _AOMA Generated:_ (STAGE job 40131)
 ******* Not applicable to Master-centric Export, so no need to display there
 ****** _Native:_ (STAGE job 40137)
 ***** DDPID
 ***** DDPPQ (can be also called PQ DESCR)
 ***** DDPMS (contents will differ depending on whether user selected Native, AOMA-generated or NO CD Text, and what audio option was chosen. This needs to be paid attention to, to make sure its coming correctly)
 ****** _With AOMA-generated CD Text, Standard Audio:_ (STAGE Job 40131; multiple tracks and CD Text noted in lines 3 and 4)
 ****** _With Consolidated Audio:_ (STAGE Job 40136; note only one track is displaying since its Consolidated)
 ****** _With Native CD Text:_ (STAGE Job 40137)
 ****** _With No CD Text:_ (STAGE job 40138; note no CD Text noted in lines 3 and 4 of the doc)
 ****** Native CD Text can be named differently from AOMA Generated CD Text; if Native is selected, make sure this filename is reflected in the DDPMS. Per _*02/14/2025*_ discussion, we don't have such an example in PROD after checking DB...but this is still possible. This should be a test case paid attention to.
 ****** PQ files should also be reflected in MS, based on what they're called (as mentioned earlier, can be called PQ DESCR)
 ***** QCNOTES.txt (optional, based on user input)
 ****** STAGE Job 40134: [^19075801322_01_QC_NOTES.txt]
 ***** SCANS folder (based on whether DDP has Track Sheet Scans or not; STAGE product 88697506582)
 ***** EMD folder
 ****** EMD tracks are named EMD01.trk, EMD02.trk, etc.
 ****** Md5 hash for EMD tracks is also included
 ** _*Supp. info:*_ [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/] 
 ** STAGE test product: 88691922552 (single side/disc), 19075801322 (multi-disc), 74321178512 (EMD/Local File Share included)
 ** {*}Example of proposed new structure{*}, from STAGE (ignore Copy at the end of the name; this is multi-sided, CD Text included, Standard audio): [ModernTalking_ModernTalkingReadyForTheMix_88985379702 - Copy|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/manu_venugopal_dtg_sonymusic_com/Documents/Documents/ModernTalking_ModernTalkingReadyForTheMix_88985379702%20-%20Copy?csf=1&web=1&e=s2tFcG]
 ** {*}Example of legacy structure{*}, from STAGE (Consolidated; posting this to show how messy and broken this is, and compared to new structure, its much cleaner): [AOMAEXPORT_40136|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/manu_venugopal_dtg_sonymusic_com/Documents/Documents/AOMAEXPORT_40136?csf=1&web=1&e=k0w5nD]
 ** Generate/include md5 hashes with each file, with same exact naming (extension excluded, as it will .md5; BE to check with AMP if they already generate these; *_Ex:_* abc.pdf and abc.pdf.md5)
 ** Only CT being sent is 4202; need to figure out if other CTs for audio DDPs that are sent to plants are still a viable use case
 ** Email notification remains as is; keep Asset Root, and list multiple master types and IDs
 ** *{color:#ff0000}Delivery test case: If a mandatory DDP file is not able to be delivered, the whole Export job should fail. This includes DDPID, DDPPQ and DDPMS. For example, if all DDP files except DDPMS are available, THEN the whole Export job should fail. This applies to any registered DDP asset; we should test if when Delivery copies over from the S3 bucket which this is uploaded to, to Ci, if it will fail the job on their end.{color}*

 
 * _{color:#172b4d}DVD DDP logic:{color}_
 ** *---> DVD DDP specific sub-folder:* DVDDDP_MasterID ({_}Ex: DVDDDP_5619455{_})
 *** *---> Disc/Side folder:* DISC_sideNo ({_}Ex: DISC_01{_})
 **** This can be multiple folders based on the number of discs/sides; _Ex: PROD product 88697650569_
 **** *---> Layer folder:* LAYER_number ({_}Ex: LAYER_01 and/or LAYER_02{_})
 ***** Below files are all unique per Layer
 ***** CONTROL.DAT
 ***** CONTROL.CNT (STAGE product 82876770949; master 5417390)
 ***** DDPID
 ***** DDPMS
 ***** MAIN.DAT
 ***** *_Per 6/20/25 GMP sync-up_* (this was a video call, but other things were discussed): If the user chose "Single Layer" in DU/SU when the DVD DDP was registered, do NOT create a Layer folder; just have the files come as is in the Disc/Side folder. This folder is only applicable when user selected "Dual Layer" via DU/SU. GMP also mentioned to retain 0 and 1 for the Layers.{*}{{*}}

 
 * _Blu-ray logic:_
 ** *---> Blu-ray specific sub-folder:* BLURAY_MasterID ({_}Ex: BLURAY_5616450{_})
 *** *---> Disc/Side folder: DISC_sideNo* ({_}Ex: DISC_02{_})
 **** This can be multiple discs/sides based on product (PROD product 19075884022, sides 6 and 7)
 **** Below files are unique per Disc/Side
 **** BDCMF.cmf
 **** PACL0.dat (need to check if this is unique)
 **** PACL1.dat (need to check if this is unique)
 **** PIC.dat
 **** UCD.dat
 **** UD.dat
 **** FAI.dat

 

{color:#172b4d}*For notifications (those who don't necessarily do Exports to this destination, but should be notified regardless):*{color}
 * [Andreas.Bartels@Bertelsmann.de|mailto:Andreas.Bartels@Bertelsmann.de]
 * [brenda.adams@bertelsmann.de|mailto:brenda.adams@bertelsmann.de]
 * [eliana.espinosa@bertelsmann.de|mailto:eliana.espinosa@bertelsmann.de]
 * [maayan.schreibman.sme@redmusic.com|mailto:maayan.schreibman.sme@redmusic.com]
 * [sonyus.team@sonopress.de|mailto:sonyus.team@sonopress.de]

 

-+_When product is also linked to a PKGF and/or Cover_+-

-WHEN QC Notes are not approved for DDP master-
-THEN display warning message (will post one from below legacy)-
 * -STAGE test product: {*}88697506582{*}; master *835050*-

-WHEN product is also linked to DDP and/or Cover master-
-THEN display PKGF choices at bottom, after either of the above-

-Legacy sent different jobs for each master type; A3 Export just sends 1 job-

 

 

+*Notes:*+

Descriptor can be excluded, along with manifest ({_}*10/02/2024*{_})

4202 should be the only CT; will confirm on other audio CTs for audio DDP

Legacy naming conventions/flow noted for Sonopress (in Aspera...will update this with audio DDP naming instead of PKGF. Will need one for both Standard and Consolidated)

column1: [BE] Add backend support to return new fields for Ai detection
column27: Add backend support to return new fields for Ai detection

column1: Hive GAI - Stereo Wav - Registration Support
column27:
*Description:* 

The SME will integrate Hive's AI Detection Technology into the SME Supply Chain in accordance with the SME Content Protection policy that forbids the dissemination of sound recordings made entirely or in part using generative AI ("GAI") models that were not ethically trained.  

This ticket is for to make GAI scans included in UST Stereo Audio registration.

*Applicable Masters:*
Stereo Wav (16 and 24 Bit) 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Registration* 

UST BE changes are required to perform GAI scan on every Stereo Audio Wav (16 and 24 Bit) registration and send the Kafka message 

System wide capability to turn on/off the GAI scan from BE to avoid multiple GAI scan failures in case of Hive API is down.

 

*Testing:*
Should test usual registration of Stereo Audio Wav (16 and 24 Bit) through UST to check if the registration is performed as expected after the above changes including checking of AQC status as well for those tracks which generate AQC. 

Take assets which will result in AI detection "True" and other few which results "False" to see if the AI detection is happening post registration of 16 and 24 Bit masters.
column369: 02/Sep/25 12:03 AM;kori002;Please find the Epic link for entire details of the phase of this project. UST related changes are requested here. All other subsequent A3 changes will be requested through A3 tickets in the Epic.;;;
column370:
24/Sep/25 6:28 PM;kori002;After JSON reviewed with content protection team the rules around if the track is AI generated or not got changed as follows:



*is_ai* is TRUE using the following logic for the arrays of scores returned by the two classes:

•For ai_generated_music: if at least 30% of the scores are greater than or equal to 0.9, or if any one chunk returns >= 0.999999(any of the ai_generated_music OR mubert OR musicgen OR riffusion OR stable_audio OR suno OR udioclasses)

•For ai_generated_music_cover:  if 10% of the scores are greater than or equal to 0.985 or if any one chunk returns >= 0.99995(ai_generated_music_cover)




 ;;;

column1: To display Hive AI detection segment level details on UI
column27:
*User Story:*
Post registration of 16 and 24 bit masters in AOMA and post Hive AI detection completion AOMA should display brief details why and what time during the duration of track the AI content was detected.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

For 16 and 24 Bit Audio wav masters when a track is AI detected the orange icon ("AI Detected icon) should open a info modal window when clicked.

Hover over message for Orange icon will be - *AI Detection - Detected (Click on the icon for more details) - Basically mouse for orange icons should be turned to clickable option.*

Info modal window should display of details AI detection 3sec segments. 

There will be 2 segments

*Instrumental AI detection segments -* For segments which are greater than 90% confidence score

*Vocal AI detection segments -* For segments which are greater than 98.5 confidence score

Each segment should list duration in HH:MM:SS in a range where AI was detected

This range could continue in the multiple of 3 of AI is detected in consecutive segments.

column1: Hive GAI - Stereo Wav - Display on details page and QC notes interface.
column27:
*Description:* 

The SME will integrate Hive's AI Detection Technology into the SME Supply Chain in accordance with the SME Content Protection policy that forbids the dissemination of sound recordings made entirely or in part using generative AI ("GAI") models that were not ethically trained.  

*Applicable Masters:*
Stereo Wav (16 and 24 Bit) 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
After UST BE changes we should display the appropriate GAI icon. Wireframe is attached along with SVG icons for GAI

Icons should be displayed at track level in a separate column called *AI Detection* on Associated master section, Master details page and QC Notes interface.

*AI Generated Music Status* text message should be displayed in the tooltip when user hover over the info icon placed next to the column name. 

Placement of the column:
The *AI Detection* col should be placed in between Duration Column and QC Notes icon column on associated master section and master details page

On QC notes interface (View and Edit interface) the  *AI Detection* column should be placed next to AQC status column (right side)

Icons at the track level will be based on the status from Hive API and should be shown with hover over small text message 

Find below of different GAI statuses and rules associated:
||Asset Registered||AI Detection Status||EOM Behavior ||Full Publish||
|Yes|Null|Allow|Y|
|Yes|Pending|Block|N|
|Yes|Failed|Block|N|
|Yes|AI Detected |Block|N|
|Yes|AI Not Detected|Allow|N|

 
 * *"Audio track is detected with AI content"* - Hover over message when AI is detected - Yellow/Orange Icon
 * "{*}Audio track is not detected with AI content -{*} Hover over message when AI is not detected - Green Icon
 * *"Audio track is failed AI detection check"* - Hover over message when AI detection is failed - Red Icon
 * *"Audio track is pending AI detection check"* - Hover over message when AI detection is in progress - Blue Icon
 * *"Audio track is detected with AI content and overridden"* - Hover over message when AI is detected and overridden
 * *"Audio track is failed AI detection check and overridden"* - Hover over message when AI detection is failed and overridden
 * *"Audio track is pending AI detection check and overridden"* -  Hover over message when AI detection is in progress and overridden

Above written bold text should be displayed in the hover over as message for respective icons.

*Note:*

*Override the* *AI Detection:* We will give the ability to override the status from Edit QC notes interface and based on that the icons should be slightly modified and shown. The details are provided in another ticket in the Epic.

column1: A3 Video Export (Vantage): warning/error messaging logic for certain size/format/CT selections
column27:
*User story:* We recently came across an issue where a user decided to use Vantage/same conversions on a Video which was already in said format. We should add a warning modal to discourage such scenarios, and to advise to use the source copy conversion instead. We should also check the size of the asset (<50 G to temper expectations) and the format of said asset (which would trigger the source copy CT suggestion).

Checking the size will advise the user to be patient. This is also linked to another issue with Export, which is the duplication of jobs (also reported in that same DPSA); Vitaliy has already created and linked a ticket to the DPSA, and I've linked it to this ticket.

MC may also include a file size check on their system; Promo is also looking into zipping improvements (DMD and Xpress File send e-cards, which are commonly used destinations in A3)

*_10/9/25:_* This will be a UI only ticket for Phase 1
 
*Pre-conditions:*

User is trying to Export an SFV
 
*Acceptance Criteria:*

Refer to this Excel for scenarios/ testing (for Jack and other QAs): [https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/manu_venugopal_dtg_sonymusic_com/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B7291F4EF-3D3A-4618-A594-5DEE4C77E0DA%7D&file=Export_Vantage_Validations.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true]
 * {color:#de350b}Devs can also use this, and may be better than ACs below...but take note of additional tasks below AFTER the WHEN-THEN AC's{color}

 

WHEN format of source SFV is SD ProRes, HD or 2k/4k (vertical in scope also)
AND user selects clip type Full Video
AND user selects CT 12192
THEN fail the Export request and throw error message upon submission: "ERROR: CT 12192 is not compatible with the selected Full Video clip. Please use the copy conversion CT instead (CT 4202)."

 

WHEN format of source SFV is SD ProRes, HD or 2k/4k (vertical in scope also)
AND user selects clip type Program Only
AND user selects CT 12192
AND size of SFV is < 100 G
THEN throw warning message upon submission with Y/N options: "WARNING: You've selected CT 12192 for a Program Only clip. Please make sure you require a converted version of this asset. Contact mediaproduction@sonymusic.com for advice; consider requesting a copy (CT 4202) instead to avoid delays. Would you like to proceed?"

 

WHEN format of source SFV is SD (mpeg or ProRes) or HD
AND user selects any of the 3 clip types
THEN do not allow the user to select CT 12195
 * BE to block/hide this rather than UI; they should configure from the table, per their suggestion (per 9/18 refinement)

 

WHEN format of source SFV is 2k/4k
AND user selects any of the 3 clip types
AND user selects both CTs 12192 + 12195
AND size of SFV is <100 G
THEN throw warning message upon submission with Y/N options: "WARNING: You’ve selected two similar conversions for this video. Please confirm that you require both outputs. If unsure, contact mediaproduction@sonymusic.com for advice, or consider requesting only one conversion to avoid delays. Would you like to continue?"
 * Test all 3 clip types here

 

WHEN file size of video is > 100 G
AND user clicks Submit or Resubmit
THEN throw warning message with red X/exit icon in top right: "WARNING: The selected video exceeds 100GB. Processing and delivery can take extended time; please be patient! For inquiries, please contact aoma.support@sonymusic.com for advice. Do NOT submit another conversion request. Thanks!"

 

{+}_Additional UI task_{+}: For Promo Export: move CT 12195 to the 3rd section with other Vantage CTs in HQ Mezzanine, per Mike/GMP

 

Warning modal should be displayed in such a way that size check and format check can display at once (test this too)
 * As an example, if user uses CT 12192 and 12195 and the warning is thrown, AND the file size of video happens to be above >100 G, warning modal should display both accordingly

 

 

{+}_Background/Note_{+}: Per GMP, the real solution here is to make AOMA frame accurate and improve the MSAs in the system. Then, we'd need to backfill (black top and tail already exists on every SFV in the system). However, this proposal is a big project, and we need to find a workaround for now.

 

*Extra positive test cases (these should be covered in Excel above); make sure A3 Export is allowed for < 100 G SFV's when:*
 # Source SFV is of format SD mpeg, user selects any of the 3 clip types, and CT 12192
 # Source SFV is of format SD [mpeg or ProRes]/ HD/ 2k/4k (vertical also), user selects clip type Preview, and CT 12192
 # Source SFV is of format 2k/4k, user selects any of the 3 clip types, and CT 12195

column1: [BE] Ability to edit the PQ files for Audio DDP master
column27: Provide mutation to edit PQ files

column1: [UI] Ability to edit the PQ files for Audio DDP master from details page interface.
Ability to edit the PQ files for Audio DDP master from details page interface.
column27:
*User Story:* With the future plan of decommissioning the Audio DDP Descriptor editor interface it would be super helpful and more convenient to be able to edit the PQ files found under the Additional files for Audio DDP master in associated master section to avoid pulling down DDP master to edit the PQ files outside the system and then register back. And if master is associated to multiple products then it should be registered back with updated one to all those products.

 

*Applicable master type:*

Audio DDP Master ( PQ files )

*Acceptance Criteria:*

When User has AUDIO_DESCRIPTOR_FILE_EDIT permission and execute access 

and user clicks the Preview Eye icon 

Then user should be to see the EDIT button up top to the corner on the left side. ( please look below screenshot)

1) Inline editing - file should be accurate and only ISRC editing is allowed.

Edit option will be disabled until the file is not swapped and until it gets proceed. and hence a we need a message from DB to show on the UI (BE will send the flag saying Swap is progress and UI will show the message accordingly - meaning UI will show this message until BE send another flag saying it is done to let user know that file is updated.
 * New AMP asset key will be generated when users edit the PQ file and hence old AMP asset key will be replaced with New AMP asset key.
 * We need to save Old AMP asset key.
 * AMP should next make the change on isilon fast enough as they are not heavy files and request are not that many as frequently - New AOMA 3 interfaces will show the New PQ file but some AOMA 2 interfaces like A2 export or A2 DDP Descriptor will still show Old PQ file until the file gets synced by AMP.

 * ISRC warning modal window should be displayed once user clicks save button when user is trying to change the ISRC in the PQ file 
 **  Upon user clicks save button if there is ISRC mismatches we should warning modal window and if not Swap of the PQ files will get started.
 **  So SAVE Button should be enabled only when both of the two below criteria are met:

 * 
 ** 
 *** At least one change is entered from where user opened the PQ file.
 *** and ISRC format has no errors and all the ISRC entered are correct.
 * Unless a real and correct ( meaning not replacing with same ISRC or a value which is not even an ISRC ) then only the save button should be enabled
 * ISRC format validation should also be handled on UI per attached screenshot in comments and if ISRC validation fails then we should block the submit button.
 * GMP is okay to separate editing of PQ files through eye icon for different side masters of the DDP unlike legacy editor interface where everything at one place
 * Each track (trk) should have only one isrc input available (if trk has more than one idx - show input for the first idx only), 00 and AA tracks are not editable

 

!image-2025-07-01-14-31-50-023.png|width=283,height=240!

 

And the once User clicks edit Edit button should be replaced with Cancel and Save button with red and green button respectively.

SAVE button will not be enabled until and unless the ISRC which was deleted and filled back with accurate and standard no of characters which ISRC have today. 

Only ISRC edit should be given

All the rules and validations if any of AOMA 2 DDP Descriptor editing should be inherited to here.

column1: AQC - To add info icon to Frequency cutoff errors for Unexpected Bandwidth type
column27:
*User Story:* As a user I want to understand  the desc of the frequency cutoff error  when AQC reported an "Unexpected Bandwidth" type.

*Applicable master Types:*
Stereo Audio (Wav 16 and 24bit)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*!image-2025-06-10-13-14-57-662.png|width=504,height=159!*
 * Warning/Error codes in the description column should be removed everywhere. 
 * Info icon for frequency drop off error should be dynamic in color ( red or yellow ) based on info from BE. 
 * Info modal window when opened both messages (Validation messages and Validation corrective action messages ) should be displayed in separate section with respective headings.
 * For "Unexpected bandwidth" AQC type
 ** The description "Frequency Cutoff error"  should have info icon(red or yellow colored based on if the *Condition* is Fail with warning or Pass with warning respectively) beside to it with the below messages in the info icon window (attached the excel - Validation messages and Validation corrective action messages should be based on master type, condition ) in the icon
 ** This display of the icons color and their message inside for respective Asset type, Asset Subtype, Condition should be tested  
 ** The icon should display both Validation message and Validation suggested corrective message highlighting both problem and solution to the user.

*Dev Notes:*
 * New columns in automated_qc_notes table are as follows
 ** auto_qc_validation_status - Validation status string for the AQC
 *** Please note as of now in the pass cases as of now this status remains as null. (If you would like me to change this please let me know.)
 ** auto_qc_validation_msg - Validation error message
 ** auto_qc_validation_corr_action - Corrective action message

column1: Hive GAI - Stereo Wav - Email Notification
column27:
*User story:*

To generate email notification to users post registration and post GAI completion and also to generate email notification to users once any AI detection flag is overridden 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Subscription in AMP user management:*

AI Generated Music Detection Complete

 

*Note:* The registration email & the AI email will be 2 separate email.

 

*Email  template:* 

*Info to be added:* 

*Top level (Master Details):*

"Master Id", "Artist", "Master Name", -

*Info Level (Asset Details):*
Asset Upload ID, Track Master ID, Side #, Track #, Track Title, ISRC, AI Generated Music Status, GAI Completed Date/Time and Registered By

*A3 Details Page URL (Associated Master section of the parent master)*

*Support Details*

*Example Email:* 

*Master Details-----------------------------------------------------------------*
Master: 000005687130 - Audio Master WAV 24 Bit
Artist(s): Carly Simon
Master name: 5 Song Sample

{*}Asset Status{*}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
Email template will look like below: 

!image-2025-10-08-15-31-25-950.png|width=388,height=63!
 
Asset Name name and file name along with Asset ID, Master ID, Side, Track Seq, AI Generated Music status and Registration last updated
 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

*A3 Details Page URL: [AOMA|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/product/G0100013826771/associated-masters/master-details?languageId=104&masterId=5728390&masterTypeId=34]*

*AOMA Support Details* 

 

End  of email>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

 

*Imp Note:*

For Hive AI detection completion emails - Email notification will be only sent out for Sucessfully completed and Detected tracks or Partially failed. Email will not be sent for not detected cases.

Detected text in the table should be Red color in text

and for Hive AI detection overridden emails - Email notification will be only sent for those tracks where overridden action was taken and for those tracks it will list the AI detection status and also the override flag along with Override reason/comments. 

and also  other status  like "Failed" or pending will be in Orange color.

 

+*Scenarios for Subject Lines for AI detection completion and overridden emails:*+

 

1) Subject lines (in bold) to the email notifications sent to subscribed users post registration and AI check completion 

a) AI check successfully completed for all the uploaded assets in an album

At least one asset has AI content detected: *AI-Generated Music Detection Successful (AI Detected):* *Master ID - [Product Number]*  *ArtistName - ProductTitle - MasterType*

b) AI check partially failed for few of all the uploaded assets in an album due to any backend error

No AI content detected at all for all the remaining uploaded assets: *AI-Generated Music Detection* *Partially Failed:* *Master ID  [Product Number]  ArtistName - ProductTitle - MasterType*

At least one asset has AI content detected out of all successfully AI check completed assets: *AI-Generated Music Detection* *Partially Failed* *(AI Detected):* *Master ID  [Product Number]  ArtistName - ProductTitle - MasterType*

C) AI check failed completely for all uploaded assets due to any backend error

*AI-Generated Music Detection* *Failed:* *Master ID - [Product Number]  ArtistName - ProductTitle - MasterType*

 

 

2) Subject lines (in bold) to the email notifications sent to subscribed users once assets are overridden.

*AI-Generated Music Detection Overridden: Master ID [Product Number] ArtistName-ProductTitle-Mastertype*

column1: A3 Export: Vinyl support (Sony Ci)
column27:
*User story:* This ticket will be about adding Vinyl (both flavors) to A3 Export, for Sony Ci.

*Pre-conditions:*

User is exporting Vinyl masters (16 and/or 24 bit)
 * masterTypeIds are 58 and 80
 * -Virtual support? masterTypeIds are 79 and 83- (per Rithwik's report, this was not found in PROD, so we're crossing this out)

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Gate A3 Export button behind AOMA3 EXPORT permission and proper view/execute sec group access

Destination will be "{_}Manufacturing Plant - CES - Pallas (Germany){_}"; gate this with permission EXPORT MANUFACTURING PLANTS CES
 * Decided on 06/05/2025 refinement; we won't give this to any user and will only assign to the Admin role
 * Client Supplier ID is 20
 * !image-2025-06-05-10-11-07-487.png|width=589,height=355!

 

In UI, there should be one checkbox with Vinyl master displayed, along with a QC notes option (if available; this is a .txt file which is created if manual changes are done to QC). No need to display all the tracks associated with the Vinyl master. Display the master ID too, as we currently do on A3 Export
 * In last 6 months, only one QC file was sent to a CES plant...job is 943873. I see more traffic on non-CES destinations

 

+_Legacy display:_+

!image-2025-05-20-16-53-48-741.png|width=385,height=187!

 

+_Filenaming structure:_+

When it lands in Ci, start with {*}top folder{*}: AOMA_EXPORT_exportJobID

Send Rohit filenaming when its both PKGF and Vinyl in product

*---> Nested product folder:* ProductArtist_ProductTitle_ProductNo

*---> Vinyl master folder:* Vinyl_[16 or 24]Bit_MasterID
 * ---> ComponentNo_SideLetter/No.wav

 * 
 ** This will be a single .wav file which includes all the tracks on a single component. Duration will be displayed on details page for whole component too
 * ---> QC_Notes.txt (optional; {+}in legacy, this is outputted if the user selects the checkbox above{+})
 * *---> SCANS folder (optional)*
 ** ---> QC.[img format]; I see jpg and pdf formats so far
 *** This is the "first" QC file that are uploaded via the user; these are not mandatory to be uploaded, but they select an "Add Files" option in the DU/SU interface to upload it (see below).
 *** GMP confirmed we should keep this
 *** Example in legacy: [AOMAEXPORT_944829|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/manu_venugopal_dtg_sonymusic_com/Documents/AOMAEXPORT_944829?csf=1&web=1&e=1xb6jF] 
 * QC Notes can be on multiple components, but there is only one text file and one QC image. _Again, both are optional_
 * QC Notes should be outputted as it was registered; manual changes to QC will generate a new txt file (which user will then need to select in the interface)
 * .md5 hashes for all files
 * Example of new naming (w/o Parent Export job folder): [KRS-One_ReturnOfTheBoomBap_01241415171|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/manu_venugopal_dtg_sonymusic_com/Documents/KRS-One_ReturnOfTheBoomBap_01241415171?csf=1&web=1&e=9vctsA]

 

Export output should be the single .wav file for the side/component, as it is registered via Direct and/or Simple Upload. Details pages show tracks associated with each Component/Side, but this is not how its uploaded (it is on the user to make sure the audio they upload covers all tracks and is the right audio. AOMA does not check this).

Uploader is also required to register a wav file for each Component/Side on the product. Not doing so will block the registration submission.
 * However, after I added the same WAV file to Side B and removed it, and then clicked Submit again, it allowed the registration to go through. Does this mean not all Components/Sides can be visible on the Export UI?

!image-2025-05-28-18-41-30-004.png|width=599,height=162!

 

There is also a label copy PDF that must be included, especially for CES Exports...there is no option to add this in DU/SU. Not sure how this is generated, but BE will have to see how this is made in the legacy code. Below is PROD job 945833 to destination _Manufacturing Plant - CES - Optimal media (Germany) [Pickup]_

!image-2025-06-03-15-25-55-191.png|width=888,height=197!
 * PDFGenerationForCESExport.java in remote-export-daemon repo
 * method name: createCESPDFForExternalSuppliers
 * This will come separate from the SCANS folder and the audio files
 * This will not come for a Master-centric Export as this is called from Product data
 * {_}*07/07/2025 Sprint Planning*{_}: This should be included for PKGF Export

 

Per GMP, similar to a track/cue sheet, this PDF can indicate to the user what all tracks are on each side wav. We will need to export the WAV file, the QC (when available) and the Label Copy PDF above.

 

Email notification for Vinyl should have no changes, aside from Vinyl master being specified: [^AOMA Export 88697720841 - Fabrizio De And - Arrangiamenti P - AUDIOWAV16BITVINYLMASTER - Status DELIVERY_SUCCESSFUL.msg]

 

+_Additional tests:_+
 * Test a multi-disc product and see how this is outputting
 * Do regression test on existing A3 digital flow (WAVs, Videos, etc to Promo, Ci, DMD, etc) and PKGF flow, to make sure it is not breaking

 

+*Notes:*+

Descriptor can be excluded, along with manifest (since {_}*10/02/2024*{_})

No CT selection in legacy; 4202 will be the only CT. Direct Mail Delivery will be another ticket (Delivery has added source copy support, so we just need to add 4202 in DB, for CT display)

column1: Hive GAI - Stereo Wav - Ability to Override the AI Detection and Run the AI detection from UI
column27:
*Description:* 

The SME will integrate Hive's AI Detection Technology into the SME Supply Chain in accordance with the SME Content Protection policy that forbids the dissemination of sound recordings made entirely or in part using generative AI ("GAI") models that were not ethically trained.  

*Applicable Masters:*
Stereo Wav (16 and 24 Bit) 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

After UST changes based on the BE info passed we will display the appropriate *AI Detection* icons.

Along with display we should also give the ability to *Override* the values where users might have to override the for various reasons so the product can be full published and delivered. (Wireframe and SVG icons are attached below)

*Override AI Detection* option should be provided in "QC Notes" interface after *RUN AI Detection* and should only be displayed for users have this below permission:

*QC OVERRIDE AI DETECTION*

So order of Display of options in the View QC notes interface is: EDIT QC Notes. Import QC notes, RUN AQC, RUN AI Detection and Override AI Detection

Checkboxes should be provided for each track to be able to select the track(s) 

Enabling *RUN AQC* option should follow same logic as we have it now based on selection of atleast on checkbox of Failed AQC track or Null AQC track(AQC never run)

Enabling *RUN AI Detection* option should follow the logic of selection of atleast on checkbox of Failed GAI track or Null GAI track (GAI never run)

Enabling *Override AI Detection* option should follow the logic of selection of atleast on checkbox of track(S) of following *AI Detection* statuses:  Pending, Failed or Detected

 

Enabling or Disable above three options should be based on above rules and if selection of track ticks all three rules then all three options should be enabled and user should be able to use all three (no restrictions)

Similar to how currently *RUN AQC* option disables once user fires the RUN AQC for selected tracks until the AQC check from BE of that selected track is completed we should have same logic for *RUN AI Detection*

*Override AI Detection* option can be enabled back again even if user did the override for particular selected track already and wants to use the option for same track. (Override flag can be set on&off)

Checkbox should be pre-selected already when user selects all not overridden tracks and save button should be disabled until a mandatory comments is typed

Checkbox should be pre-selected when user selects all already overridden tracks but this time save button will light up only when user unselect the checkbox and enter the mandatory comments

Checkbox should be horizontal selected checkbox when user selects few overridden tracks and few not overridden tracks and this time user should either check or uncheck the checkbox completely and enter a comment to save it.

*Important Note:* BE will initiate Systematic re try or RUN AI detection for failed tracks for 5 attempts. Meaning post registration of asset and Hive AI detection is failed for a track then system will take that as pending task (so that no UI re RUN AI detection can be used) and system will re run the Hive up to 5 attempts until it not failed. If 5 attempts are unsuccessful  then system would not retry anything from BE and we will mark that track as AI detection failed and if needed later RUN AI can be initiated again from UI by users. 

Once user clicks the option *Override AI Detection* an *Override AI Detection*  named modal window should be opened as shown below (Ignore the word Edit GAI):

!image-2025-09-10-10-18-58-610.png|width=256,height=114!

Check box should be called as *Override AI Detection* and it should be pre-selected as default.

Comments box should be called as *Reason for Override* and it should allow to enter free text and mandatory and only after entering some text the save button should be enabled. This provides backtracking if anything was overridden and allowed to publish and deliver. 

Once the track(s) were overridden those track(s) should have different icon that needs to be displayed at track level on associated master section, master details page QC Notes interface (View and Edit interfaces) replacing the standard (before overriden) GAI icons.

Please find the override icons which slightly differs from normal GAI icons and the text message (bold messages below)that should be displayed on the hover over 

 

{*}AI Detection{*}{*}: Pending{*} {*}and overridden{*}- Tracks that are registered and GAI in progress - Blue Icon

{*}AI Detection{*}{*}: Failed{*} {*}and overridden{*}- Tracks that are registered but failed from GAI - Red Icon

{*}AI Detection{*}{*}: AI Detected{*} {*}and overridden{*}- Tracks that are registered and got GAI detected - Yellow/Orange Icon

 

Above written bold text should be displayed in the hover over as message for respective icons.

!image-2025-09-10-10-35-31-610.png!

 

After overriding the status of AI detection for the track(s) the GAI icon should be updated on details page (associated master section, QC notes interface and master details page)

After successful change of the status EOM message should be delivered and should update the ability to full publish and orderable in EOM (Vamsi's Kafka message is attached to XSC linked to the Epic)

Email notification should be sent out to the user about the GAI status update. (It will be phase 2)

column1: To display product footage type and mismatches on Products tab for digital video track products.
column27:
*Description:*

With last build we have started supporting Pseudo video creation using non jpeg files like gif files. 

The footage type the digital video track should be "Enhanced Pseudo Video" to accept a non jpeg file 

*Acceptance criteria:*
To display Product footage type of product in product tab on details page with mismatch if master footage type does not match in associated master section

column1: QC Notes/Immersive: "Create Master Hierarchy" flow for when Related ISRC is available
column27:
*User story:* Excluding Stereo ISRC tracks from QC flows for immersive masters will also affect which tracks should be made when creating a new master hierarchy.

 

*Pre-conditions:*

User has permission QC NOTES EDIT

User has proper security group execute access

Master's track count is < product's track count
 * System will need to check if the product is an immersive or stereo one, and THEN the immersive tracks need to be identified for the comparison

Master is empty

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
h3. Stereo product

WHEN product is Stereo
AND track has related ISRC
AND user is on immersive master type
AND user clicks "Create Master Hierarchy"
THEN create hierarchy only for those tracks which has related ISRC
 * Use related ISRC performance table to identify the correct tracks

h3. Immersive product

WHEN product is Immersive
AND track has related ISRC
AND user is on immersive master type
AND user clicks "Create Master Hierarchy"
THEN create hierarchy only for those tracks which has related ISRC
 * Consider ALL tracks for immersive product

 

UI changes seem to be already done from AOMA3-1817

 

-Look for createMasterHierarchy() and getMasterTrackDetails(); relatedIsrc performance table can also be checked to get the ISRC-

 

+_Other test cases:_+

UST part to be tested, by testing "Create Master Hierarchy" flow there

Existing "Create Master Hierarchy" flow in PROD for stereo and immersive products should remain intact

Make sure you can edit QC Notes after hierarchy is created

Check Master Event History for proper event, desc, etc.

column1: [AMEBA] GRPS full publish Rules and messages for Hive AI detection
column27:
Hello AMEBA team,

Please find the rule and messages associated to full publish capability in GRPS for Hive AI detection

*For Stereo Wav 16 and Wav 24 Bit masters:*

For regular products (where AI detection is Null or AI not detected) we should not show any messages in GRPS and allow full publish (EOM partner delivery is also allowed)

*Important Note:*
Assets swaps are allowed for full published product (usual process - We allow assets swaps in AOMA for full published products even now) and now after swap if AI is detected again on the new asset then we send the AI flag to EOM and EOM blocks the partner delivery for this track unless overridden again.. but full publish stays as full publish..

Please find the below rules and  messages for other product cases:

XX: 16 or 24

YYYYYY: Master ID

*Block full publish in GRPS until all the tracks in all the audio wav masters associated to the product are either "AI not detected" or "AI detected/failed/Pending but overridden"*

 
 * *"Audio Master Wav XX Bit YYYYYY is detected with AI content for at least one track"* - Parent master level message when AI is detected but not overridden for all the detected tracks in the audio master
 * *"Audio Master WAV XX Bit YYYYYY is failed AI detection check for at least one track"* - Parent master level message when AI detection is failed and not overridden for all the failed tracks in the audio master
 * *"Audio Master WAV XX Bit YYYYYY is pending AI detection check for at least one track"* - Parent master level message when AI detection is in progress and not overridden for all the pending tracks in the audio master
 * *"Audio Master Wav XX Bit YYYYYY is detected with AI content for at least one track and overridden"* - Parent master level message when AI is detected and overridden for all the detected tracks in the audio master
 * *"Audio Master WAV XX Bit YYYYYY is failed AI detection check for at least one track and overridden"* - Parent master level message when AI detection is failed and  overridden for all the failed tracks in the audio master
 * *"Audio Master WAV XX Bit YYYYYY is pending AI detection check for at least one track and overridden"* - Parent master level message when AI detection is in progress and overridden for all the pending tracks in the audio master

Note: At parent master level messages AI detected message will take superiority over AI Detected and overridden messages

Track master level messages:
 
 * *"Audio track is detected with AI content"* - Track message when AI is detected 
 * *"Audio track is failed AI detection check"* - Track level message when AI detection is failed
 * *"Audio track is pending AI detection check"* - Track level message when AI detection is in progress
 * *"Audio track is detected with AI content and overridden"* - Track message when AI is detected and overridden
 * *"Audio track is failed AI detection check and overridden"* - Track level message when AI detection is failed and overridden
 * *"Audio track is pending AI detection check and overridden"* - Track level message when AI detection is in progress and overridden

column1: [BE] Explicit Indicators - Track Master Edit
Hive GAI - Stereo Wav - Asset Swap and Unregistration
column27:
In AOMA system when user does stereo audio registration a GAI scan will happen, All the GAI done for that asset is saved to the DB, if the user unregisters or does an asset swap all the saved GAI for the previous asset should not be deleted and the GAI for the new asset should also be saved, The old GAI should not be deleted.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

 

GAI should be backed up
 # Un-register wav 16 and 24 Bit asset, GAI should be backed up
 # Asset Swap a wav 16 and 24 Bit asset, GAI should be backed up

 

*Important Note:*
Assets swaps are allowed for full published product (usual process - We allow assets swaps in AOMA for full published products even now) and now after swap if AI is detected again on the new asset then we send the AI flag to EOM and EOM blocks the partner delivery for this track unless overridden again.. but full publish stays as full publish..

*Regression test:*

Should test usual unregistration and asset swap of Stereo Audio Wav (16 and 24 Bit) through UST to check if they are performed as expected after the above changes including checking of AQC status as well for those tracks which generate AQC.

column1: [DB] ISRC-related queries (A2 Export Order form traffic migration to GOLD)
column27:
Hi DB team,

I'm working on a project to help develop a download button in the GOLD app, so that we can migrate some of AOMA's Export Order form traffic over to using it instead...ultimately, this will help the overall goal of killing the A2 Export Order form altogether.

For this, I need to see how certain products/Orders were fulfilled in AOMA and if there was any strange situation where it was NOT fulfilled, order didn't go through, etc. Attached are 2 reports from GOLD, of different requests from their end; one is for single-use/track requests, and the other is for Compilation products.

For the first/single use Excel, please look at the ISRC column in it, and supply me a report of the following:
 * The Product No's associated with the ISRC (refer to _*Column F/Asset Number for the ISRC)*_
 ** There is one blank entry here, whose title is *The Photographer, "A Gentleman's Honour"* (look for blank entry in Column F)...do a search for the title in this case, to get possible Product No's
 * Any Export Orders associated with these Product No's (different from Export Job ID's)
 * Status of Export Order (whether these Export Orders were fulfilled or not)
 * Master types and IDs associated with these Export Orders (track master ID and track ISRC also included, if possible)
 * Export Order requestor
 * Maintenance Owner
 * Export Job ID
 * Export Job submitter

 

For the 2nd Excel/Compilations one, please provide the same as above in a 2nd sheet. The Product No is already listed in Column I.
 * If you do not find any Export Order associated with this Compilation product, please instead do a search for associated Product No's on the ISRC's listed in Column M, and repeat the same criteria as above. The criteria in this case would be the same, as above for track/single-use...only difference is using Column F in one Excel, and Column M in the other.

 

Also, on a separate note/question: are there cases of track masters in AOMA having a null ISRC? I know that product ISRCs can sometimes be null because of the product being created in a rush (in GRPS), but just curious if its the same with master ISRC's as well. We're looking to send ISRCs accordingly to GOLD for this proposed download flow, so this would be good information for me to know.

Thanks!

+_BE tasks:_+

column1: [BE] Export fails for product tracks without assigned ISRC
column27:
*AOMA3 productized export fails for tracks with not assigned ISRC*

Prod DPSA:
{panel}
DPSA-31262
where the export of tracks failed via AOMA3 but were successful via AOMA2 export.

AOMA3 Error: "400 : "Order contains duplicate tracks for master:[null] product:[G010001384559I] isrc:[null]""
 
G010001384559I - Side 3 - Tracks 15 & 17. Please note that these tracks are without an assigned ISRC on the Details UI. 
{panel}

STAGE replication:

Product: 82367510423
Select tracks 1 and 2 and submit export ->

column1: Stereo Wav: To Support Hive GAI Detection in AOMA UST, Details Page and QC notes
column27:
*Description:* 

The SME will integrate Hive's AI Detection Technology into the SME Supply Chain in accordance with the SME Content Protection policy that forbids the dissemination of sound recordings made entirely or in part using generative AI ("GAI") models that were not ethically trained.  

*Applicable Masters:*
Stereo Wav (16 and 24 Bit) - Highest priority 

Other masters which has audio in it will eventually also be the scope of this project

*Project High level:*
**
 # GAI scans will be conducted when new tracks are first uploaded into the AOMA, before they go live. When Hive identifies a track as being GAI, the product(s) will be flagged in the system and placed on "hold." 
 # A note will be generated by the system to be shared with the SME label or affiliate. The SME label or affiliate is required to review all flagged products before any further action is taken in the system.
 # Once the SME label or affiliate reviews and approves, the content can be set to Full published and can be delivered.

*Phases:*
Phase 1

1) All Stereo audio registrations via UST should undergo GAI Scan. UST BE changes are required and  System wide capability to turn on/off the GAI scan from BE to avoid multiple GAI scan failures in case of Hive API is down. Including Email notification, EOM message delivery and master event history update. 

2) GAI badge in separate column (writing based on discussion with Nelson) should be displayed on track (Product and Associated Master section, QC Notes interface and Master details page)

3) Ability to modify the GAI status or Ignore GAI  on Edit QC notes interface (inline and bulk edit) to allow publishing and delivery of product 

4) Ability to RUN GAI for failed tracks/ tracks that were never run ( No backfill of GAI for older products will be done as of now)
column169: Hive GAI Detection - AOMA Stereo Wav Support

column1: Explicit Indicators - Track Master Edit
column27:
*User Story:* 

We should be able to edit the lyric indicator version of track master similar to ISRC edit. 

*Applicable Masters:* 

Stereo Audio Wav Master (16 Bit, 24 Bit and Vinyls)

Immersive Master (Quad, 5.1, 7.1, Dolby, 360 RA).

Short Form Video Master

Closed Caption Master (SCC and TTML)

*Acceptance Criteria:*
For above masters we should be able to edit the Lyric indicator at track master level using the same pencil icon that we have today for ISRC edit. 

We should give the ability to edit the lyric in the same modal window when Pencil icon is clicked

The last option in the modal window should be given to be able to edit lyric indicator 

Drop Down should be called as "Lyric Indicator" and it should be set default to current version of track.

Then rest of the options should be provided in the drop down to be able to edit the lyric indicator of the track master.

 

Three values will be provided in the Dropdown: Explicit, Clean and Unknown. (BE will pass as values)

User can change to any value from one value among above values.

After successful edit E indicator or EMismatch indicator display on details page and on QC notes interface should be properly adjusted based on the value it got modified to.

Similar to ISRC Edit we should be giving warning if the track master is linked to different other products and changing the version here will create the mismatch between the current product and all other products.

 

!image-2025-08-27-22-57-47-277.png|width=143,height=120!

column1: Migrate the AOMA architecture for Physical Supply Chain including AOMA 2 export component to AOMA 3
column27:
*Back Ground:* 

CES Export:

There are two workflows based on who registers the Physical's ( Vinyl, PKGF, DDP. Blu-ray, DVD). There are European registration users and there are US based registration users and hence the two workflows.

EU: If a person is subscribed for auto export to the CES destination, and registers a physical master in AOMA and then AOMA sends an export message to CMG system automatically

US: US releases might depend if the US stuff is getting manufactured and releasing in EU or not. They can use Auto export as same as EU folks does or they can use AOMA 2 Supply chain order form to export to CES destination.

For any workflow the XML message is generated and sent to CMG system  with Master ID, Product Number and Export Key. 

And when they are ready to manufacture CMG system sends an XML based request to export to a particular destination. and the message consists of Product ID, export key and Vendor ID/Client ID and the Export message is consumed by AOMA 2 and an export request is created for that product number, master id (which is represented by export key) and AOMA 2 export destination (that corresponds to Client Supplier ID)

So the destination is SFTP server and it packages everything and delivers to that location and this location is accessed by the client and they get the part order that they have to manufacture

 

Following are couple of initial agenda items (phases):

Phase 1: Along with AOMA 2 queue the CMG export request should also be consumed by AOMA 3 queue. 

We should check if certain destination pertaining to Client supplier ID is available in AOMA 2 and AOMA 3 and whether they are active or not.

*Case 1:* If both AOMA 2 and AOMA 3 destination are active, then AOMA 2 export is submitted and then message is also forwarded to AOMA 3 to submit a parallel export via AOMA 3. This is for temporary and this way they would receive the packages from both and would help us confirm both look accurate and same to make us AOMA 2 destination inactive in near future post confirmation.

 

*Case 2:* If AOMA 2 is disabled and only AOMA 3 is active, then we should just forward the message to AOMA 3 to consume and send the export to the destination.

 

*Case 3:* If AOMA 2 is active and AOMA 3 is not available/active, then just export via AOMA 2 and do not submit any message to AOMA 3.

 

Phase 2: 
We should work on messages only being directed to AOMA 3 queue once deliveries from AOMA 2 and AOMA 3 are confirmed as same.

 

Phase 3: Current AOMA 3 Physical supply chain order form dashboard should be revisited to make the interface more faster and add new destinations as we have in AOMA 2 supply chain order interface.
column169: Migration of AOMA architecture in Physical Supply chain workflow

column1: AOMA Home page - UI/UX redesign and Angular Upgrade of the Home Page
column27:
*User Story:*
AOMA home page needs to be updated to Angular, because the system needs to be on the same framework and development platform across all interfaces. 

A request from business is to slightly the change the look and feel of the AOMA home page to meet the modern standards. 

 

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

Upgrade the AOMA home page to angular

There should be no role displayed on the Home page such as Media Engineer, or Audio Engineer or Graphics Engineer etc..

The interface buttons on the landing page should be more interactive like reacting to mouse hover over by slightly enlarging and highlighted little darker on the border as shown below.

 

The reference documents links should be cleaned up - all the obsolete ones need to be removed. There are total 36 links now in AOMA home page if user has permission to all the links. Please find the attached excel to see what are all the links should be removed and what are all the links should be renamed. 

Reference documents should be placed down in the Home page in categories in rectangular shape with curved corners and those categories should also match with home page buttons design meaning the color, font, boldness, reacting to hover over and it should be modern UX.

[AOMA Home Page - Reference Documents.xlsx|https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/rithwikreddy_koripelly_ext_sonymusic_com/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BC706A05D-45DE-4A49-97AB-A6A6B45B8F56%7D&file=AOMA%20Home%20Page%20-%20Reference%20Documents.xlsx&fromShare=true&action=default&mobileredirect=true]

Reference documents should be categorized into below categories:

*GRAPHICS*
*AUDIO*
*VIDEO*
*LINKING* 

Each category has sub category like including General sub category.

 

The good thing about current buttons we have on the AOMA home page is the readability so we shall increase the font size a bit and make the font bolder. (Short description can be ignored for now - we do not need that) and hence all the buttons will be in square shaped.

!image-2025-07-02-16-22-47-440.png!

!image-2025-07-02-16-23-40-557.png!

 

Home page will have 4 rows 5 buttons each. Total 20 buttons. 

Default order is below if user have access or permission to all 20 options. Display of Some of these (if not all) buttons will be decided base on the role and permissions that user have. If any of the option from the order misses out due to lack of permissions then the order should be followed to the next available option in the list.

In addition to default view we should also provide drag and adjust capabilities of these buttons so that user can customize of what they want to see in Row 1, Row 2 etc...  

We should also provide option of Hiding and Unhide options based on user preference.

Unified Submission Tool (UST) 
Direct Upload (Master only) 
Simple Upload 
Asset Submission Tool (LFV) 
Archive Submission Tool 
Master create 
Registration Job Status 
Product Status 
Export Status A3 
Archive export status 
Manage Supply Chain Order 
Product Linking A3 
Pseudo Video 
CD Text 
Package Printing Specs 
Artist Search 
MBC 
Mobile Audio editor 
Mobile Audio Manager 
My AOMA Files (A3) 

 

*For home page buttons (titles) permission checking should be done on BE side but not hardcoded as we are doing today.*

*Reference documents order, links and categories should also be handled from BE side*

 

Regression testing to see if all the items  AOMA home page  items , Links to the reference documents are working as expected.

column27:
*User story:* We will add audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray master support in Export, to send via Direct Mail Delivery

Compare with cloned ticket to make sure that desc is similar

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on product details page, whose config can link to:
 * Audio DDP

 * -Blu-ray-
 * -Virtual Side audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray-

User has permission AOMA3 EXPORT

+_UI tasks_+

Destination "{color:#4c9aff}*Direct Mail Delivery (Physical)*{color}" should be displayed in A3 Export; this will be gated by permission AOMA3 EXPORT PHYSICAL SUPPLY CHAIN?

Gate A3 Export button behind AOMA3 EXPORT permission and proper view/execute sec group access

In Export interface, display in order (with collapsible side number):
 # Audio DDP

 # -Blu-ray-

 ** PROD product 19075878812; linked to audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray
 ** STAGE product 88985379702 (double-sided CD product)
 ** STAGE product 19075801322 (audio DDP + DVD DDP)
 ** List of viable combinations (at least 2):
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP
 *** Audio DDP + Blu-ray
 *** Audio DDP + Side Virtual audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray ({_}DB team confirming{_})
 *** DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 *** + track virtual DDP?
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 * Mimic Sony Ci display

How to combine with other master types?

WHEN QC Notes exist for audio DDP
AND QC Notes are not approved
THEN gray out QC Notes option?
AND gray out DDP option?
AND display message "QC Notes for DDP master [master No] are not approved"? (Check legacy message)

Add "Do Not include CD Text" option (CD Text options will be radio buttons)

Include CD Text redirection to legacy CD Text interface, for AOMA Generated option? If CD Text already exists, option can display from the get go?

How to display the Native CD Text option? (BE will have to check if this information is available for master, and send something to UI to display option accordingly)

Display both Standard and Consolidated (radio buttons), and default select to Standard?

 

+_BE tasks:_+
 * Handle packager on AOMA side
 ** We are looking to migrate 4 legacy destinations. Check packager _*ISCDirectMaiDropoff*_ for Manufacturing Plant Delivery Mail Pickup (or use same packager as what was used for Sony Ci in AOMA3-2542).
 ** 
 *** *Top parent folder:* productArtist_productTitle_productNo {_}(Ex: InaMuller_IchbindieLive_19075801322{_})
 **** *{color:#4c9aff}For master-centric Export:{color}* Replace above parent folder naming scheme with below PKGF specific sub-folder naming schemes per master; delete above folder so that it doesn't duplicate twice. Keep below folder naming.
 ***** We can include master artist and master title for audio DDP, but what about DVD DDP and Blu-ray?
 **** Since this is Direct Mail Delivery via e-card, this folder should be zipped. Does Promo have to worry about making changes to accept these sorts of files?Proposed naming scheme (cannot upload example folders to Jira; BE team can request a OneDrive link for comparison):
 *** *---> audio DDP specific sub-folder:* AUDIODDP_audioDDPMasterID ({_}Ex: AUDIODDP_5244786{_}) 
 **** *---> Disc/Side folder:* DISC_sideNo ({_}Ex: DISC_01{_})
 ***** This can be multiple folders based on number of discs/sides of product
 ***** DDP audio (naming for this will always be {_}IC+number.trk{_})
 ****** If user chose Standard, there will be multiple tracks based on track Seq; _*Ex:*_ _IC01.trk,_ _IC02.trk,_ _IC03.trk, etc._
 ****** If user chose Consolidated, there will just be a single track which has audio for entire Disc/Side; _*Ex:* IC01.trk_
 ***** Below files are all unique per Disc/Side...do we need a Misc Files folder?
 ***** CDTEXT.BIN (optional, based on user input)
 ***** DDPID
 ***** DDPMS (contents will differ depending on whether user selected Native, AOMA-generated or NO CD Text, and what audio option was chosen. This needs to be paid attention to, to make sure its coming correctly)
 ***** DDPPQ
 ***** QCNOTES.txt (optional, based on user input)
 **** _*Supp. info:*_ [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/] 
 **** STAGE test product: 88691922552 (single side/disc), 19075801322 (multi-disc)
 * Generate/include md5 hashes with each file, with same exact naming (extension excluded, as it will .md5; BE to check with AMP if they already generate these; *_Ex:_* abc.pdf and abc.pdf.md5)
 * Only CT being sent is 4202; need to figure out if other CTs for audio DDPs that are sent to plants are still a viable use case
 * Generate XML for DMD, and perform zipping as well; Vijay and Rohit discussed and agreed to this
 * Email notification (legacy examples below, will post)

 

 

-+_When product is also linked to a PKGF and/or Cover_+-

-WHEN QC Notes are not approved for DDP master-
-THEN display warning message (will post one from below legacy)-
 * -STAGE test product: {*}88697506582{*}; master *835050*-
 * -Check if it blocks the Export or not; if it doesn't, this is just a UI message that needs to be shown as a warning. If it DOES block it, BE work will be involved and it will be a validation-

-WHEN product is also linked to DDP and/or Cover master-
-THEN display PKGF choices at bottom, after either of the above-

-Legacy sent different jobs for each master type; A3 Export just sends 1 job-

 

 

+*Notes:*+

Descriptor can be excluded, along with manifest ({_}*10/02/2024*{_})

Manu to review output in Ci to see if this is workable (will get user's help); Manuela did a direct upload to Ci, can check that with user.

No CT selection in legacy; 4202 will be the only CT. BUT 4202 is not added to Direct Mail Delivery yet; this phases DMD out as a destination...we'll just do Ci first

Legacy naming conventions/flow noted for Sonopress (in Aspera)
 * AOMAEXPORT_Job ID
 * ---> Product No_Product Artist_Product Title_PACKAGEGRAPHIC_Job ID (When CFO is selected for Export)

 * ---> GFX_Master ID (WHEN CFO is NOT selected for Export)
 ** ---> PRESS_READY (Reader Spread files show automatically, not in a folder)
 *** Source filename of pdf
 *** STAGE test job 39891

Other plants which use packager _*ISCGraphics*_
 # {-}Manufacturing Plant - Australia - Technicolor - Graphics [SFTP]{-}; _*this is no longer valid, so we decommissioned immediately*_

Only one plant uses packager _*ISCGraphicsDropoff*_

Other plants which use packager _*GenericSingleFolderGraphicsPlant*_ (these are all CES destinations though, so I don't know if we want to look to consolidate these just yet)

column369:
12/May/25 11:18 AM;stef003;*File Naming and Structure*

File naming should be preserved as-is.
Each side (e.g., disc, part) should be placed in a separate folder within the export.

Specify the naming convention for the parent folder in the export.

*QCNotes File*

A QCNotes.txt file should be generated automatically (similar to the one sent as an email attachment).
This file should be created on-the-fly during the ZIP upload process.

*CDTEXT.BIN File*

Generate the CDTEXT.BIN file on-the-fly if the option is selected.
{color:#ff8b00}Define the required content for this file (specify the format and data to include).{color}

*DDPMS File Handling*

Update the DDPMS file with new information (do not modify the original; create a copy).
The updated DDPMS file can be downloaded locally, modified, and then uploaded into the ZIP.
ZIP Upload Process

*The ZIP upload should only begin after:*

Media conversion is complete - Consolidated track creation is finished.
The DDPMS file has been updated.
{color:#ff8b00}Determine how MD5 hashes should be calculated for the updated files.{color}

*Consolidated Export*

{color:#ff8b00}Define the process for consolidated export.{color}

*AMP DMD File Storage*

Files such as DDPPQ, DDPMS, DDPID, TRK, CDTEXT, JPQ, and DAT are stored as separate S3 objects (one per asset).
Existing methods for fetching S3 object URLs can be used.
Note: TRK files are at the track level, miscellaneous files are at the component level.

{color:#ff8b00}Find out how to export EMD files... How it is stored in AMP?{color}

*Examples*

19075801322: Multiple discs (stage)
88843066762: CD text present (stage)
74321178512: EMD (stage);;;

column1: AOMA3 Linking - To link multiple masters in one action - Track Master Linking
column27:
*User Story:* Currently a user is only able to commit one master type at a time via the track linking interface. The ability to multi-select and commit multiple track master links in one step has been requested.  This will increase efficiency and cut down on the time to link from one product to another significantly. 

*Acceptance Criteria:* 
In track linking interface we should make Audio and Video master types multi select i.e we should provide check boxes against each master type.

!image-2025-06-17-22-15-27-452.png|width=227,height=238!
Once user selects one or more master type and hit fetch masters we should display each master type selected in the order of Prod Seq and Prod Track Seq.

One *Master Type* col along with a filter dropdown at column level (to filter and apply the master types) should be added in between Master Track Seq col and Master Icons col. 

Example: Product has 1 side 4 tracks and user selected Wav 16 Bit + DDP, WAV 24 Bit (44.1kHz) and Dolby Atmos 

then we should show total 12 tracks with Row 1 displaying Track 1 and Wav 16 Bit +DDP info, Row 2 displaying Track 1 and Wav 24 Bit (44.1 kHz), Row 3 displaying Track 1 and Dolby Atmos and Row 4 displaying Track 2 and Wav 16 Bit +DDP info and so on.... ( this order applies even a particular combination does not fetch any master level info and no ISRC match is found)

Filter dropdown at Master Type col will be used if user wants to see filtered view of only particular master type.
!image-2025-06-17-22-15-51-064.png|width=498,height=130!




If when multiple masters are linked in one action and we need to consolidate all the error(s) to show in one single modal window and if no errors popped up then users are redirected to warnings modal window. 

*Warnings*  *Display:* 

 We shall display warnings in one single with extended modal window. 

The modal window will be opened in collapsed version with all the masters to show the master level warnings in separate sections that are selected to commit the link along with one section for general warnings with showing indicators of warning.
