column27:
*Description:*
**

With August Build we have released the GIF submission for pseudo video creation.

Currently AOMA allows only digital video track products with footage type "Still Pseudo video" to be submitted for auto-pseudo generation. GIF submitted images have motion, so the appropriate footage type is "Enhance Pseudo video" -

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Update " Still Pseudo video" footage type for jpeg only based auto-pseudo video submission.

Enable "Enhance Pseudo video"  footage type for gif only based auto-pseudo submission.  

*Test:*

Test if "Enhance Pseudo video"  footage type digital video track product is allowed for Pseudo video submission by using gif only but not using jpeg file

Test if "Still Pseudo video"  footage type digital video track product is allowed for Pseudo video submission by using jpeg only but not using gif

Regression test for both Gif and Jpeg submission if the pseudo video is successfully created and along with Auto locked and Auto approval cases.

[AMEBA] Get events for record update in tickets table
column27:
Hi [~gvamsik]

As discussed, We are building a functionality in AOMA3 to process the physical exports to manufacturing plant (CES).
To achieve this, we need to receive update events from the tickets table. We need to know when the status of a ticket changes to TicketStatus.Of.INPROGRESS.
Columns are:
ticket_ky
ticket_type
ticket_status
data
message
client_system_id

The app that will access this event is aoma-export-service. Roles are below:
DEV: arn:aws:iam::969009837416:role/aomad-eks-ameba-dev-ns-aoma3-dev-sa-aoma-export-service-role

STAGE: arn:aws:iam::969009837416:role/ameba-dev-ns-aoma3-stage-sa-aoma-export-service-role

PROD: arn:aws:iam::613871678587:role/aomap-ms-ns-aoma3-sa-aoma-export-service-role

Regards,
Himanshu

column1: To support VCA (Video Custom Art - New Master) on AOMA 3
column27:
Things to consider when introducing VCA on AOMA 3:
 # Details pages (display, dimensions, etc. on Associated Masters section)
 # QC notes (mimics VSC?)
 # Search icon inclusion 
 # Download capability from AMP - Naming conventions for Short and Long name
 # Edit VCA, Upload VCA and Download VCA on left thumbnail as VCA
 # Linking and linking validations (one important use case to consider is what should happen when a VSC already linked to product? What types of product configurations should allow a VCA? Should only be Video...but maybe Combo products?
 # Export (display in modal, any specific workflow like PKGFs with CES regions, can Delivery accept it, which destinations, etc)

Consider EOM messaging for features, AMP storage, Delivery for Export, potential CloudOps involvement? etc

column1: [UI]: VCA - Export
Pre Populate Product IDs for Pseudo Video submission using related audio ISRC
column27:
*User Story:* 

As a user I want to  to create a Pseudo video using AOMA with ease by pre populating the product numbers of digital video track based on selected audio track related audio ISRC

*Description:* 

Currently, AOMA pseudo video interface has to be manually updated with digital video track products after selecting the Audio tracks and cover image from details page

*Acceptance Criteria:*

When the user navigates to the Pseudo interface via the product details page they  will select cover and all the tracks of audio requires for pseudo video creation and then click the pseudo video button to open the interface with the cover art and audio from that product prepopulated. 

We should use related audio ISRC concept here to auto populate the digital video track products where those video track product ISRCS relates to audio track by related audio ISRC

On clicking the pseudo video button from the details interface the pseudo video create interface loads including suggested product IDs which should be review-able/modifiable by the user before committing/submitting.

We should provide give the ability to change the product number if user wants and also we should give ability to navigate quickly to details page of the product using product number hyperlinks that are pre populated.

*Test Cases:*
General regression testing should be conducted for Pseudo video creation using Source audio and source cover or upload of jpeg and gif

Auto QC lock and Auto QC approval should also be tested for jpeg and gif uploads.

Pseudo Video created using .gif source should undergo registration using UST to create SFV and VSC master to create video product of footage type Pseudo video.

Looping of the gif should be entirely through out the audio duration in the resulting video.

VSC should extracts from first frame of the gif.

Video product should auto populate based on Video ISRC that corresponds to related audio ISRC  when the audio track is selected for PV creation.

column1: Explicit Indicators - Inherit at Master Level
column27:
*Applicable Masters:*

Stereo Audio (16 Bit, 24 Bit and vinyl), Immersive, SFV, CC. 

*Description:*

*Request from business is to show explicit indicators at track level on master details page, QC Notes and Associated master section interface.*

Currently the indicator is not inherited at the master level and as a result, it is not viewable in the A3 master details or Qc notes interfaces as these leverage master data and are master level vs. product level.  

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

To add the explicit indicator at the master level, upon association with product data (similar to ISRC inheritance). 
 * A3 product Details 
 * A3 Master Details 
 * QC Notes 

Que for GMP? Shall we consider regs thru Simple & direct upload or only UST?

Phase 1- UST regs are inheriting (potentially do it for everything) - Stereo Audio, SFV, VSC,  VCA and Immersive and displaying the indicator wherever we have the ISRC - like at Assoc master section, Master details page, QC Notes and mismatches of explicit indicators should be shown on products tracks tab

Phase 2 - Backfill for all the prodcuts ( can be done in phases) - This should be done as 2nd phase and ahead of linking interface cz we need to have these info for older products in order to support when linking is performed.

Phase 3 -  Product linking - anytime we fetch pretty similar to duration and isrc mismatches are shown and linking inheritance - master does not have E and product has E then it inherits 

Phase 4 - Track master edit - allows you to change the explicit/non-explicit and with warnings similar to ISRc edit

column1: [UI] AOMA UI restriction on gif submission for Pseudo Video
column27:
*User Story:* 

As a user I want to upload a .gif image to create a Pseudo video using AOMA.

*Description:* 

Currently, AOMA pseudo video supports image as source or uploads of type .jpg or .jpeg and .gif 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
UI should allow .gif file with following restrictions:
If file type gif is submitted
 * Image dimensions must be 1920x1080 or 1080x1080
 * Framerate must be 25fps 
 * File size should not exceed 400mb

Other UI validations we already have for gif based submission are:

No dots and spaces inside the file name and height validation 

CT id for accepting non gif file: 2067

CT id for accepting .gif file: 4205

 

*IMP:* Should loop in GMP and users like Victor while changes in stage before we push changes to prod.

*Test Cases:*
General regression testing should be conducted for Pseudo video creation using Source audio and source cover or upload of cover

Auto QC lock and Auto QC approval should also be tested for jpeg and gif uploads.

Pseudo Video created using .gif source should undergo registration using UST to create SFV and VSC master under digital video track of footage type "Enhanced Pseudo Video"

Pseudo Video created using .jpeg source should undergo registration using UST to create SFV and VSC master under digital video track of footage type "Still Pseudo Video"

Looping of the gif should be entirely through out the audio duration in the resulting video.

Should test all the above restrictions from Pseudo Video UI submissions of a gif file.

VSC should extracts from first frame of the gif.

column1: [UI] Explicit Indicators - Display on Linking interface and Warnings
Explicit Indicators - Display on Linking interface and Warnings
column27:
AMEBA team is working to inherit explicit indicators flag to track level when master is linked for first time to a product. AOMA should work on displaying indicators and mismatch info on during linking on linking interfaces (full and track linking interfaces) and on warning modal window same as ISRC.

*Applicable Masters:* 

Stereo Audio Wav Master (16 Bit, 24 Bit and Vinyls)

Immersive Master (Quad, 5.1, 7.1, Dolby, 360 RA).

Short Form Video Master

Closed Caption Master (SCC and TTML)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

BE will pass below lyric indicator values for the track master when explicit flag is True or false but not null

Explicit

Clean

Unknown

So based on the values to the version values:

When we try fetch and commit link for above masters we should display the information regarding E and EMismatch indicator next to product title as we do it products tracks tab as per below cases:

Case 1:

If both product track and track master is Explicit we display E indicator next to title text on track level - No warning will be displayed on modal window

Case 2:

If both product track and track master is clean or unknown we do not display any badge or E indicator on linking interface - No warning will be displayed on modal window

Case 3:

If explicit flag  on the track master and the product track is not matched then we show the show the EMismatch indicator with hover over pop up showing version of product track and track master and in the warning modal window in the section of duration and ISRC mismatches another column should be added to show the tracks which has Explicit version mismatch.

Like example below when Product Track is Clean and Track master is explicit. 

!image-2025-08-27-22-25-18-359.png|width=180,height=65!

example when product track is Unknown and Track master is explicit.

!image-2025-09-01-21-44-30-286.png|width=254,height=79!

 

*Color note from Image above:*
Sky blue color is used here but same color should be maintained as compared to how we have for Duration mismatches (Dark Blue)

column1: AOMA 3 Explicit Indicators - Display of indicators and mismatches (CC) and change the format of mismatches display
column27:
*Applicable Masters:* Closed Captions (SCC and TTML) and 360 RA

(360 RA was already implemented this change with earlier ticket in Aug build but BE changes (UST inheritance part was not available at that time and hence our display of indicators and mismatches was not showing anything for 360 - Matt C will push BE changes for Sept build so if we need to do any change after his push then 360 RA will also be in scope for this one)

Hence this ticket will be Dependent upon UST team support inheriting explicit indicators on to track level for SCC, TTML.

Also since now BE is gonna pass the values of lyric indicator version to the UI. UI should consider those values to display the E and Emismatch indicators on various pages(Products tab, Associated master section, QC Notes and Master details page) as per below mentioned logic for all the below master in scope to maintain the consistency in logic for all the masters that were done previously in Aug build.

Stereo Audio Wav Master (16 Bit, 24 Bit and Vinyls)

Immersive Master (Quad, 5.1, 7.1, Dolby, 360 RA).

Short Form Video Master

Closed Caption Master (SCC and TTML)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

BE will pass below lyric indicator values for the track master when explicit flag is True or false but not null

Explicit

Clean

Unknown

 

and Currently the explicit mismatch badge should show hover over message as described/displayed (similar pop over message as we have for duration mismatches) instead of hover messages in black/gray boxes. 

This should be again applied to all the masters in scope:

So for SFV, Immersive, Stereo Audio (16, 24 and Vinyl's) and including CC (SCC and TTML).

 
 * Explicit indicators should be displayed at track master level on
 ** Associated master section
 ** Master details page
 * Explicit indicator mismatches should be displayed on products tab and QC notes interface by following below mentioned cases:
 ** QC noter interface
 *** When QC notes is accessed through UST or Assoc master section we should show the Explicit mismatches based underlying product
 *** When QC notes is accessed through master details page E indicator alone is fine to display for the track master
 ** Products tab (follow the below cases)

 

Case 1:

If both product track and track master is Explicit we display E indicator next to title text on track level on products tab and associated master section.

Case 2:

If both product track and track master is clean or unknown we do not display anything.

Case 3:

If lyric indicator values on the track master and the product track is not matched then we show the show the EMismatch indicator with hover over pop up showing version of product track and track master on products tab.

Like example below when Product Track is Clean and Track master is explicit. 

!image-2025-09-01-22-00-25-590.png|width=240,height=82!

example when product track is Unknown and Track master is explicit.

!image-2025-09-01-22-00-45-234.png|width=306,height=94!

 

 

Pleas note to not to forget about disregarding the check when explicit flag is null at track master level.

UI should consider those values to display the E and Emismatch indicators on various pages(Products tab, Associated master section, QC Notes and Master details page) as per below mentioned logic for all the below master in scope to maintain the consistency in logic for all the masters that were done previously in Aug build.

Stereo Audio Wav Master (16 Bit, 24 Bit and Vinyls)

Immersive Master (Quad, 5.1, 7.1, Dolby, 360 RA).

Short Form Video Master

Closed Caption Master (SCC and TTML)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

BE will pass below lyric indicator values for the track master when explicit flag is True or false but not null

Explicit

Clean

Unknown

 

and Currently the explicit mismatch badge should show hover over message as described/displayed (similar pop over message as we have for duration mismatches) instead of hover messages in black/gray boxes. 

This should be again applied to all the masters in scope:

So for SFV, Immersive, Stereo Audio (16, 24 and Vinyl's) and including CC (SCC and TTML).

 
 * Explicit indicators should be displayed at track master level on
 ** Associated master section
 ** Master details page
 * Explicit indicator mismatches should be displayed on products tab and QC notes interface by following below mentioned cases:
 ** QC noter interface
 *** When QC notes is accessed through UST or Assoc master section we should show the Explicit mismatches based underlying product
 *** When QC notes is accessed through master details page E indicator alone is fine to display for the track master
 ** Products tab (follow the below cases)

 

*Case 1:*

If both product track and track master is Explicit we display E indicator next to title text on track level on products tab and associated master section.{*}>>PASS{*}

column1: [BE] To support Pseudo video registration of Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD)
column27:
*Description:*
Currently we do not support PV registration for Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD) . We support for all Virtual Track masters and we cannot support this one for any Virtual Side Vinyl masters.

*Applicable Masters:*
Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

To support Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD) for PV generation.

It should display Virtual master id with side and track seq listed. (As discussed it is okay to display the Virtual master id, Side and track seq of virtual master as supposed to display of underlying parent source master id. We display the track title info in the icon for user to understand what audio it is)

*Test cases;*

Create a Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD) with multiple tracks where tracks are created from multiple different parent source masters. Example Track 1 side ! of Virtual master should be from Track 5 of Parent source master (try to jumble up) and create as many virtual tracks as possible in that manner for the virtual master

Now select all the tracks in the virtual master and create multiple Pseudo video products to verify if the correct parent source audio master is mapped to Pseudo video created via Virtual track master.

Standard PV regression test like Auto Lock, Auto Approval and VSC extraction.

column1: [UI] A3 Export/Vinyl: Workspace name and CT usage
column27:
*User story:* Fix secondary workspace name display underneath destination, and also send correct CT.

Vinyl is an audio asset and uses existing audio architecture, so this will require some re-work in the future to differentiate it from "digital" audio masters.

*Pre-conditions:*

User is trying to Export a Vinyl

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Correct workspace name display when Pallas is selected as a destination....will post STAGE examples, as we have made decision to deactivate it in PROD. This issue is intermittent, and not always happening

 * Product where its NOT: [https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/product/88697518417/product/product-tracks?masterId=5693930] 

 

 

Use CT 4202 instead of CT 1 in conversion (this uses existing audio components, so it may be hard to do without first doing re-org mentioned above). This issue is also intermittent, and not always consistent

 * Product where CT 4202 is used: [https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/product/88697796411/product/product-tracks?masterId=5725410]

column1: QC Notes: Immersive & Stereo for the same product/UPC
column27:
'+*User Story 1:* Display related ISRC for Immersive Tracks+
As a user, I want to see the specific immersive related ISRC for each immersive track when I click on the QC Notes section, so that I can verify the correct ISRC information for immersive content.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the Associated Masters section for an stereo/immersive product
*WHEN* I click on the QC Notes button option
*AND* track has both immersive related ISRC and stereo ISRC
*THEN* each track should display the specific immersive related ISRC instead of the stereo ISRC -if the related ISRC is available for that specific immersive track- (crossed out due to AND statement above).

 

+*User Story 2:* Do not display immersive tracks in QC when no Immersive related ISRC is available+
As a user, I want to -see an empty field for related ISRC when an- hide immersive tracks which do not have a corresponding immersive related ISRC, so that I can easily identify which tracks lack the related ISRC.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the Associated Masters tab for an stereo/immersive product
*WHEN* a track does not have a related immersive ISRC
*THEN* -the ISRC field for that track should be empty.- that particular track should not be displayed for QC Note editing (confirmed on GMP call on 6/23)

 

-In addition to above QC changes, display "encoding type" for Atmos on Product Tracks section (example below)- (Determined we can do this later per 9/2 Sprint planning, so scratching this out)
 * -This display should be track-based, not product config-based (per Rohit on 07/08 call)-
 * -This should only show for immersive products-

!image-2025-07-08-12-04-55-872.png|width=932,height=61!

 

+_Per above and below notes, stereo ISRC should NEVER display for an immersive track in QC going forward_+
 * 9/17/2025: Dolby ISRCs should be compared to performance ISRCs, and Stereo ISRCs should be compared to Stereo ones...there should be no overlapping between the 2 from a direct comparison standpoint

 

Lets also test this in UST

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

*{color:#ff0000}Requirements which needs to be checked with Rohit and story needs to be updated:{color}*

{color:#ff0000}If a product has 5 tracks and if only 3 tracks  has related ISRC and if we click on the QC Notes button from one of the immersive master section,{color}

{color:#ff0000} should we display all the 5 tracks and grey out the 2 tracks which does not have the related ISRC or should we only display the 3 tracks which has the related ISRC ?{color}

{color:#00875a}Checked the above with Rohit on 6/4/2025, Rohit asked us to check with Mike, Checked with Mike on 6/4/2025 and Mike said though UST is displaying all the tracks, on the QC notes section we can display only the tracks which has the related ISRC. eg. if a product has 5 tracks and only 2 relates ISRC is available, UST will display all the 5 tracks where only 2 tracks will have the file name & ISRC and the select button enabled but for the remaining 3 tracks it would be greyed out, But on the QC Notes section we should be displaying only the 2 tracks which has the related ISRC {color}

 

{*}Notes From Refinement 6/5/{*}2025

{color:#172b4d}QA needs to get the following test products from prod & stage:{color}
 # {color:#172b4d} album stereo products & corresponding album dolby product{color}
 # digital single stereo products & corresponding single dolby product
 # album stereo products & corresponding dolby product(But only for few tracks)

Jack confirmed on the call that he will get the above 3 products from the DB team for all the scenarios mentioned on the ticket/Excel.

Need to also reach out to EOM team when its ready on stage for end to end testing and we should focus on the following scenario 
|Album Stereo Product |Corresponding Dolby Product (but only for few tracks)|

column374:
19/Sep/25 5:56 PM;jpitzer;Verified in STAGE



+*User Story 1:* Display related ISRC for Immersive Tracks+
As a user, I want to see the specific immersive related ISRC for each immersive track when I click on the QC Notes section, so that I can verify the correct ISRC information for immersive content.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the Associated Masters section for an stereo/immersive product
*WHEN* I click on the QC Notes button option
*AND* track has both immersive related ISRC and stereo ISRC
*THEN* each track should display the specific immersive related ISRC instead of the stereo ISRC -if the related ISRC is available for that specific immersive track- (crossed out due to AND statement above).{*}>>PASS{*}
*Test product - G010001227997Q / 16b master 5737470*

*!image-2025-09-19-11-36-20-299.png|width=817,height=553!*

 

+*User Story 2:* Do not display immersive tracks in QC when no Immersive related ISRC is available+
As a user, I want to -see an empty field for related ISRC when an- hide immersive tracks which do not have a corresponding immersive related ISRC, so that I can easily identify which tracks lack the related ISRC.

*Acceptance Criteria:*
*GIVEN* I am on the Associated Masters tab for an stereo/immersive product
*WHEN* a track does not have a related immersive ISRC
*THEN* -the ISRC field for that track should be empty.- that particular track should not be displayed for QC Note editing (confirmed on GMP call on 6/23){*}>>PASS{*}

!image-2025-09-19-09-30-45-875.png|width=726,height=369!

-In addition to above QC changes, display "encoding type" for Atmos on Product Tracks section (example below)- (Determined we can do this later per 9/2 Sprint planning, so scratching this out)
 * -This display should be track-based, not product config-based (per Rohit on 07/08 call)-
 * -This should only show for immersive products-

!image-2025-07-08-12-04-55-872.png|width=932,height=61!

 

+_Per above and below notes, stereo ISRC should NEVER display for an immersive track in QC going forward_+
 * 9/17/2025: Dolby ISRCs should be compared to performance ISRCs, and Stereo ISRCs should be compared to Stereo ones...there should be no overlapping between the 2 from a direct comparison standpoint{*}>>PASS{*}

 

Lets also test this in UST{*}>>PASS{*} - same behaviors as above in UST for product G0100048961748

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

*{color:#ff0000}Requirements which needs to be checked with Rohit and story needs to be updated:{color}*

{color:#ff0000}If a product has 5 tracks and if only 3 tracks  has related ISRC and if we click on the QC Notes button from one of the immersive master section,{color}

{color:#ff0000} should we display all the 5 tracks and grey out the 2 tracks which does not have the related ISRC or should we only display the 3 tracks which has the related ISRC ?{color}

{color:#00875a}Checked the above with Rohit on 6/4/2025, Rohit asked us to check with Mike, Checked with Mike on 6/4/2025 and Mike said though UST is displaying all the tracks, on the QC notes section we can display only the tracks which has the related ISRC. eg. if a product has 5 tracks and only 2 relates ISRC is available, UST will display all the 5 tracks where only 2 tracks will have the file name & ISRC and the select button enabled but for the remaining 3 tracks it would be greyed out, But on the QC Notes section we should be displaying only the 2 tracks which has the related ISRC{color:#172b4d}*>>PASS*{color}{color}

!image-2025-09-19-09-45-56-924.png|width=726,height=369!

{*}Notes From Refinement 6/5/{*}2025

{color:#172b4d}QA needs to get the following test products from prod & stage:{color}
 # {color:#172b4d} album stereo products & corresponding album dolby product >> {color}G010004840121A / G010004932345P
 # digital single stereo products & corresponding single dolby product >>G010004873888L / G010004931524X
 # album stereo products & corresponding dolby product(But only for few tracks){color:#172b4d}>>G010001227997Q / G010004888963O{color}

Jack confirmed on the call that he will get the above 3 products from the DB team for all the scenarios mentioned on the ticket/Excel.

Need to also reach out to EOM team when its ready on stage for end to end testing and we should focus on the following scenario 
|Album Stereo Product |Corresponding Dolby Product (but only for few tracks)|;;;

column1: Skelton
AOMA 3 Explicit Indicators - Phase 1 - Display of indicators and mismatches for Pseudo Video
column27:
We should also handle the Pseudo Video use case for display mismatches of Explicit Indicators.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Case 1:* 
If the Pseudo Video product or Pseudo video master track is clean, but the source audio track master which is used to generate the pseudo video is explicit then we should display the mismatches on product tab of Pseudo Video product or display E indicator on Pseudo video master track respectively

The tooltip message when we hover over the mismatch badge in this case should clearly say "{*}Pseudo video p{*}{*}roduct track is clean, and the source audio track master used is explicit and hence the mismatch"{*}

*Case 2:*

If the Pseudo Video product track is Explicit is explicit but the source audio track master which is used to generate the pseudo video is clean, we should display the mismatches on products tab of Pseudo Video product

The tooltip message when we hover over the mismatch badge in this case should say "{*}Pseudo video p{*}{*}roduct track is explicit, and the source audio track master used is clean and hence the mismatch"{*}

column1: AOMA pages to support products with high magnitude of tracks (1000+ tracks)
column27:
*User Story:* As an AOMA users we need support to handle with products of high volume of tracks and sides (like 100+ Sides and 1000+tracks) to perform operations like Export and load details pages within sometime potentially with no server timeout error to validate duration and ISRCs.

*Use Case:*
Recently SME Germany team tried to export 19658704682(Product has 70 sides (899 tracks) to manufacturing plant and wanted to perform a recheck of track list in AOMA - (do ISRCs on audio master match with metadata for all tracks etc. on 19658704682. But the Details page seems unable to load due to product of this high magnitude. (DPSA attached)

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
Need to improve the performance of loading A3 details page with all the metadate and tracks information on products track tab and associated master tab such that it will load products of large-scale magnitude. 

*Test Case:*

Test to see if the A3 product details page is loading smoothly (may take some time) for products of high volume of tracks (at least 800+ tracks and 50+ sides) and should be to see ISRC and duration information on details page.

column1: Revise link fetch logic to sort the Master types while performing Track linking.
column27:
*User Story:* As a AOMA user team there were recently some issues faced with a combo product which had incorrect tracks linked and was able to be published and sent to market incorrectly. To mitigate the risk of this happening again we're proposing the following:

 

*Pre - Conditions:* 
 * SFV - QC Lock is a must (regardless of whether or not an actual QC note was entered)
 * Immersive - QC Lock is a must (regardless of whether or not an actual QC note was entered)
 * Stereo Audio (DDP, Wav 16 and Wav 24b) - If the QC notes are entered, QC lock is must However, if the QC notes are not entered, QC lock is not required

*Acceptance Criteria:*

As shown in the image attached add "{*}QC Lock?" column{*} in the table that comes when we click "show all matches" icon beside master.

As shown in the image attached *"Highlight the master in Red both at commit link page and all matches' page if the QC is not locked for SFV and Immersive Master types and for Stereo Audio follow the QC available and lock combination logic and with a info icon beside that red master to see the details. QC Available - Y/N QC Lock - Y/N* 

Logic for Sorting Masters is as follows:

For Track Link Fetch: Use QC lock as first level of sorting for SFV and Immersive and then most recent registration date

For Track Link Fetch: Wav 16/DDP, Wav 16 should be given first preference over DDP (existing behavior), then second level sorting is QC lock / QC not entered at all, and then most recent registration date

For Wav 24b, first level sorting is QC lock / QC not entered at all, and then most recent registration date

 

 

 


Comment for (Sharma, Himanshu ), we should make the sorting as generic as possible for other master types as well e.g. VSC OR CC etc, if they don't have QC lock at all, then secondary sorting should handle the current use case (most recently registered). Discuss with Rohit if needed.
Stage testing for sergi posted tickets

On Commit, there should be a secondary warning for these master types indicating to user that QC notes are not locked 
 * SFV and Immersive audio - Require QC and QC lock - If not locked, on linking, a warning should indicate that the asset is not QC locked and will not be deliverable until locked. (Use this warning message:  {*}Asset is not QC locked and will not be deliverable until locked{*}.) 
 * Stereo Audio - Does not require QC lock except when QC notes exist.  If QC notes exist there should be a similar warning message if not locked. (

column1: Stereo Audio QC Notes changes for WAV16, WAV24, DSD - Modify Workflow for Receiving Track Information for Audio
column27:
*GMP Question(s):* 

+BEFORE IMPLEMENTATION:+ does the EOM messaging flow need to change?
 * 
 ** *For Harshita:* QC Locking in AOMA also affects downstream apps like EOM. When this happens, data is sent to EOM accordingly. When we first implemented immersive, we had to do testing to make sure that flag is being sent right...this required an XSC. This would be primarily testing with Prashant/Manuela, and Minoshi handled this when with immersives.
 ** +_assetAvailability_+ needs to be checked as well
 * Internal review should happen with GMP too, about this requirement (check with Harshita if this is done yet)

 

*Business Value:* As the user I would like to see the information and data for a Track even when the information for a master may be incomplete so that I can provide QC Testing and Notes for a given track without having to depend on other components of a master's availability - currently, I cannot do that. 

 

*Description:* We would like to provide the same workflow process for track level information immersive type masters to the audio masters, namely WAV16, WAV24, and DSD

 

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

Given the user is working with a WAV16, WAV24, or DSD Master type

When there are one or more tracks available for the master

Then the ability to add QC Notes will appear on the track level, like it does for immersive masters
 * Copy AC from immersive tickets here for more specific instructions for dev; or use AOMA3-2245 and AOMA3-2279 as Harshita already made

And these changes should be reflected on UST, so that this information from the Associated Masters Tab is coming in from the individual track level there as well
 * UST has shared component with respect to QC Notes
 * Is UST setting default QC Notes on registration? If so, they need to accomodate this change, and there would be a ticket needed on their side
 * Is WAV/DDP ready in UST? That would impact this as well

 

+BEFORE IMPLEMENTATION:+ does the EOM messaging flow need to change?
 * 
 ** *For Harshita:* QC Locking in AOMA also affects downstream apps like EOM. When this happens, data is sent to EOM accordingly. When we first implemented immersive, we had to do testing to make sure that flag is being sent right...this required an XSC. This would be primarily testing with Prashant/Manuela, and Minoshi handled this when with immersives.
 ** +_assetAvailability_+ needs to be checked as well

 

The QC notes will look like this once modified:

!image-2024-06-20-07-37-35-252.png|width=1140,height=416!

 Note: We can refer to https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AMSE-827 to see all the changes made in order to modify track workflow and provide UI updates

column1: Analysis on A2/legacy AOMA interface usage
column27:
In order to decommission old A2 interfaces, we have to migrate them over to A3 if needed. If not needed, we can simply kill the interface. However, there are no metrics which we can use to help determine which users are interacting with these legacy interfaces, and for what purpose.

Please come up with an idea on how to capture metrics for the following legacy features; what, who, why and how often:
 * AOMA 2 Details Pages
 ** Which all places are still navigating to A2 instead of A3
 * Batch Offerings ({+}_*6/7:*_{+} discussion was had to figure out statistics here, so we can potentially remove this item and/or make it a separate one. We have to figure out the use cases and how/why they are using it)
 * Asset Naming Utility
 ** Product or Master ID Selection (Bar UPC Code is a possible selection on the next screen)
 ** All Master Types can be chosen
 ** Product-master mapping checked
 *** !image-2024-06-16-17-04-06-631.png|width=900,height=19!
 ** !image-2024-06-16-17-02-27-172.png|width=501,height=249!
 * Migrate Assets
 ** Scans folders in user's migration bucket
 ** !image-2024-06-16-17-04-44-554.png|width=492,height=412!
 * Register Assets
 ** I guess UST will replace this; asks for directory but I'm not sure at all what this is; maybe from user's folders (migration/assets)?
 ** !image-2024-06-16-17-05-20-156.png|width=536,height=476!

_*Note:*_ I don't think we want to develop some new interface here to capture this. AMEBA does do report generation, so maybe we can leverage that somehow? No record is captured

column1: SFV Related Download Options - Subtitle
column27:
*Business Value/Description:* We would like to have the HTTP download option available for Closed Captions and Subtitles so that I have support for these asset types. These are needed to download an SFV in UST so we should add these accordingly on the A3 details page.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Given the AOMA user is workings with a Closed Caption or Subtitle type asset in AOMA 3

When they are on the Associated Masters Tab viewing the asset

Then they will be able to download the asset(s) using the HTTP Download option

And this will be available for SCC and TTML Closed Captions

And the download option will also be available for the the Subtitles

And there will be proper tracking of the downloads for the assets using the Master Event History

And there will be email notification sent the user when they initiate a download for the asset they are working with

 

Note: We will not need an Aspera option for downloading the SCC on the A3 side - but we will need Aspera download abilities on the UST side. We may need to modify this in the future.
h3. Examples

*Subtitle*
 - Short product name: SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_Subtitle_EN_Full_Comment.srt
 - Long product name: VictorGarcia_SiTuQuisieras_G0100020182921_01_01_SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_Subtitle_EN_Full_Comment.srt

*Closed-caption SCC*
 - Short product name: SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_SCC.scc
 - Long product name: VictorGarcia_SiTuQuisieras_G0100020182921_01_01_SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_SCC.scc

*Closed-caption TTML*
 - Short product name: SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_TTML.xml
 - Long product name: VictorGarcia_SiTuQuisieras_G0100020182921_01_01_SiTuQuisieras_MXV011000628_TTML.xml

column1: A3 Physical Export: DVD DDP + Blu-ray support for DMD
column27:
*User story:* We will add DVD DDP and Blu-ray master support in Export, to send via Direct Mail Delivery

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on product details page, whose config can link to:
 * DVD DDP
 * Blu-ray
 * Virtual Side audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray?

User has permission AOMA3 EXPORT

*Acceptance Criteria:*

+_UI tasks_+

Destination "{color:#4c9aff}*Direct Mail Delivery (Physical)*{color}" should be displayed in A3 Export; this will be gated by permission AOMA3 EXPORT PHYSICAL SUPPLY CHAIN?
 * Master types to be specified for DB team

Gate A3 Export button behind AOMA3 EXPORT permission and proper view/execute sec group access

In Export interface, display in order (with collapsible side number):
 # Audio DDP
 # DVD DDP
 # Blu-ray

 * Sort files lexi-graphically/alphabetically
 * +*Wireframe*+
 ** PROD product 19075878812; linked to audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray
 ** STAGE product 88985379702 (double-sided CD product)
 ** STAGE product 19075801322 (audio DDP + DVD DDP)
 ** List of viable combinations (at least 2):
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP
 *** Audio DDP + Blu-ray
 *** Audio DDP + Side Virtual audio DDP/DVD DDP/Blu-ray ({_}DB team confirming{_})
 *** DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 *** + track virtual DDP?
 *** Audio DDP + DVD DDP + Blu-ray
 * Mimic Sony Ci display

How to combine with other master types?

WHEN QC Notes exist for audio DDP
AND QC Notes are not approved
THEN gray out QC Notes option?
AND gray out DDP option?
AND display message "QC Notes for DDP master [master No] are not approved"? (Check legacy message)

Add "Do Not include CD Text" option (CD Text options will be radio buttons)

Include CD Text redirection to legacy CD Text interface, for AOMA Generated option? If CD Text already exists, option can display from the get go?

How to display the Native CD Text option? (BE will have to check if this information is available for master, and send something to UI to display option accordingly)

Display both Standard and Consolidated (radio buttons), and default select to Standard?

 

+_BE tasks:_+
 * Handle packager on AOMA side
 ** We are looking to migrate 4 legacy destinations. Check packager _*ISCDirectMaiDropoff*_ for Manufacturing Plant Delivery Mail Pickup (or use same packager as what was used for Sony Ci in AOMA3-2542).
 ** Proposed naming scheme (cannot upload example folders to Jira; BE team can request a OneDrive link for comparison):
 *** *Top parent folder:* productArtist_productTitle_productNo {_}(Ex: InaMuller_IchbindieLive_19075801322{_})
 **** *{color:#4c9aff}For master-centric Export:{color}* Replace above parent folder naming scheme with below PKGF specific sub-folder naming schemes per master; delete above folder so that it doesn't duplicate twice. Keep below folder naming.
 ***** We can include master artist and master title for audio DDP, but what about DVD DDP and Blu-ray?
 **** Since this is Direct Mail Delivery via e-card, this folder should be zipped. Does Promo have to worry about making changes to accept these sorts of files?
 *** *---> DVD DDP specific sub-folder:* DVDDDP_dvdDDPMasterID ({_}Ex: DVDDDP_5619455{_})
 **** *---> Disc/Side folder:* DISC_sideNo ({_}Ex: DISC_01{_})
 ***** Can this be multiple folders based on the number of discs/sides? Will check with DB team
 ***** *---> Layer folder:* LAYER_number ({_}Ex: LAYER_0 and LAYER_01{_})
 ****** Below files all unique/different per Layer
 ****** CONTROL.DAT
 ****** CONTROL.CNT (STAGE product 82876770949; master 5417390)
 ****** DDPID
 ****** DDPMS
 ****** MAIN.DAT
 ****** *_Per 6/20/25 GMP sync-up_* (this was a video call, but other things were discussed): If the user chose "Single Layer" in DU/SU when the DVD DDP was registered, do NOT create a Layer folder; just have the files come as is in the Disc/Side folder. This folder is only applicable when user selected "Dual Layer" via DU/SU. GMP also mentioned to retain 0 and 1 for the Layers.
 ***** STAGE test product: 19075801322 (audio DDP + DVD DDP)
 *** *---> Blu-ray specific sub-folder:* BLURAY_bluRayMasterID ({_}Ex: BLURAY_5616450{_})
 **** *---> Disc/Side folder: DISC_sideNo* ({_}Ex: DISC_02{_})
 ***** This can be multiple discs/sides based on product (PROD product 19075884022, sides 6 and 7)
 ***** Below files are separate by Disc/side
 ***** BDCMF.cmf
 ***** PACL0.dat
 ***** PACL1.dat
 ***** PIC.dat
 ***** UCD.dat
 ***** UD.dat
 ***** FAI.dat
 **** STAGE test product: 88985421862 (5 inch CD Single)
 * Generate/include md5 hashes with each file, with same exact naming (extension excluded, as it will .md5; BE to check with AMP if they already generate these; *_Ex:_* abc.pdf and abc.pdf.md5)
 * Only CT being sent is 4202; need to figure out if other CTs for audio DDPs that are sent to plants are still a viable use case
 * Generate XML for DMD, and perform zipping as well; Vijay and Rohit discussed and agreed to this
 * Email notification (legacy examples below, will post)

 

 

-+_When product is also linked to a PKGF and/or Cover_+-

-WHEN QC Notes are not approved for DDP master-
-THEN display warning message (will post one from below legacy)-
 * -STAGE test product: {*}88697506582{*}; master *835050*-
 * -Check if it blocks the Export or not; if it doesn't, this is just a UI message that needs to be shown as a warning. If it DOES block it, BE work will be involved and it will be a validation-

-WHEN product is also linked to DDP and/or Cover master-
-THEN display PKGF choices at bottom, after either of the above-

-Legacy sent different jobs for each master type; A3 Export just sends 1 job-

 

 

+*Notes:*+

Descriptor can be excluded, along with manifest ({_}*10/02/2024*{_})

Manu to review output in Ci to see if this is workable (will get user's help); Manuela did a direct upload to Ci, can check that with user.

No CT selection in legacy; 4202 will be the only CT. BUT 4202 is not added to Direct Mail Delivery yet; this phases DMD out as a destination...we'll just do Ci first

Legacy naming conventions/flow noted for Sonopress (in Aspera)

 * ---> GFX_Master ID (WHEN CFO is NOT selected for Export)
 ** ---> PRESS_READY (Reader Spread files show automatically, not in a folder)
 *** Source filename of pdf
 *** STAGE test job 39891

Other plants which use packager _*ISCGraphics*_
 # {-}Manufacturing Plant - Australia - Technicolor - Graphics [SFTP]{-}; _*this is no longer valid, so we decommissioned immediately*_

Only one plant uses packager _*ISCGraphicsDropoff*_

Other plants which use packager _*GenericSingleFolderGraphicsPlant*_ (these are all CES destinations though, so I don't know if we want to look to consolidate these just yet)

column1: Details page/Vinyls: Single component download capability (skeleton)
column27:
*User story:* We should add download capability for Vinyl masters. Vinyls are unique in that tracks can be associated with a single component/side...but the streaming audio are those tracks all stitched together as one single audio file. This single audio file is what should be downloadable.

Full master download capability is already handled in AOMA3-2676, so this will just be for single component functionality.

*Pre-conditions:*

Vinyl WAV master is linked to product (16 or 24 bit)

-Virtual Side master also?- (Per Rithwik's report, there is no PROD example where virtual Vinyl exists)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

STAGE product 88697038001 (multi-Component, multi-Side)
h3. Single Component download (no .zip capability)

WHEN user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT
AND Vinyl master is linked to product
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display Download icon next to Vinyl

!image-2025-05-21-16-04-09-340.png|width=548,height=166!

Or Download button (would be more visible)...user would have to select checkboxes (might conflict with below)

!image-2025-05-21-16-06-13-298.png|width=548,height=166!

 

Output here should be the single component wav file, unzipped

`````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````
h3. -Multi-component download-

-WHEN user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT-
-AND Vinyl master is linked to product-
-AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group-
-AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})-
-THEN display Download All and Download Selected buttons in dark gray header-

!image-2025-06-05-18-11-26-339.png|width=628,height=169!

 

-Output here will be one folder containing files, in zipped format-

```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````
h3. Unapproved flow

WHEN master is unapproved
AND user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT UNAPPROVED MASTER
AND user has selected a master from Associated Masters section
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display single component download next to component(s)
AND the "Download All (.zip)" and "Download Selected (.zip)" buttons in dark gray header, next to master ID, with cloud icon
 * Make sure actual output is downloaded and verified

 

-WHEN user clicks "Download All"-
-THEN all master's listed files should be downloaded in a single .zip folder-
 * -*{color:#de350b}User should not need to check any box for this{color}*-

 

-WHEN user checks a folder, or file, or component-
-AND user clicks "Download Selected"-
-THEN download selected files in a single .zip folder-
 * -Is it possible to have logic where clicking any of the download icons and buttons will just download selected files? That way user won't have to scroll for a 100+ track product-
 * -Button should be grayed out until a file, component or folder is selected-

```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````````

Just add Reason text prompt...No short or long name options? No Aspera option? If we go with naming options, see below AC

 

WHEN user clicks Download
THEN whole Component/Side is downloaded, with all associated tracks stitched together as one audio file
 * File-naming scheme:
 ** Short: Component[No]_Side[Letter]_parentMasterID.format
 *** ComponentMasterID needed?
 ** Long: artistName_productTitle_productNo_parentMasterID_Component[No]_Side[Letter]_VWAV[16 or 24]B.format
 *** ComponentMasterID needed?
 ** How would we get Side Letter, if we are displaying this on the Associated Masters Section? It does not display there, as you see in above screenshots. Would we have to add it on the Product tab? There are also different file-naming conventions between Product and Master.
 ** Are we doing preview download along with source download? If so, what CT needs to be used? As an example, SFV clip downloads use CTs

 

Master Event History and Email notification should remain as on other implemented master types.

 

Anything to do with AMP? They have Vinyl metadata, but they do not send anything

column1: A3 to send kafka events to AMEBA for QC modification
column27:
As part of moving away from Debezium and also moving EOM to Kafka, we need AOMA3 to send kafka event to ameba-events topics for any qc modification.

Topic Name : ameba-events 
 

Below one is the sample message:
{code:java}
{
  "masterId": 26227643, -- Parent Master id
  "productNumber": null,
  "assetMasterId": 26227645,  ( will be null for audios )
  "assetUploadId":,
  "assetId": ,
  "action": "UPDATE",
  "topic": "MASTER",
  "correlationId": "QCModified_ParentMaster-26227643_1736167544164",
  "priority": "LOW"
}
{code}

column1: [DB] Edit queries to add qc entered and qc lock flag
column27:
Hi, 

We need to add two additional information in the below queries isQcEntered(qc details are updated) and isQcLocked(QC notes are locked) to the below 2 queries:

*+QUERY 1:+*

SELECT DISTINCT ON (atm.isrc_id)
         atm.isrc_id AS isrcId,
         atm.track_master_nm AS trackMasterNm,
         atm.master_track_sequence AS masterTrackSequence,
         prnt_comp_hier.parent_master_id AS parentMasterId,
         comp_track_hier.child_master_id AS trackMasterId,
         tm.master_type_id AS trackMasterTypeId,
         prnt_comp_hier.child_order AS sideNumber,
         sr.sample_rate_nm AS sampleRateName,
         mct.master_classification_type_id AS masterClassificationTypeId,
         arj.registration_end_time,
         mt.master_type_id AS masterTypeId,
         count(1) over (partition by atm.isrc_id) AS allMasterCount
    FROM audio_track_masters atm
     JOIN masters tm ON tm.master_id=atm.master_id
     JOIN master_hierarchies comp_track_hier ON comp_track_hier.child_master_id=atm.master_id
     JOIN master_hierarchies prnt_comp_hier ON prnt_comp_hier.child_master_id=comp_track_hier.parent_master_id
     JOIN asset_registration_jobs arj ON arj.master_id=prnt_comp_hier.parent_master_id
     JOIN masters pm ON pm.master_id=arj.master_id
     JOIN master_types mt ON mt.master_type_id=pm.master_type_id
     LEFT JOIN sample_rates sr ON sr.sample_rate_id=pm.sample_rate_id
     LEFT JOIN master_classifications mc ON mc.master_id=tm.master_id
     LEFT JOIN master_classification_types mct ON mct.master_classification_type_id=mc.master_classification_type_id
    WHERE atm.isrc_id in (?1)
      AND mt.master_type_id in (?2)
      AND arj.registration_status_id = 4
      AND exists (SELECT 1 FROM all_assets aa WHERE aa.master_id = atm.master_id AND aa.asset_sub_type_id IN (?3))
      AND (sr.sample_rate_id IS NULL OR sr.sample_rate_nm = ?4)
      AND (mct.master_classification_type_id IS NULL OR mct.master_classification_type_id IN (?5))
    ORDER BY
      atm.isrc_id, mt.master_type_id DESC, arj.registration_end_time DESC

*+QUERY 2:+*

  select audioTrackMaster.isrcId as isrcId, audioTrackMaster.trackMasterNm as trackMasterNm, audioTrackMaster.masterTrackSequence as masterTrackSequence, parentMaster.masterId as parentMasterId,masterType.masterTypeId as parentMasterTypeId, trackMaster.masterId as trackMasterId, trackMaster.masterType.masterTypeId as trackMasterTypeId,
      parentMasterHierarhy.childOrder as sideNumber, sr.sampleRateName as sampleRateName, mc.masterClassificationType.masterClassificationTypeId as masterClassificationTypeId, assetRegistrationJob.registrationEndTime as assetRegistrationEndTime, assetRegistrationJob.registrationUser.userName as assetRegisteredBy
        from AudioTrackMaster audioTrackMaster
        join MasterV1 trackMaster on trackMaster.masterId = audioTrackMaster.masterId
        join MasterHierarchy componentMasterHierarhy on componentMasterHierarhy.childMaster.masterId = audioTrackMaster.masterId
        join MasterHierarchy parentMasterHierarhy on parentMasterHierarhy.childMaster.masterId = componentMasterHierarhy.parentMaster.masterId
      join AssetRegistrationJob assetRegistrationJob on assetRegistrationJob.master.masterId = parentMasterHierarhy.parentMaster.masterId
        join MasterV1 parentMaster on parentMaster.masterId = assetRegistrationJob.master.masterId
      join parentMaster.masterType as masterType
      left join SampleRate sr on sr.sampleRateId = parentMaster.sampleRate.sampleRateId
        left join MasterClassification mc on mc.master.masterId = trackMaster.masterId
        left join MasterClassificationType mcf on mcf.masterClassificationTypeId = mc.masterClassificationType.masterClassificationTypeId
        where audioTrackMaster.isrcId in :isrcIds
      and masterType.masterTypeId in :masterTypeIds
      and assetRegistrationJob.registrationStatus.registrationStatusId = 4
      and exists (SELECT 1 FROM Asset asset WHERE asset.master.masterId = audioTrackMaster.masterId
      AND asset.assetSubTypeId IN :assetSubTypeIds)
      AND (sr.sampleRateId IS NULL OR sr.sampleRateName = :sampleRateName)
       AND (mcf.masterClassificationTypeId IS NULL OR mcf.masterClassificationTypeId IN :masterClassificationTypeIds)
     ORDER BY
       audioTrackMaster.isrcId, masterType.masterTypeId DESC, assetRegistrationJob.registrationEndTime DESC

*Note: This query is used for both stereo and immersive masters, so the qc info for stereo masters will come from parent master qc details and for immersive masters it will come from track master qc details.*

Regards,
Himanshu

column1: Details page: Modify canExportProduct and sec group logic for A2 Export button display
column27:
*User story:* _canExportProduct_ variable logic needs to be refactored. Logic for the Export button has existed for a while, but after discussion today, we should refactor this somewhat, for BOTH the A2 and A3 Export buttons. This ticket will deal with the A2 button, and the A3 one will be in a separate ticket.
 * This is pure UI change as BE is already passing _canExportProduct_ variable

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user has SG execute access for master
THEN display A2 Export button

WHEN user doesn't have SG execute access for master
THEN do not display A2 Export button

WHEN canExportProduct = true
THEN system can bypass security group checks
AND display A2 Export button
AND user is allowed to Export
 * *_Do we need a use case for WHEN canExportProduct = false?_*

WHEN masters are empty
THEN do not display A2 Export button

WHEN master is unapproved
AND user doesn't have AOMA3_EXPORT_UNAPPROVED_MASTER permission
THEN do not display A2 Export button

WHEN master is unapproved
AND user has AOMA3_EXPORT_UNAPPROVED_MASTER permission
THEN display A2 Export button

 

+*_Pre-release specific:_*+
WHEN user has permission EXPORT AUDIO PRE RELEASE
AND user has pre-release execute access for security group
AND user is on Product tab of pre-release product
THEN display A2 Export button

WHEN user does not have above permission
OR user does not have pre-release execute access
AND user is on Product tab of pre-release product
THEN do not display A2 Export button

column1: [BE] A3 Export: Include pause data for DDP to WAV conversions
column27:
*User story:* In A2 Export, when a user was exporting DDP to My AOMA Files/Ci workspaces with a WAV format selected for conversion, there was no lag/pause (2 sec of silence) added at the start of the exported audio track. In A3 Export, we need to send this pause data accordingly so that DSRV knows to exclude it from the track.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User has selected "WAV-1" as a CT, in Ci Export
 * -We don't have WAV conversions in Promo Export right?-

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-Read data for selected DDP track from DDP Descriptor Editor interface for when to start and end a DDP track; send these times in DSRV schema for the Export job
 * Ex of how a product looks when loaded in interface:
 * !image-2023-10-08-17-44-47-575.png|width=498,height=234!

-WHEN a user exports a DDP track
THEN send start time for DDP track in DSRV schema, as time indicated when "idx" column is equal to "01" for that same track number ("trk" column)

-WHEN a user exports a DDP track
THEN send end time for DDP track in DSRV schema, as time indicated for start time of next track
 * *Ex:* end time of track 1 ("trk" = 01) will be start time of track 2 ("trk" = 02) which is 4:51:54
 * "idx" column can be either 00 or 01; take into account which ever comes first

   "clipping":"custom", => Arvato MC Prod (https://mcapi.smecloudops.com/api/conversion/metadata/1)

We should first test with our changes alone and without making any changes to MC CTs. However, if our changes don't fix the issue, we should review MC potential change together.;;;

column1: [BE] Get rid of duplication client API whenever need to add them to the new services
column27:
Right now if our new service requires access to the AMP, MC, or other services, we need to implement logic, that will request data from there. But we already have it in other services like GPS, or UST. Need to remove this code duplication and time-wasting process.

 

Actions to do:
 * Create a new repository on GitHub, where we will store API clients of other services
 * Create a modular project, where each module is a client for a specific service (AMP, MC)
 * Use Feign as a client to call the API
 * Make config with Auth automatically, when the token expired
 * Check that it's easy to run (steps to run)
 ** Add dependency
 ** Add bean
 ** Use it
 * Make deployment process to Nexus

column1: [BE] Remove master number from territory for PKGF
column27:
Remove master number from territory for PKGF

Divide territory into:
 # Territory Code
 # Territory name
 # Description

Add asset sub type for all assets 

 

select aa.asset_id,ast.asset_sub_type_id, ast.asset_type_id, ast.asset_sub_type_nm, ast.asset_table_nm,m.master_id, mt.master_type_nm,
 aa.thumbnail_graphic_url, aa.screen_res_graphic_url, fp.file_package_path, ff.file_format_nm 
 from all_assets aa, filesets f, file_packages fp, asset_sub_types ast, file_formats ff, master_types mt, masters m
where aa.fileset_id=f.fileset_id 
and f.file_package_id=fp.file_package_id
and  aa.asset_sub_type_id = ast.asset_sub_type_id
and ast.file_format_id=ff.file_format_id
and aa.master_id = m.master_id
and m.master_type_id=mt.master_type_id
--and aa.asset_id=da.asset_id
and aa.master_id in (select child_master_id from master_hierarchies where parent_master_id in(13024788))

column1: [BE] A3 Export to Promo: Truncate filenames when too long
column27:
Exports to Promo system fail when the Filename Path is too long.

Notes by Manu- When a filename is nested in many different folders, the filename can be extended many characters over...a decision needs to be made what to trim, and what a user would want to see. This is causing a lot of problems, failures on DPSAs on the legacy Export side, so this needs to be taken care of in A3 Export as well. Promo has a limit of 256 characters, but they do not care about the filename char length at all.

 

DPSA-28150 for reference.

 

Too long is estimated at 100 characters.

column1: [BE] Expose Endpoint for Parent Master Level Lock for UST bulk script
column27:
*Desc:*

*Add Lock Support for just passing parentMaster id (not including track array)*

As discussed over a call UST using a bulk script to import/lock qc notes by calling AOMA3 endpoints. In order to not bloat the script with db looksup for trackMasters can AOMA3 expose an new endpoint to for locking qcNotes that just takes in a parent master and then proceeds to lock the child track masters.

*Add Support for importQCNotes of track to track master*

Also for the UST bulk script, we need a new endpoint to import qcNotes via trackMaster instead of parentMaster. It should  behave the same as the existing importQcNotes call but be based on trackMaster instead.

Note:
 * If source/dest master is not a track fail it for the import.
 * We should only allow immersive to immersive

column1: [DB] ISRC Backfill for auto-fetch track linking support
column27:
Hi DB team,

AOMA has been developing a new track linking function that auto-fetches available masters for a give ISRC and mater type.

As part of the phase 1, the following masters are in scope:
 * DDP
 * 16 WAV bit
 * 24 WAV bit

The key to success of this auto fetch feature is the correctness of the backend data especially the ISRC at track master level.

Can you please generate a report for the above mentioned masters that have registered assets but the ISRC on track master level does not match any of the associated product tracks.

e.g. If wav 16b master has 5 sub track level masters with registered assets:

TM 1 -> ISRC: XYZ1 (Linked to Product 1 and Product 2 with same ISRC on product track level)

TM2 -> ISRC: XYZ2 (Linked to Product 1 and Product 2 with same ISRC on product track level)

TM3 -> ISRC: XYZ3 (Linked to Product 1 and Product 2 with same ISRC on product track level)

TM4 -> ISRC: XYZ4 (Linked to Product 1 with same ISRC ABC1 and Product 2 with ISRC ABC2 on product track level)

TM5 -> ISRC: Null (Linked to Product 1 and Product 2 with same ISRC: XYZ5 on product track level)

For the case above, this report should have the following for TM4 and TM5

Track Master Id

Track Master Title

Asset Duration

Track Master ISRC

Product Track Link Creation Date

Product Track Link Last Updated Date

Product Parent Level Link type (Full master vs Virtual)

Product Track Title

Product Track Duration

Product Track ISRC 

Product Number

Product Title

Product Title Supplement

Product Artist

Product Configuration

Product Release Date

Product Parent Rep Owner

 

Thanks,

Manu

column1: [BE] Implement changes in repository for Reg Job Status pg
column27:
*User story:* In order to have a page start to live-update, we need to modify the *aoma-subscription-api-service* repository for some of the new pages that have been introduced in AOMA 3. We will first start with A3 Registration Job Status page, and then move on to others.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

column1: [BE] A3 Product Event History log visibility update
column27:
*User story:* As a user, I want the A3 Product Event History page's visibility to be centered around a user's assigned security groups and permissions, so that only allowable history will be visible to them.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-Visibility of page data is dependent on the following: 
 * Admin: If user has Admin role assigned to them, all events, products and masters are visible to them
 ** This will be a permission check
 * Pre-release: If a product's publish status is pre-release, AND the user has pre-release view access on a shared security group with said product, that product/row is visible to the user
 * Basic: If the user account shares view access on a shared security group with a product, that product/row is visible to the user
 * Any event a user personally triggered (Links, registrations, etc) is also visible to them (check execute access here)

*NOTE:* If a product has more than one security group assigned to it, a user only needs to have view/execute access on one of those SG's to view it, and navigate to the Product Details page

column1: [BE] Validate manually inputted master data (return Master Duration / ISRC)
column27:
*User story:* When a user inputs a master of their own choosing for A3 Linking, they may not know all the information that comes with it. The system needs to be able to return the relevant fields, and validate accordingly.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User has manually input master data, via Manual Edit button

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-WHEN user enters manually input data for masters
THEN Return master ISRC and duration
 * Required info:
 ** Master ID
 ** Side
 ** Sequence number
 ** Master Type

column1: InfoSec - FND-16346: Cleartext Submission of Sensitive Information
column27:
[https://sonymusic.archer.rsa.com//default.aspx?requestUrl=..%2fGenericContent%2fRecord.aspx%3fid%3d266836%26moduleId%3d167]
|Title:|Cleartext Submission of Sensitive Information| |
| |!https://sonymusic.archer.rsa.com/WebResource.axd?d=YJzswGr0ujKMydwOCyixnOvJoaWuAzOEUSwPGKCzqSLf8CEBhEAh9TnVWzirmn7xerfrmT8YZjiM66LTnjdde6Q-b0-diU-nszGDuP_bwpVfxgB7HLND8o9L2BSyt72AAXQnCe5meN-uNSCopBk-6g2&t=637692353440000000|id=loitem2861hiimg!Finding:|A Basic Auth authorization header is being set and send over the network. Even if the connection is encrypted with TLS there are still some risks.In general, the use of HTTP Basic Auth should not be considered secure, especially for critical systems, since it has a few security flaws, such as: - The password is sent over the wire in base64 encoding (which can be easily converted to plaintext); - The password is sent repeatedly, for each request (larger attack window); - The password is cached by the web browser, at a minimum for the length of the window/process (can be silently reused by any other request to the server, e.g. CSRF); - The password may be stored permanently in the browser, if the user requests (same as previous point, in addition might be stolen by another user on a shared machine);Of these flaws, using SSL only prevents the first, and even with that, SSL only protects until the webserver, any internal routing, server logging, etc, will see the plaintext password.We would advise to review the need and justification of using this authentication method, consider using a more secure method such as OpenID or others.
*AOMA-API*
 
File Name src/web/com/sonymusic/aoma/api/web/AuthFilter.java
Method public ContainerRequest filter(ContainerRequest containerRequest) throws
WebApplicationException {
....
41. String[] lap = BasicAuth.decode(auth);| |
| |!https://sonymusic.archer.rsa.com/WebResource.axd?d=YJzswGr0ujKMydwOCyixnOvJoaWuAzOEUSwPGKCzqSLf8CEBhEAh9TnVWzirmn7xerfrmT8YZjiM66LTnjdde6Q-b0-diU-nszGDuP_bwpVfxgB7HLND8o9L2BSyt72AAXQnCe5meN-uNSCopBk-6g2&t=637692353440000000|id=loitem5166hiimg!Remediation Recommendations:|Basic Auth is not a secure protocol and it shouldn't be used.|

column1: [BE] Shortcut to create new master for different clip points
column27:
User case where users want the same master is linked to multiple products where that master has different clips for each product.

The below is a potential short cut to make that process easier:
 * Prod A linked to master a
 * Prod B linked to master a
 * Create process to update master a clip points in Prod A but not Prod B
 * Process duplicates master a (now master b) and links to Prod A
 * Prod B is linked to master a 
 * Prod A is linked to master b and master a
 * product track link and product track association change (like mobile clip)

column1: Physical Export Analysis: How to handle failed Exports (PKGF)
column27:
Analysis being created to see how to handle failed Exports in new Physical Export flow. DSRV does not clean up their bucket when they have partial data, so we need to figure out how to remove that accordingly.

Per _*01/30/2025*_ discussion, AOMA will handle the clean-up of these buckets

3 buckets:
 * sme-core-aoma-dev-file-storage
 * sme-core-aoma-uat-file-storage
 * sme-core-aoma-prod-file-storage

column1: [BE] Update existing queries to work with big products
column27:
There are some products in AOMA that have 20+ sides and 100+ tracks. With this high load the A3 details page becomes unresponsive as we need to fetch the data for all the tracks when the page loads. To work with these products, we should expand the queries to return data for few sides at a time rather than all. Below are the modifications required in the query:

1. Write a new query 'productSides'. This query takes in product as input and returns the product sides and the product side links for each side. Add necessary columns from both product_sides and product_side_links table.

2. Extend the existing getProductTrackDetails query to take a list of product sides(optional) as input along with product. The query should return all the tracks in case the product sides is empty (current logic remains as is). In case the input contains a list of product sides, then the query should return the track data only for these particular sides.

column1: Skeleton- A3 Physical Export: DVD DDP + Blu-ray Support to Ci
column27:
*User story:* We will look to add DVD DDP and Blu-ray support in A3 Export, for physical masters. We will look to support this in Sony Ci, DMD and MAF in the end. This ticket will handle the Ci workflow

*Acceptance Criteria:*

PROD product 19075878812, linked to audio DDP, DVD DDP and Blu-ray (PKGF too)

STAGE product 19075801322 (audio DDP + DVD DDP)

 

Gate A3 Export button behind *AOMA3 EXPORT* permission and proper view/execute sec group access

Add to destination "{*}{color:#4c9aff}Manufacturing Plant - USA - Sonopress Audio/DVD/Blu-ray (Sony Ci){color}{*}" (this destination is added in the DDP to Ci ticket; this will continue to be gated by permission *AOMA3* {*}EXPORT PHYSICAL SUPPLY CHAIN{*})

_+Legacy interface (A3 interface should replicate this)+_

!image-2025-04-09-22-19-46-096.png|width=589,height=94!

 

Packager used in A2 Export was _ISCAudio;_ although these are Video assets here, we should continue to base this on the same packager we established in the DDP to Ci ticket. Naming/folder structure below:
 * *---> DVD DDP specific sub-folder:* DVDDDP_MasterID ({_}Ex: DVDDDP_5619455{_})
 ** *---> Disc/Side folder:* DISC_sideNo ({_}Ex: DISC_01{_})
 *** This can be multiple folders based on the number of discs/sides; _Ex: PROD product 88697650569_
 *** *---> Layer folder:* LAYER_number ({_}Ex: LAYER_01 and/or LAYER_02{_})
 **** Below files are all unique per Layer
 **** CONTROL.DAT
 **** CONTROL.CNT (STAGE product 82876770949; master 5417390)
 **** DDPID
 **** DDPMS
 **** MAIN.DAT
 **** *_Per 6/20/25 GMP sync-up_* (this was a video call, but other things were discussed): If the user chose "Single Layer" in DU/SU when the DVD DDP was registered, do NOT create a Layer folder; just have the files come as is in the Disc/Side folder. This folder is only applicable when user selected "Dual Layer" via DU/SU. GMP also mentioned to retain 0 and 1 for the Layers.
 * *---> Blu-ray specific sub-folder:* BLURAY_MasterID ({_}Ex: BLURAY_5616450{_})
 ** *---> Disc/Side folder: DISC_sideNo* ({_}Ex: DISC_02{_})
 *** This can be multiple discs/sides based on product (PROD product 19075884022, sides 6 and 7)
 *** Below files are unique per Disc/Side
 *** BDCMF.cmf
 *** PACL0.dat (need to check if this is unique)
 *** PACL1.dat (need to check if this is unique)
 *** PIC.dat
 *** UCD.dat
 *** UD.dat
 *** FAI.dat

 

Will add email example, to see if there is any specific information we need to add that isn't already being caught

For master-centric export, what about DVD DDP and Blu-ray file-naming?

column1: [UI/BE] A3 Export: Mixed Media/Combo products support (DMD)
column27:
{*}User story{*}: To help decommission legacy Export and migrate remaining legacy digital workflow over to A3 Export, we should add the Export functionality on the Mixed Media product details page. We should start with DMD (A duplicate ticket will be made for Sony Ci)

We are testing Master-centric support to Sony Ci (SFV and audio) currently, which makes this ticket less priority.

{+}_02/06/2025_{+}: We have to do this in such a way which includes Media Batch Converter and other destinations:
 * My AOMA Files (AOMA 3)
 * Promo
 * Xpress File (w/o watermark)

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on product details page of type:
 * Digital Combo (multiple media); productConfigId = 58
 * Digital Combo Bundle; productConfigId = 195
 * Digital Combo EP; productConfigId = 194

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT
AND execute access on at least one sec group
THEN display A3 Export button on Product Tab

 

Modal should display both audio and SFV assets; wireframes below:

Example of Combo product linked to a Virtual WAV 24 bit master (audio only), and a virtual WAV 16 bit (both WAV 16 bit and Videos linked)

!image-2025-02-05-18-43-11-236.png|width=572,height=622!

 

Overall modal from Nelson:

!image-2025-02-05-18-41-57-994.png!

 

+Following already displays in Ci/Direct Mail Delivery:+

Display both audio and video clip options

Display collapsible Side, along with Master ID and master type (along with sample rate, if applicable)
 * Allowed linked master types here are:
 ** Virtual Master (Track DDP/WAV 16Bit/Video); masterTypeId = 8
 ** Virtual Master (Track WAV 24Bit/Video) (multiple sample rates); masterTypeId = 41
 ** Virtual Master (Video Track Only); masterTypeId = 42
 ** Virtual Master (Track Video Screen Capture); masterTypeId = 104

Display audio and video tracks with Title and Title Supp, along with Select and Deselect All Tracks options
 * How feasible is it to display the VSC for each Video Track? If its feasible, how easy is it to display a "No VSC"/black image when VSC is not available for a Video Track?

 

Display Graphics Options, both with Downsized and Full Resolution/source copy:
 * WHEN user selects a Video track
THEN enable VSC options
 * WHEN user has not selected a Video track
THEN gray out VSC options and make them unclickable
 * For VSC, since there can be multiple video tracks, VSC options should only be allowed when user selects a Video Track ({*}this is behavior in MBC{*}; VSC for selected track should be returned, based on the VSC option the user selects); STAGE Export job 3915 as example

Include Email Settings (required for DMD, and for Submit purposes for this destination)

 

+*Notes:*+

STAGE test product: [https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/product/G010004775227Q/product/product-tracks?languageId=104&masterTypeId=8] 

There can be multiple videos for a Combo product (Export jobs in general will take longer if they select more than one video, but this can take time based on size of the videos...should we display some message about this?)

Delivery mentioned there are no changes needed on their end (there are different CTs per asset type, but Delivery mentioned it should not be a problem)

column1: [BE] Linking: Prevent new link creation when there is an existing link in process
column27:
*User story:* To prevent a duplicate link attempt, and to not clutter the linking queue, we should check if an existing link attempt is in process. This will streamline the process in general.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN when there is an existing link attempt in progress for a product
AND its for the same master type
THEN system should restrict a new link from being created
AND record the error in link_attempt_failures table

This should be done for both track and full master linking ({*}A2 change will be done{*})
 * Example error message: "{_}Link to this master of type Virtual Master (Track Immersive Audio) cannot be created because a link attempt already exists for this product: "G010004082389B" for Dolby Atmos Audio master type with link attempt id: "111111" (Status: IN PROCESS){_}"

{*}Use cases (test this in 3 places){*}:
 # _A3 Full Master Linking_
 # _A3 Track Linking_
 # _A2 Full Master Linking_
 # _A2 Track Linking is hidden at the moment, so no need to test there_

column1: [BE] Track QC Notes: Import QC Notes for SFV/stereo audio
column27:
*User story:* Adding import capabilities for track level QC Notes for below master types{*}{*}

*Pre-conditions:*

-Master type is:
 * SFVs
 * WAVs
 * DSDs

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * *Import from immersive to non-immersive audio*
 ** Can we delete the existing error message, that Product or Master No is not of Immersive Audio type, so its not allowed?
 * *Import from non-immersive to immersive audio*
 ** Keep the existing validations (e.g. number of track masters are identical on both masters, etc)
 ** Carry these 3 fields from the Header to track master level of destination master:
 *** QC Engineer
 *** Last Updated By
 *** QC Comments

 * *Import from non-immersive to non-immersive*
 ** Validate that track length of each product/master is the same; throw error message "Track length of products don't match" if not the same
 ** Map track placement accordingly and carry over the same 3 fields mentioned above
 *** *ex:* If importing from Product B to Product A, and both have track lengths of 5, then the track at Side 1, Seq 1 in Product A will inherit the QC Notes of the track at Side 1, Seq 1 in Product B...and so on
 * *Import SFVs*
 ** What validations here?
 ** Quality Level and Attributes need to be checked?

-{*}NOTE:{*} The Import dropdown selection has 2 options between Product No and Master ID, but right now there is not much difference between the two, as masters will be checked anyway in both scenarios. As such, we don't need to worry about differing logic here at the moment (in the future, differences between the immersive audio types will have to be taken into account)
