column1: [BE] Analysis on how to swap posters for LFVs
column27:
Business has requested the ability to swap posters for LFVs. _+We'll be adding this functionality in the top left where the poster displays, and on the track/row level too.+_

Permission to consider is LINK MODIFY SWAP LONG FORM VIDEO. Execute access should be checked too (or is this only on UI?)

UST support for swapping is also requested

This is just a note for UI/myself, but we should toggle all poster options on the top left

+*Current workflow*+
 * One goes to AST, clicks lightning bolt on right-most side; AST only supports productized LFV masters at the moment
 * Master only LFV swaps are difficult because everything is under one master, so I think we should exclude this from the scope for now
 * !image-2024-01-02-12-30-53-456.png|width=849,height=361! 
 ** User will need to input a reason and a file of their own
 ** Validation exists for {*}file format{*}, {*}resolution{*}, {*}colorspace{*}, *dimensions* and *psd quality* (provided by GMP [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/poster-art/)]
 *** These validations vary depending on the dimensions of the poster (check link above)
 *** Example of dimensions validation for a 2000x3000 poster swap  !image-2024-01-02-12-34-17-385.png|width=876,height=439!
 * Product Event History messages are there (STAGE product [G010001713829P|https://aoma-stage-int.smcdp-de.net/product/G010001713829P])
 ** !image-2024-01-02-12-36-55-458.png|width=611,height=360!

 

NOTE: Each Poster can have more than one file applied but they must be different languages/locales. Default poster image/preview to show for each type would be the local language/locale for that product. 
 * Ex: PROD products G010004671041Q and G010005107033Y
 * Only *5-6* posters per LFV product here (might be bad data for the 6 poster one)

column1: [BE] Analysis on retrieving/storing requested LFV fields
column27:
We need analysis on where we can fetch the following fields from. DX and GRPS should be able to provide most (if not all) of these...how do we get info from these? Is it stored in AOMA, is there an API called, etc.:
 * Participants (Starring)
 * Synopsis
 * Director
 * Release Year (Release Date is already displaying, so maybe we can just pull the year from this)
 * Rating
 ** !image-2023-12-22-12-02-53-049.png|width=545,height=115!
 * Region of Origin
 * Original Audio Language
 * Audio Format (Stereo, 5.1, Atmos)
 ** !image-2023-12-22-12-03-35-411.png|width=570,height=56!
 * File Size
 ** Individual file sizes are listed for each asset, so maybe we can just add/sum these together

column1: [BE/AMEBA] Add Product Approval creation for Covers linked to Mobiles
column27:
*User story:* Recently, AOMA 3 has been looking to open physical and Mobile products accordingly in a new details page format. With this, we need to display Product Approvals accordingly. AOMA 3 is adding logic to edit an existing Product Approval status, but there is also logic where a Product Approval status can be created from scratch. This status is made during the linking process, so we'll have to add this logic on the currently used AMEBA service.

*Pre-conditions:*

1. Product config the link attempt is being made to is a Mobile config:
 * Mastertone
 * Ringback Tone

2. User is attempting to link a Cover

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user registers or links a Cover to a Mobile product
THEN create Product Approval status UNKNOWN for Mobile Cover

 

_Ex: How it currently looks in A2_

!image-2023-10-30-09-54-56-152.png|width=1026,height=481!
column369: 15/May/25 7:40 PM;gvamsik;This is old Jira , Not sure this is still valid ;;;

column1: [BE] Store/capture master data to table
column27:
*User story:* Various fields that need to be caught/stored at track level for  QC Note storage.

*Pre-conditions:*

-Master type is:
 * WAV 16 Bit
 * WAV 24 Bit
 * DSD
 * SFV

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-We need to move these fields which were previously caught at parent level to track level; store these appropriately in DB table (Column "master_id" in table master_qc_details?)
 * Locked By
 * Locked Date/Time
 * Last Updated By
 * Last Updated By Date/Time
 * QC Engineer
 * QC Note Comments
 * Attributes (SFV specific)
 * Quality Level (SFV specific)
 * Additional fields to check (these will need to be displayed in UI):
 ** Side Number
 ** Master Type
 ** Sequence Number
 ** Track Title Name
 ** Track Time
 ** Title Supplemental
 ** ISRC
 ** Actual Duration (Duration from GRPS)
 ** Entered Duration (actual duration read from asset)
 ** P-Line

-Current fields caught for immersive (can use this as a template):

!image-2024-03-01-19-17-03-349.png|width=622,height=205!

 

Note: If there is a change to the system then we will have to test / check with the CSA Publishing Tool [https://csa2.medigitalapps.com/csa]

column1: [BE] Analysis on physical Order Management (rewriting Supply Chain logic)
column27:
*User story:* There are currently order management workflows running through the entire Supply Chain, involving many apps. In current day, a bunch of media assets are now digital and thus use a digital order management workflow (this involves products being created and sent to Digital Service Providers).

However, there are still older, legacy physical products that need to be distributed as well. This uses physical workflow. We should figure out a way to streamline/modernize this process as much as possible, as there are many different orders that can be done (involving a bunch of Export Orders, certain order forms, etc)

GRPS is heavily involved here, as they are the entry point of the workflow and precede AOMA. Not only do we receive metadata from them, but GRPS creates scheduling orders in AOMA, where then we proceed to export these media assets to manufacturing plants.
 * A demo needs to be conducted before analysis can be done

column1: [BE] Adjust Type display in filters and results/columns
column27:

-Adjust Long Form Video so that it appears on one line

column1: [BE] On Hold: Return count for highest matched fetched master
column27:
Keep this in backlog for now; until users start wanting to use "preferred" masters

 

*User* *story:* To improve the general A3 linking experience, we need to capture the masters that are most applicable to a product's tracks. Essentially, when one fetched master shares its ISRC with multiple tracks, we want to be able to highlight and promote that master against the other fetched masters (if applicable).

This will also help to serve an "Apply" function for other tracks on said product and the A3 linking interface, where you can assign this highlighted, common master to multiple tracks at once.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User has fetched masters for tracks on the A3 Linking interface

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-Return the count of the highest/largest track master ID for a track
 * Return where fetched master's ISRC matches with other relevant tracks

*Use case:*

_Track with highest count displays first in UI_

column1: [BE] Switch from DB to AMP endpoint for Video details
column27:
AMP has requested we switch from using a DB endpoint to call certain fields for Video details, to an endpoint of their creation instead. SFVs are already stored in AMP anyway, so to call as directly as we can from there is more sensible.

*Revamp description as needed

column1: [DB] Export: report generation for download and A3 flow
column27:
Hello DB team,

I'm looking to track the migration of A2 Export traffic to A3 Export, for digital flows and PKGF-DMD (non-Order form) flow. This is for some statistics I will have to report to Sang. I will need Export stats, and Download stats as well

I will need it for the following master types and destinations:
 * Master types (include virtual also)
 ** WAV 16 bit
 ** WAV 24 bit
 ** DDP (Converted...if it is sent with a non source CT)
 ** Cover
 ** SFV
 ** VSC
 ** PKGF
 * Destinations (PKGF specific)
 ** Direct Mail Delivery
 ** Self Delivery
 ** My AOMA Files (named Local in A2 Export)

Please send me a report of the following, with date since 07/23/2025, and for digital masters, only limit to digital products (product No starts with 'G'):
 * A2 Export traffic for digital masters to any destination
 * A2 Export traffic for Packaging Graphic masters to above destinations (with NO Order Form included)
 * A3 Export traffic for digital masters to any supported destination
 * A3 Export traffic for Packaging Graphics master to destination Direct Mail Delivery (Physical Masters)
 * Download traffic (full .zip and single file, both) from details pages for all listed master types above

In the report, in addition to above info (master type, destination, etc), also include:
 * username
 * department
 * date/time of Export/download

column1: [DB] Create user_home_page_preference_map table
column27:
Hi DB team,

The aoma application is developing a new home page dashboard and needs database support to store user-specific tile configurations. Tiles are menu options on the dashboard that users can reorder and show/hide.

We plan to reuse the *_aoma_ui_menu_options_* table for base tile information (name, URL, permissions).

Please do the following:

 

*1. Extend _aoma_ui_menu_options_* *table*
    Please add the following columns to the aoma.{_}aoma_ui_menu_options{_} table:

    {_}is_tile{_}: BOOLEAN (NOT NULL, default false)
    {_}description{_}: VARCHAR(255) (NULL)
    {_}default_order{_}: SMALLINT (NULL)
    {_}icon_name{_}: VARCHAR(255) (NULL)

    *Data backfill:* Please backfill these new columns for provided options and update _aoma_ui_menu_option_nm_ for existing records based on the attached XLS file.

 

*2. Add new option to* _*aoma_ui_menu_option:*_
    _option name: Package Printing Specs_
    _menu_id: 1 (Engineering)_
    _relative_url: /servlet/com.sonymusic.aoma.AOMADispatcherServlet?chain=PackagePrintingSpecificationSelectProductAction_

    _is_tile: true (should be menu option and dashboard tile)_
    _description: Review and modify physical packaging print specifications_

    _default_order: 15_

    _icon_name: home_page_package_print_specs_

   {color:#172b4d}And add following permission for the option to aoma_ui_menu_options_permission_map:{color} 
_QC_METADATA_VIEW_VIDEO_PRODUCT, QC_METADATA_EDIT_VIDEO_PRODUCT, QC_METADATA_VIEW_AUDIO_ARCHIVE, QC_METADATA_EDIT_AUDIO_ARCHIVE, QC_METADATA_VIEW_DVD_PRODUCT, QC_METADATA_EDIT_DVD_PRODUCT, QC_METADATA_EDIT_PACKAGE_PRINTING_SPECIFICATION_

 

*3.* Use the existing tables aoma.ui_view_configs and aoma.user_ui_preferences for user home page preferences mapping. 

One new record in aoma.{_}ui_view_configs{_} as follows:

    _ui_view_config_id_ : 3
    {_}aoma_ui_menu_option_nm{_}: null
    {_}view_nm{_}: Home Page Default View}
    {_}view_options{_}: null

Service will insert the rest to user_ui_preferences table

 
----
Also please grant access to aoma_micro_srv_user_mgmt service db user (and devs shar051, stef003) to the following tables:
   aoma_ui_menus,
   aoma_ui_menu_options,

   aoma_ui_menu_options_permission_map,
   ui_view_configs,
   user_ui_preferences
 

Thank you

column1: [BE] AOMA Home page - UI/UX redesign and Angular Upgrade of the Home Page
[BE] To block creation of Virtual 24 Bit master (regular and Mfit) when a full master of same type already exists
column27:
*Description:*

We have discovered recently that when Full master of Wav 24 Bit (regular or Mfit) is linked to product ( generally when a partial registration created a 24 bit master) we are also able to create a Virtual master of 24 Bit of same kind which should not be allowed. 

This is not happening in the case Wav 16 Bit master. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

If the product already has Full 24 Bit master (Regular and Mfit) then a Virtual 24 Bit master of same type/version should not be allowed to create.

This should be blocked similar to how creation of virtual 16 bit master blocks it when a Full 16 bit master is already linked to the product.
column369:
12/Sep/25 4:21 PM;kori002;the logic of allowing virtual masters to be created for tracks which yet has not been registered in other full 24 masters of same sample rate and classification is in legacy too 

so If I have 24 bit normal master with only one track registered

I can link 3 more virtual masters for the rest of the tracks in the product

in another words we allow only ONE asset to be mapped in the system for corresponding product track of same config (be it all assets in one master or scattered among many). ;;;

column1: [UI] Setting Lyrics column to default 'Yes' for CC masters on details page
column27:
*Description:* 

For Closed Caption Masters (SCC and TTML), currently the display of Lyrics (Yes/No) on details page is incorrectly showing as "No" for closed caption masters on Product details page, Associated Master section and Master details page

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

For CC (SCC and TTML) masters  the Lyrics column should follow these below on  Product details page, Associated Master section and Master details page

If BE value is Y display Yes

If BE value is N display No

if BE value is null then leave it unspecified

column1: [BE] Implement export status kafka listener
column27:
h3. Technical Story: 

Currently AOMA has a scheduler which runs once every 30 seconds and triggers delivery api to get statuses for in progress export jobs.

Now Delivery system sends status update events to kafka _delivery-package-events_ topic in Global DS kafka cluster, so AOMA should listen to those events and update export job statuses accordingly
h3. Testing notes:

Submitting few exports and tracking status update on Export Status page would be enough to confirm that the solution works.
Also media batch converter should be tested too.

column1: [UI] To include "Full Publish" status along with GRPS past release date for Product release warning in linking interfaces
column27:
*Description:*

Currently in the linking interface when we commit a link to product with GRPS first release date in the past then we warn user in modal window when user clicks commit link button saying that product is released and linking could deliver the assets directly to partner. 

UST introduced similar warning on registration/asset swap but they have added "Full Publish" status as well in addition Past GRPS first release date to show the warning message and hence to maintain the consistent approach throughout the system we shall add in the addition condition of Full publish status to display the warning message.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

When the product has GRPS first release date in the past 

and When the product has "Full Publish" status 

Display below warning message in the modal window when user tries to perform linking/hotswap to the product:
!image-2025-08-06-16-13-42-748.png|width=270,height=132!
 * Adjust message to say "{*}This action will link the new asset to a full published and released product and will be delivered to the partners automatically.{*}" (do not forget full stop at end of sentence)

column1: To fix the issue with AOMA URL re direction
column27:
*Issue:* 
When clicking AOMA links from Jira tickets AOMA is opening the last page opened instead of the direct url link you clicked.

*Expected Behavior:*

**

Expected Behavior, When I click an AOMA URL link, I expect to be taken to the page as referenced in that link, not to the last page I was on in AOMA. 

My bookmark for AOMA is the AOMA landing/home page.  When I click my bookmark, it no longer takes me to the homepage, it takes me to the last page I was on in AOMA. 

If I am on a page in AOMA, and the system times out, logging me out, when I am forced to log back in, I would expect to be taken to the last page I was on.

column1: AOMA 3 Explicit Indicators - Display of indicators and mismatches
column27:
*Applicable Masters:* Stereo Audio(16, 24Bit and Vinyls), Immersive (except 360 RA) and SFV.  

Pseudo Video - Will check with GMP (need another ticket)

*Acceptance Criteria:* UST team will be ready to inherit the Explicit indicators for both productized and UST master only registrations (for SFV use case alone) and based on that we should display Explicit indicators at Assoc master section, QC notes and explicit indicators mismatches should be displayed on products tab. 

*Note:* Master only registration for SFV means UST does not have a real master only registration and we provide a checkbox up top there especially for the short form videos alone to start with where it uses the product metadata to create a master, but it does not create that link at all and hence we inherit the E indicator because we are also inheriting the ISRC from the product because there is a product underneath.

And from A2 where we register real master only there is no way we can inherit the E indicator there and hence we only consider UST registrations. 

 

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Explicit indicators should be displayed at track master level on
 ** Associated master section
 ** Master details page
 * Explicit indicator mismatches should be displayed on products tab and QC notes interface by following below mentioned cases:
 ** QC noter interface
 *** When QC notes is accessed through UST or Assoc master section we should show the Explicit mismatches based underlying product
 *** When QC notes is accessed through master details page E indicator alone is fine to display for the track master
 ** Products tab (follow the below cases)

*Case 1:* 
If the product track is clean, but the track master which is linked to is explicit then We should display the mismatches on product tab (PFA Wireframe for mismatches)

The tooltip message when we hover over the mismatch badge in this case should clearly say "{*}Product track is clean, and the track master linked is explicit and hence the mismatch "{*}

*Case 2:*

If the product track is Explicit and the track master which is linked to is clean, we should display the mismatches on products tab

The tooltip message when we hover over the mismatch badge in this case should say "{*}Product track is explicit, and the track master linked is clean and hence the mismatch"{*}

 

*Case 3:* If both Product track and track master is either clean or Explicit then we display no indicator or E indicator respectively on products tab and associated master section.

column1: Auto-pseudo enhancement - Accept animated gifs in addition to a still cover image
column27:
*User Story:* 

As a user I want to upload a .gif image to create a Pseudo video using AOMA.

*Description:* 

Currently, AOMA pseudo video accepts only cover image as source or uploads of type .jpg or .jpeg etc. This should be extended to support .gif 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
UI should allow .gif file in addition to currently supported formats when you browse file for upload.

No validations on gif when upload as a phase 1 project. (may be in future we shall add any validations in future phase)

UI validations: No dots and spaces inside the file name and height validation - these are current validations and should be extended while accepting .gif files. Any other extra validations will be discussed later and addressed as phase 2.

If cover file is selected as source for Pseudo video or cover image is uploaded existing CT can be used for Pseudo Video creation. But if user upload .gif image, the system should be using the new CT ( MC ticket attached to get the details of new CT) to generate the Pseudo video.

CT id for accepting non gif file: 2067

CT id for accepting .gif file: 4205

*Test Cases:*
General regression testing should be conducted for Pseudo video creation using Source audio and source cover or upload of cover

Auto QC lock and Auto QC approval should also be tested for jpeg and gif uploads.

Pseudo Video created using .gif source should undergo registration using UST to create SFV and VSC master to create video product of footage type Pseudo video.

Looping of the gif should be entirely through out the audio duration in the resulting video.

VSC extracts from first frame of the gif.

 

*This ticket is mostly for facilitate to GMP to test the new CT 4205 by allowing the .gif upload to create a pseudo video.*

column1: [UI] Ability to add tracks in Track Hot swap for stereo masters
[BE] Ability to add tracks in Track Hot swap for stereo masters
Ability to add tracks in Track Hot swap for stereo masters
column27:
*User Story:* We have implemented the ability add tracks for published immersive products via Track hot swap with last build.

We should extended that support to Stereo Audio masters as well 

*Applicable Master Types:*
|Virtual Master (Track DDP/WAV 16Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track WAV 24Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track DSD/Video)|

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*FOR PUBLISHED PRODUCTS* 

*WHEN* user has permission _LINK_MODIFY_SWAP_ 
*AND* permission _TEMP AOMA3 TRACK LINK MODIFY SWAP_

*AND* user has Master Execute access

*AND* Master is not empty mean asset availability flag is True

We give the ability to add (Only add not delete) of tracks for above virtual masters using Track hot swap option.

This hot swap will not check QC lock or Qc approved and the only basic sanity check are performed like the track is existing asset type, duration and ISRC mismatches are displayed basically Add track should be considered as new linking itself and when changing or replacing an existing track then it should check hot swap rules or conditions and this should be tested in terms of adding a track and replacing a track using same Track hotswap functionality

We should change the logic to check at track level from BE to see if it is adding a new track or if is replacing a track using that same track hotswap option. BE should handle this.

Then UI changes are also required to send to BE istrackhotswap flag for each track.

Both BE and UI changes will affect current logic for immersives as well and hence Immersive track hotswap should be tested.

*Note:* This should be tested only for Published products where we give the checkboxes to add more tracks to the virtual master.

column1: Revert AMEBA Linking and Unlink for DDP and Vinyl to legacy to avoid export failures
column27:
*Desc:* 
We are experiencing so many A2 export failures because AMEBA will not update the deprecated tables in AOMA 2 as legacy linking does. Hence we need to point the linking and unlinking to legacy until ATF team fixes this.

 

*AC:*

For Create Master Linking move the endpoint from AMEBA to legacy for following masters:

Audio DDP
Audio Wav 16 Bit Vinyl

Audio Wav 24 Bit Vinyl

 

For Delete link move the endpoint from AMEBA to legacy for following masters:

Audio Master Wav 24 Bit Vinyl 
Audio Master Wav 16 Bit Vinyl 
Virtual Master ( Side DDP/ Blu-ray/ DVD) 
Virtual Master ( Side Wav 24 Bit Vinyl) 
Virtual Master ( Side Wav 16 Bit Vinyl)  


*Test Case:*
Perform regression testing for all the above Linking and Unlinking cases for respective mentioned masters.

column1: Ability to Delete and Edit links of Immersive/ AMB/ CC/ Subtitle masters for published products
column27:
*User Story:* 
As a user I would like to delete the link of Immersive (Dolby, 360 RA, Quad, 5.1,7.1) or AMB full masters (not track linked) which are linked to published products. 

*Applicable Masters:*
Immersive full masters ( Dolby, 360 RA, Quad, 5.1 and 7.1) , AMB, Closed Captions and Subtitles.  

Adding one more here for scope: All Virtual Immersive Masters 

These masters are not required for publish of a product  and not required to be locked down for 'catalog stability'. There are many use cases where we need to take down masters at storefronts due to technical issues or creative changes. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

This should be Permission driven.

*Permission Name:* LINK MODIFY PUBLISHED PRODUCTS

Permission will be only give to Select GMP users who can delete or edit the link for published products.

Given user has the above permission and "Execute" access

Then we should skip the check of Publish status of the product for above master types to allow delete and edit link.

*IMP NOTE:* Delete and Edit link for published products should not be available for Immersive only product. (UI will need to check Boolean property on products tracks level which needs to be defined later)

*test cases:*

*1) When user has necessary permission on full published product:*

Delete link: Full master AMB, Full master (all Immersive), Full master( CC and Subtitles) and Virtual Master (all Immersive)

Edit link: Virtual Master (all Immersive). 

 

*2) regression test cases::*

Published Product
  Stereo Product
    With permission
     it should provide delete link option only for immersive master types (including virtual)
    Without permission
     it should not show the delete link option for any master types including immersive
Immersive Product
    With permission
     it should not show the delete link option for any master types including immersive
    Without permission
     it should not show the delete link option for any master types including immersive

 

 

Not Published Yet
  Stereo Product
    With permission
     it should provide delete link option for all master types including immersive master types (including virtual)
    Without permission
     it should provide delete link option for all master types including immersive master types (including virtual)
Immersive Product
    With permission
     it should provide delete link option for all master types including immersive master types (including virtual)
    Without permission
     it should provide delete link option for all master types including immersive master types (including virtual)

column1: [BE] AOMA 3 Linking: Support Create link for Stereo Audio Vinyls
AOMA 3 Linking: Support Create link for Stereo Audio Vinyls
column27:
*User Story:* 

Vamsi's team is ready to support AOMA 3 full master linking for Vinyl Audio Masters with AMEBA based architecture. In this ticket we will migrate Audio Vinyl linking support to AOMA 3 UI and AMEBA.

*Applicable Masters:* 

Stereo Audio Vinyl 16bit

Stereo Audio Vinyl 24bit

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*1) Permissions:* 

It should mirror what we currently have for AOMA 3 full master linking.

Required Permissions: *AOMA 3 Link* and *Link Modify*

 

{*}2) BE Errors - All errors are blockers and should block the linking attempt{*}{*}{{*}}

*Once user enters product ID or master id and fetches the master and then select the master(s) - (multiple master linking in one action should also be supported here and hence checkboxes will be provided against masters then if any of the below error cases arises the UI should block the "Commit Link" button and should show the respective message(s).* 

 

When the vinyl master has no assets

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

"The Stereo Audio %%Bit Vinyl master you're trying to link has no assets."

 

When the product configuration of the product is not one of the list provided below.

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

" The Stereo Audio %% Bit Vinyl master cannot be linked to this Product Configuration."

 

Product Configurations that we support linking of16 and 24 bit Vinyl masters:

 

List from GMP: 

*12 inch Vinyl Single 78*

*12 Maxi-Single Vinyl*

*10 inch Vinyl Extended Play*

*10 inch Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3*

*10 inch Vinyl Single*

*7 inch Vinyl Single*

*7 inch Vinyl Extended Play 45*

*VinylDisc Maxi Single*

*Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3*

*7 inch Vinyl EP 33 1/3*

 

 

*List from Current BE table: (One Vinyl Disc Maxi single is missing in AOMA 2 BE as compared to above list given by GMP and hence should be added to the table)*

 
|10 inch Vinyl Extended Play|
|10 inch Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3|
|10 inch Vinyl Single|
|12 inch Vinyl Single 78|
|12 Maxi-Single Vinyl|
|7 inch Vinyl EP 33 1/3|
|7 inch Vinyl Extended Play 45|
|7 inch Vinyl Single|
|Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3|

 

 

When the  Product and Master sides count is not equal

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

*"Selected master cannot be linked to this product because the product has [x] components while the master has [y]"*

 

When the product has already master of same type is linked

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

"MasterType "Audio Master WAV [x] Bit Vinyl" was already linked to this product by a full master. The system does not support linking more than one"

 

*3) UI Warnings: (All warnings are not blockers and should be allowed to override and commit)*

*Once user selects the Vinyl master(s) and there are no errors found then UI should display the information with all the tracks and sides with duration mismatches. Additionally, warnings should be added as secondary warning message in modal window.*

 

When total duration of the Product side is less then sum of all track durations in it.Master side 

Then display the below warning message in modal window for all the components which has mismatches

The total duration hh:mm:ss:ms of master component 'x' Side 'y'  is less then the actual duration of the label copy of component [x] Side [y] Product duration: HH:MM:SS:FF

 

*Please note* we do not have any ISRC mismatches in the Vinyl linking as we link at side level and we do not store the track sequence with track names and ISRC codes for each side at the master level and then use that to validate against product.

 

*Some additional Duration (Side) based conditions that we have to check for Vinyl masters and provide the user as a warning in the modal window:*

*For* Vinyl 16 and 24 bit masters 

*When* the product configuration is *12 inch Vinyl Single 78* 

and *When* the Duration of total wav file is Is >4 mins 30 secs

*Then* display warning message in the modal window:
Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 78 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The recommended duration is under 4 mins 30 seconds. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.
----
*For* Vinyl 16 and 24 bit masters 

*When* the product configuration is *10 inch Vinyl Extended Play,* *10 inch Vinyl Single,* *10 inch Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3*

and *When* The Duration of total wav file is Is >9 mins but ≤12 mins

*Then* display warning message along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended. 

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl: 
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes 

and *When* The Duration of total wav file is >12 mins 

*Then* display warning message along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 10 inch vinyl: 
 - @45 rpm up to 9 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 12 minutes 
----
*For* Vinyl 16 and 24bit Masters 

*When* the product configuration is *7 inch Vinyl Single,* *7 inch Vinyl EP 33 1/3,* *7 inch Vinyl Extended Play 45*

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >4 mins 30 secs but ≤7 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes 

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >7 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes 
----
*For* Vinyl 16 and 24bit Masters 

*When* the product configuration is *VinylDisc Maxi Single*

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >4 mins 30 secs but ≤7 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >7 mins but ≤15 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 7 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes 

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >15 mins but ≤24 mins

*Then* display warning message along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes

and *when* the duration of total wav file Is >24 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes
----
*For* Vinyl 16 and 24bit Masters 

*When* the product configuration is *Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3,* *12 Maxi-Single Vinyl*

and *when* the duration of total wav file is > 15 mins but ≤24 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes

and *when* the duration of total wav file is > 24 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes
----
*Important Note:* Duration(Side) mismatches between product side and master side should be displayed on AOMA 3 UI when user fetches and selects the Vinyl master.

*Test cases:*

1) All the above error messages and warnings should be tested for Vinyl masters

2) Test the permission checks mentioned above

3) *Emails notifications and updates:*

Product Link Email is sent

and Master Event history and Product Event history is updated

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.{color:#172b4d}*>>PASS*{color}
!image-2025-08-21-16-44-36-822.png!


ecommended side lengths for 7 inch vinyl:
 - @45 rpm up to 4 minutes 30 seconds
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 7 minutes

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes
----
*For* Vinyl 16 and 24bit Masters 

*When* the product configuration is *Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3,* *12 Maxi-Single Vinyl*

and *when* the duration of total wav file is > 15 mins but ≤24 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended{*}>>PASS{*}
!image-2025-08-21-16-39-20-832.png!

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes

and *when* the duration of total wav file is > 24 mins

*Then* display warning message  along with recommendations in the modal window:

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 33 1/3 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.{*}>>PASS{*}
*!image-2025-08-21-16-41-10-157.png!*

Recommended side lengths for 12 inch Vinyl
 - @45 rpm up to 15 minutes
 - @33 1/3 rpm up to 24 minutes
----
*Important Note:* Duration(Side) mismatches between product side and master side should be displayed on AOMA 3 UI when user fetches and selects the Vinyl master.

*Test cases:*

1) All the above error messages and warnings should be tested for Vinyl masters

2) Test the permission checks mentioned above

3) *Emails notifications and updates:*

Product Link Email is sent

and Master Event history and Product Event history is updated;;;

column376:
22/Aug/25 6:40 PM;jpitzer;Here's the status of the vinyl linking ticket - the duration validation warnings are working as expected, and some of the product/master combinations are linking successfully. But some are failing as shown above:

 

Product / master 88697374562 / 4681596

Product / master  19439937371/ 4391038

Product / master 19075860251 / 5607470

 

All the link failures are showing the same error message:

Link failed due to the following unexpected error: NoSuchElementException

 

For successful linking, product and event history updates are working as expected, and notification are being sent

*Applicable Masters:* 

Stereo Audio Vinyl 16bit

Stereo Audio Vinyl 24bit

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*1) Permissions:* 

It should mirror what we currently have for AOMA 3 full master linking.

Required Permissions: *AOMA 3 Link* and *Link Modify*

 

{*}2) BE Errors - All errors are blockers and should block the linking attempt{*}{*}{{*}}

*Once user enters product ID or master id and fetches the master and then select the master(s) - (multiple master linking in one action should also be supported here and hence checkboxes will be provided against masters then if any of the below error cases arises the UI should block the "Commit Link" button and should show the respective message(s).* 

 

When the vinyl master has no assets

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

"The Stereo Audio %%Bit Vinyl master you're trying to link has no assets."{*}>>PASS{*}

!image-2025-08-22-09-17-20-479.png!

When the product configuration of the product is not one of the list provided below.

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

" The Stereo Audio %% Bit Vinyl master cannot be linked to this Product Configuration."{*}>>PASS{*}

!image-2025-08-22-09-18-57-754.png!

Product Configurations that we support linking of16 and 24 bit Vinyl masters:

 

List from GMP: 

*12 inch Vinyl Single 78*

*12 Maxi-Single Vinyl*

*10 inch Vinyl Extended Play*

*10 inch Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3*

*10 inch Vinyl Single*

*7 inch Vinyl Single*

*7 inch Vinyl Extended Play 45*

*VinylDisc Maxi Single*

*Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3*

*7 inch Vinyl EP 33 1/3*

 

 

*List from Current BE table: (One Vinyl Disc Maxi single is missing in AOMA 2 BE as compared to above list given by GMP and hence should be added to the table)*

 
|10 inch Vinyl Extended Play|
|10 inch Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3|
|10 inch Vinyl Single|
|12 inch Vinyl Single 78|
|12 Maxi-Single Vinyl|
|7 inch Vinyl EP 33 1/3|
|7 inch Vinyl Extended Play 45|
|7 inch Vinyl Single|
|Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3|

 

 

When the  Product and Master sides count is not equal

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

{*}"Selected master cannot be linked to this product because the product has [x] components while the master has [y]"{*}{*}{color:#172b4d}>>Pass but with alternate messaging:{color}{*}
*{color:#1a3a48}"Selected master cannot be linked to this product because the product has 1 components while the master has 2"{color}*

*!image-2025-08-18-16-38-24-925.png!*

When the product has already master of same type is linked

Then display the below  message in Red (block the commit link button)

"MasterType "Audio Master WAV [x] Bit Vinyl" was already linked to this product by a full master. The system does not support linking more than one"{*}>>PASS but with alternate messaging:{*}

*"{color:#1a3a48}MasterType "Audio Master WAV 16 Bit Vinyl" was already linked to this product by a full master. The system does not support linking more than one{color}"*
Test product - 88697720371
Master -  5693895

*3) UI Warnings: (All warnings are not blockers and should be allowed to override and commit)*

*Once user selects the Vinyl master(s) and there are no errors found then UI should display the information with all the tracks and sides with duration mismatches. Additionally, warnings should be added as secondary warning message in modal window.*

 

When total duration of the Product side is less then sum of all track durations in it.Master side 

Then display the below warning message in modal window for all the components which has mismatches

The total duration hh:mm:ss:ms of master component 'x' Side 'y'  is less then the actual duration of the label copy of component [x] Side [y] Product duration: HH:MM:SS:FF{*}>>PASS{*}
!image-2025-08-22-10-56-12-648.png!

 

*Please note* we do not have any ISRC mismatches in the Vinyl linking as we link at side level and we do not store the track sequence with track names and ISRC codes for each side at the master level and then use that to validate against product.

 

*Some additional Duration (Side) based conditions that we have to check for Vinyl masters and provide the user as a warning in the modal window:*

*For* Vinyl 16 and 24 bit masters 

*When* the product configuration is *12 inch Vinyl Single 78* >>Product / master - 19658823501 / 572530

and *When* the Duration of total wav file is Is >4 mins 30 secs

*Then* display warning message in the modal window:
Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 12 inch vinyl master at 78 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The recommended duration is under 4 mins 30 seconds. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.{*}>>PASS{*}
*!image-2025-08-22-11-51-40-423.png!*
----

Warning: Component X Side X master is xx:xx:xx long, this exceeds the recommended maximum length of a 10 inch vinyl master at 45 rpm and may be too long to fit on a side. The cutting facility may require prior contact to ensure the master can be manufactured as intended.

column377:
26/Aug/25 6:21 PM;jpitzer;Ticket has been retested. 

There is a potential issue as follows:

Example product - 19658823501
Example master - 5728010

Master is 6 min 23 sec per side, and should display the duration validation for that product configuration.

But, it's inconsisent - out of 7 link attempts, the validation only displayed on the 7th attempt - and then the warning displayed, and I linking was successful.

This was tested on PC and MAC, all browsers.

The issue then is that the duration warning modal is not consistently displaying. But there is no way to force the issue to be reproduced.;;;

column1: Master Details Page - To add "Regenerate Preview" support to all the applicable masters
column27:
*User Story:* Currently the master details page does not support "Preview Regeneration" as it does on the associated master section for same master type.

*Applicable Master Types:*
// parent masters
  MasterTypesEnum.CoverMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterDDP,
  MasterTypesEnum.ShortFormVideoMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.LongFormVideoMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterSideDDPBluRayDVD,
  MasterTypesEnum.PackagingGraphicsMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterWAV16Bit,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterWAV24Bit,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterWAV24BitVinyl,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterDSD,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioMasterWAV16BitVinyl,
  MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterSideWAV16BitVinyl,
  MasterTypesEnum.DigitalBookletStandardMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.ReaderSpreadMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.PrinterSpreadMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VideoScreenCaptureMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VideoCustomArtMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackVideoScreenCapture,
  MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackVideoCustomArt,
  MasterTypesEnum.AlbumMotionBundle,

  // child masters
  MasterTypesEnum.DDPTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VideoTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.DigitalBookletWithReader,
  MasterTypesEnum.WAV16BitTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.WAV24BitTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.LongFormMainVideoMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.LongFormTrailerVideoMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.DSDTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioWAV24BitVinylComponentMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioWAV16BitVinylComponentMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioWAV16BitVinylTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.AudioWAV24BitVinylTrackMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.ClosedCaptionsMasterLongFormFeatureVideo,
  MasterTypesEnum.SubtitleMasterLongFormFeatureVideo,
  MasterTypesEnum.ClosedCaptionsMasterLongFormTrailerVideo,
  MasterTypesEnum.SubtitleMasterLongFormTrailerVideo,
  MasterTypesEnum.LongFormChapterMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.LongFormPosterMaster,
  MasterTypesEnum.VideoScreenCaptureTrack,
  MasterTypesEnum.DolbyAtmosAudio,
  MasterTypesEnum.VideoCustomArtTrack,

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

For all the  ** master types mentioned above where they support preview regeneration when user select and clicks the *"Generate Preview"*  button. The same support should be added to those masters on their master details page.

*Test* *Cases:*
Test if the "Generate Preview" button is added to all the *PARENT* masters mentioned and it works as expected 

This functionality should work as expected just like how it works on product details page (associated master tab) and also should not throw any error when no product is linked to master (Standalone Master).

column1: [UI] Details pages: Modify A2 Export button display logic (digital flow)
column27:
*User story:* Now that we have certain A3 options available, we should hide the A2 Export button accordingly, to help migrate traffic from A2 Export to A3 Export. This will be for remaining Digital traffic.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-Should we gate this behind a TEMP permission?-

WHEN product is of digital configuration
AND product is not linked to DDP master (full or side-linked virtual master)
THEN hide A2 Export button

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

_After check per above AC is done, below AC is next:_

WHEN product is linked to DDP (full or side-linked virtual)
THEN current existing system checks should proceed
 * This allows for A2 Export button to display when needed

 

_Master types to check:_

Audio Master DDP (Full Master)

Virtual Master (Side DDP/Blu-ray/DVD)

Master type IDs are 2 and 7

!image-2025-08-07-09-35-22-360.png!

 

_For Jack: conduct additional regression test on A3 Export:_ Just make sure user can export the above master types to Sony Ci, DMD, MAF, etc.
 * If possible, conduct a Order Form request just to make sure A2 Export interface is not deleted also

column1: [UI] A3 Export: Use childOrder to display tracks
column27:
*User story:* Many things are checked to display assets in A3 Export; one such value is {_}masterTrackSeq{_}. This value is pulled from a table called _audio_track_master_ table; however, masters submitted via DU/SU do not create entries in this table.

Unless this is addressed, legacy registered assets won't be able to be exported via A3 Export due to not being displayed.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Use childOrder to display asset in A3 Export modal, instead of masterTrackSeq

 

{_}Testing{_}: general regression test on multiple master types, and make sure Export output works
 * Register a supported A3 Export master type via DU/SU and see if its showing
 * -See if we have an older registered supported master (pre-UST) and see if its displaying- (Masters registered from this era will not generate an AMP asset key, which means this cannot be displayed in A3 Export modal. However, assets in PROD should not have this problem.)
column369: 28/Jul/25 5:30 AM;shar051;[~venu001] This does not require any backend work. Changing this to a UI story and assigning to you .;;;

column1: A3 Full Master Linking: Migrate "Create" link for DBKS master types to AOMA 3 UI and AMEBA
column27:
*User Story:* .AOMA 3 UI should start support create full master linking for DBKS master

AMEBA is also ready to support BE.

*Applicable Master Type:* 
Digital Booklet Standard Master

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*LINKING OF BOOKLETS CAN BE ONLY DONE TO A PRODUCT IF IT IS SET UP TO HAVE BONUS MATERIAL OF TYPE STANDARAD BOOKLET. (UST ALREADY HANDLES THIS) - INFO SET IN GRPS*

*!image-2025-08-21-09-53-19-434.png!*

After clicking Full master button on A3 linking page and enter any DBKS Master Id or any product id that this master type associated then

Remove the verbiage "Not supported for now. Coming soon." for above master type and enable this master type to support full master linking to the new product.

!image-2025-08-13-21-27-31-148.png|width=254,height=91!

Find the attached image to understand what to display once user selects DBKS Master to perform full master linking.

!image-2025-08-13-21-34-19-754.png|width=481,height=175!

We should display following information when we select the DBKS master

Thumbnail, File Name, File Size, File Type, Dimension, No. of Pages and Resolution

Thumbnail should be left side of the File name.

 

Only one DBKS master is allowed to link to a product.

*Test cases:*
**

Perform below test cases for DBKS master:

1. Test to see if the verbiage is removed and master type is enabled to be selected using radio button.

2.  Test to see if the above-mentioned columns are being displayed when DBKS master is selected using radio/Multi select button.

3. DBKS links to the product successfully upon hitting commit link.

column1: [DB] New Permission to gate the ability to Unlink and Edit link for select masters from Published Products.
column27:
Hello DB team,

Please create a new permission called "LINK MODIFY PUBLISHED PRODUCTS" to be able gate the ability to Unlink or Edit link on Published Products in AOMA production. 

GMP requested permission driven ability to modify links for published products in AOMA production for select master like AMB, Immerisves, CC & Subtitles because often these masters are requested to be removed from storefronts and also these masters are not required for publish of a product  and not required to be locked down for 'catalog stability' and hence it will ease out the current GMP process of unpublishing a product in these scenarios to modify the links on published products.

column1: A3 Status pages- filter settings not retained if user navigates away from main page
column27:
*08/07/2025 AMSE1 refinement suggestion - Have details page open in a new browser tab, and get rid of "Return to list" completely on the details page - this would allow the A3 export UI to retain filters and the result would be better UX.*

*06/12/2025 refinement:* This can be applicable to all "status" pages, not just Export Status

If a user opens A3 export status, and sets the filters using any/all attributes, filters the results, THEN clicks on a job ID, then the A3 export job details opens. IF the user then clicks on "Return to list" then all of the filter settings are deleted, so user has to manually repeat the process.

Expected result - filter settings should be retained if user opens a job details page and then navigates back to the list by clicking the "Return to list" button

 

Test: Export Status, Registration Job Status, Product and Master Event History, Link Attempt Status, etc.

column1: AUM: Implement new USM auth architecture
column27:
*User story:* AOMA is requested to move its authentication to USM, so all Sony Music applications use a single sign on mechanism. In order to achieve that, AOMA should adjust the AUM modal.

 
----
h1. Pre-conditions

UPN is the field which is used for login (in USM email input). We need to be careful when updating it, as it requires approval from the associated user (otherwise login will not be successful).
h4. From now on, there is going be 3 types of users in the system:
 # AZURE
 # AOMA_INTERNAL
 # USM

In USM system user can be external or internal depends on upn domain

 
----
h2. Acceptance Criteria

_(These_ _ACs only have to do with creating user and updating user_ _settings; login steps are specified in AOMA3-2096)_
h3. Create Internal user

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: a user with ADMINISTER_USER permission (referred to as "{*}admin" user{*}) on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management sub-item

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on Create New User button

  _Then:_ the system shows Create New User modal

{color:#de350b}*3.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some fields, but leaves some required fields touched but empty (required fields marked with *)

  _Then:_ the system outline those fields with red (Save button remains inactive)

{color:#00875a}*4.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *SonyMusic* *domain* (example@{*}sonymusic.com,{*} full list of domains mentioned in the comments)

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ user is able to login _(does not receive any email, support should message user to inform about account setup)_

{color:#ff8b00}*5.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *SonyMusic* {*}domain{*}, but *un-toggles Active field*

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active
 * Is this AC still relevant? For example, if user is automatically created and set to inactive, are there cases where the user account is then set back to active a day later for whatever reason?
 * Can check with Keith on whether Active or Inactive is set default on new user creation

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ new user is present in AOMA but *not able to login*
h3. Create external user

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management with Create New User modal opened and new user *does not exist* in USM (by upn)

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *not* *SonyMusic* *domain* (example@{*}example.com{*}, any other than listed in the comments)

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message ({color:#ff8b00}_User_ _'username' has been created in AOMA and in USM_{color}{_}){_}

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ system syncs the user with USM *(saves new user in USM)*

      _And_ created user receives a mail (by the UPN email address)

!image-2024-12-09-17-44-34-949.png|width=409,height=446!

    _When:_ user receives email above

        _And_ clicks on link provided in the mail

        _And_ he's getting redirected to USM password setup page where enters password and confirm password

     _Then:_ user's account is set in USM but user *is not redirected to AOMA* ({_}USM limitation){_}

     _Then:_ user opens AOMA login page in browser (different tab) and does regular login

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management with Create New User modal opened and new user *exists* in USM (by upn)

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields a

      _And_ enters UPN with *not* *SonyMusic* *domain*

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message ({color:#ff8b00}{_}U{_}{_}ser{_} {color}{color:#ff8b00}_'username' has been created in AOMA and linked in USM_{color}{_}){_}

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ system syncs the user with USM *(links user in USM to AOMA client)*

      _And_ created user receives a mail (by the UPN email address)

!image-2024-12-09-14-43-19-047.png|width=384,height=355!

    _When:_ user receives email above

        _And_ clicks on link provided in the mail

        _And_ he's getting redirected to USM login page and enters his (already existing) credentials

    _Then:_ user's is authorized by USM but user *is not redirected to AOMA* ({_}USM limitation){_}

    _Then:_ user opens AOMA login page in browser (different tab) and does regular login

{color:#ff8b00}*3.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields and

        _And_ enters UPN with *NOT* *SonyMusic* {*}domain{*}, but *untoggles Active field*

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      *_And_ does not sync new user with USM*

      _And_ New external user is present in AOMA but *does not receive any email* *and is not able to login*
h3. *Update USM Internal user to be active or inactive*

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management subitem

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters a valid username of type *USM,* which has *SonyMusic domain UPN* (means the user is internal), in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#ff8b00}4.{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *true*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *false* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *not* *able* to login anymore (user is inactive now)

{color:#00875a}5{color}. {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *false*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *true* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *able* to login now
h3. *Update USM External user to be active or inactive*

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management subitem

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters a valid username of type *USM,* which *does not have SonyMusic domain UPN* (means the user is external), in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#ff8b00}3.{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *true*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *false* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *not* *able* to login anymore

      _And_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *unlink* the external user from the client

{color:#00875a}5{color}. {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *false*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *true* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *able* to login now

      _And_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *link* the external user to the client (in case if user exists in USM - user will received welcome *linked* email)

      _Or_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *create* the external user (in case if user does not exist in USM - user will received welcome *created* email)
h3. *Change user type from USM to Azure*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *USM* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *USM* to *Azure*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type, and the updated user will be redirected to Azure authentication page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from Azure to USM*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *Azure* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *Azure* to *USM*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type, and the updated user will be redirected to USM authentication page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from USM to AOMA_INTERNAL*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *USM* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *USM* to *AOMA_INTERNAL* and enables MFA authentication

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type _(same old logic remains for changing user as from Azure to AOMA_INTERNAL)_

        _And_ the system sends AOMA User Account Secret Key email

        _And_ the updated user will be redirected to Legacy Login with Credentials page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from AOMA_INTERNAL to USM*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *AOMA_INTERNAL* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *AOMA_INTERNAL to USM*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type

        _And_ the system sends AOMA User Account Secret Key email

        _And_ the updated user will be redirected to USM authentication page for subsequent login attempts

   {_}When{_}: the user is external (non sonymusic domain upn)

   _Then:_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *link* the external user to the client (in case if user exists in USM - user will received welcome *linked* email)

      _Or_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *create* the external user (in case if user does not exist in USM - user will received welcome *created* email)
h3. *Change user type from AOMA_INTERNAL to AZURE*

Existing logic remains untouched.
h3. *Change user type from AZURE to AOMA_INTERNAL* 

Existing logic remains untouched.

 
----
h2. UI changes
h3. Create New User modal

Existing modal

!image-2024-11-28-08-46-39-987.png|width=431,height=380!

New modal

!image-2024-12-10-09-51-12-483.png|width=433,height=277!

*Fields to be added/changed:*
 * Username
 * First Name
 * Last Name
 * Email Address (email pattern validation)
 * UPN (email pattern validation; _value may be or may be not the same as the Email Address; {*}used for login{*})_
 * Department
 * Active toggle (true or false)

All of the above fields are mandatory/required

*Fields to be removed:*
 * Password input
 * Re-enter password input
 * Force reset password flag
 * Locked flag
 * MultiFactor auth flag
 * MFA required flag
 * Authentication type (Will always be USM for new users)

h3. Edit User Details view

No changes here, everything remains the same, except adding new User Type called *USM* (which should behaves exactly as Azure from fields standpoint)

!image-2024-12-10-09-56-39-043.png|width=393,height=409!

 

{*}General note{*}: rename _Authentication Type_ to _User Type_ in text/label/placeholder
h3. Notes for UI devs

New endpoint by path _/{*}v3{*}/users_
{code:java|title=POST (create user)}
{
  "active": true,
  "emailAddress": "vitaliy.stefanchak.reyktech+1@sonymusic.com",
  "firstName": "USM",
  "lastName": "Test",
  "userName": "usmtest2",
  "upn": "vitaliy.stefanchak.reyktech+1@sonymusic.com",
  "departmentId": null
}{code}
For update user - existing v2 remains untouched

 
----
