column371:
14/May/25 10:54 PM;jpitzer;STAGE testing in progress:



*User story:* AOMA is requested to move its authentication to USM, so all Sony Music applications use a single sign on mechanism. In order to achieve that, AOMA should adjust the AUM modal.

 
----
h1. Pre-conditions

UPN is the field which is used for login (in USM email input). We need to be careful when updating it, as it requires approval from the associated user (otherwise login will not be successful).
h4. From now on, there is going be 3 types of users in the system:
 # AZURE
 # AOMA_INTERNAL
 # USM

In USM system user can be external or internal depends on upn domain

 
----
h2. Acceptance Criteria

_(These_ _ACs only have to do with creating user and updating user_ _settings; login steps are specified in AOMA3-2096)_
h3. Create Internal user

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: a user with ADMINISTER_USER permission (referred to as "{*}admin" user{*}) on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management sub-item

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page{*}>>PASS{*}

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on Create New User button

  _Then:_ the system shows Create New User modal{*}>>PASS{*}

{color:#de350b}*3.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some fields, but leaves some required fields touched but empty (required fields marked with *)

  _Then:_ the system outline those fields with red (Save button remains inactive){*}>>PASS{*}
*!image-2025-05-14-13-44-19-878.png!*

{color:#00875a}*4.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *SonyMusic* *domain* (example@{*}sonymusic.com,{*} full list of domains mentioned in the comments)

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ user is able to login _(does not receive any email, support should message user to inform about account setup){*}>>PASS{*}_

{color:#ff8b00}*5.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *SonyMusic* {*}domain{*}, but *un-toggles Active field*

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active
 * Is this AC still relevant? For example, if user is automatically created and set to inactive, are there cases where the user account is then set back to active a day later for whatever reason?
 * Can check with Keith on whether Active or Inactive is set default on new user creation

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ new user is present in AOMA but {*}not able to login{*}{*}>>PASS{*}{*}{*}
h3. Create external user

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management with Create New User modal opened and new user *does not exist* in USM (by upn)

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields

      _And_ enters UPN with *not* *SonyMusic* *domain* (example@{*}example.com{*}, any other than listed in the comments)

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message ({color:#ff8b00}_User_ _'username' has been created in AOMA and in USM_{color}{_}){_}

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ system syncs the user with USM *(saves new user in USM)*

      _And_ created user receives a mail (by the UPN email address)

!image-2024-12-09-17-44-34-949.png|width=409,height=446!

    _When:_ user receives email above

        _And_ clicks on link provided in the mail

        _And_ he's getting redirected to USM password setup page where enters password and confirm password

     _Then:_ user's account is set in USM but user *is not redirected to AOMA* ({_}USM limitation){_}

     _Then:_ user opens AOMA login page in browser (different tab) and does regular login{*}>>PASS{*}

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management with Create New User modal opened and new user *exists* in USM (by upn)

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields a

      _And_ enters UPN with *not* *SonyMusic* *domain*

      _And_ Active field remains toggled

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message ({color:#ff8b00}{_}U{_}{_}ser{_} {color}{color:#ff8b00}_'username' has been created in AOMA and linked in USM_{color}{_}){_}

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      _And_ system syncs the user with USM *(links user in USM to AOMA client)*

      _And_ created user receives a mail (by the UPN email address)

!image-2024-12-09-14-43-19-047.png|width=384,height=355!

    _When:_ user receives email above

        _And_ clicks on link provided in the mail

        _And_ he's getting redirected to USM login page and enters his (already existing) credentials

    _Then:_ user's is authorized by USM but user *is not redirected to AOMA* ({_}USM limitation){_}

    _Then:_ user opens AOMA login page in browser (different tab) and does regular login

{color:#ff8b00}*3.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened Create New User modal

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters all required fields and

        _And_ enters UPN with *NOT* *SonyMusic* {*}domain{*}, but *untoggles Active field*

  _Then:_ the system makes Save button active

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system creates user of type *USM*

      _And_ shows successful message

      _And_ opens newly created user details on the page

      *_And_ does not sync new user with USM*

      _And_ New external user is present in AOMA but *does not receive any email* *and is not able to login>>PASS*
h3. *Update USM Internal user to be active or inactive*

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management subitem

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page{*}>>PASS{*}

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters a valid username of type *USM,* which has *SonyMusic domain UPN* (means the user is internal), in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user{*}>>PASS{*}

{color:#ff8b00}4.{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *true*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *false* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *not* *able* to login anymore (user is inactive now){color:#de350b}*{color:#172b4d}>>PASS{color}*
*!image-2025-05-14-16-54-36-225.png!*
{color}

{color:#00875a}5{color}. {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *false*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *true* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *able* to login now{*}>>PASS{*}
h3. *Update USM External user to be active or inactive*

{color:#00875a}*1.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on any other page than AMP User Management

  {_}When{_}: admin user clicks on User Management menu item and on AMP User Management subitem

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to User Management page

{color:#00875a}*2.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters a valid username of type *USM,* which *does not have SonyMusic domain UPN* (means the user is external), in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#ff8b00}3.{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *true*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *false* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *not* *able* to login anymore

      _And_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *unlink* the external user from the client{color:#de350b}*{color:#172b4d}>>PASS{color}*

!image-2025-05-14-16-53-57-188.png!

{color}

{color:#00875a}5{color}. {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details with active flag as *false*

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button

  _Then:_ the system marks fields as editable

  {_}When{_}: admin user makes Active flag *true* and clicks Save button

  _Then:_ the system updates the user details and updated user is *able* to login now

      _And_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *link* the external user to the client (in case if user exists in USM - user will received welcome *linked* email)

      _Or_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *create* the external user (in case if user does not exist in USM - user will received welcome *created* email)
h3. *Change user type from USM to Azure*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *USM* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *USM* to *Azure*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type, and the updated user will be redirected to Azure authentication page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from Azure to USM*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *Azure* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *Azure* to *USM*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type, and the updated user will be redirected to USM authentication page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from USM to AOMA_INTERNAL*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *USM* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *USM* to *AOMA_INTERNAL* and enables MFA authentication

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type _(same old logic remains for changing user as from Azure to AOMA_INTERNAL)_

        _And_ the system sends AOMA User Account Secret Key email

        _And_ the updated user will be redirected to Legacy Login with Credentials page for subsequent login attempts
h3. *Change user type from AOMA_INTERNAL to USM*

{color:#00875a}*1.* {color}{_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page

  {_}When{_}: admin user enters some username of user with type *AOMA_INTERNAL* in user look up search field

  _Then:_ the system shows User Details for the searched user

{color:#00875a}*2.*{color} {_}Given{_}: admin user on User Management page with opened some user details

  {_}When{_}: admin user click Edit user details button and changes User Type from *AOMA_INTERNAL to USM*

  _Then:_ the system updates the user type

        _And_ the system sends AOMA User Account Secret Key email

        _And_ the updated user will be redirected to USM authentication page for subsequent login attempts

   {_}When{_}: the user is external (non sonymusic domain upn)

   _Then:_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *link* the external user to the client (in case if user exists in USM - user will received welcome *linked* email)

      _Or_ AOMA makes a request to USM to *create* the external user (in case if user does not exist in USM - user will received welcome *created* email)
h3. *Change user type from AOMA_INTERNAL to AZURE*

Existing logic remains untouched.
h3. *Change user type from AZURE to AOMA_INTERNAL* 

Existing logic remains untouched.

 
----
h2. UI changes
h3. Create New User modal

Existing modal

!image-2024-11-28-08-46-39-987.png|width=431,height=380!

New modal

!image-2024-12-10-09-51-12-483.png|width=433,height=277!

*Fields to be added/changed:*
 * Username
 * First Name
 * Last Name
 * Email Address (email pattern validation)
 * UPN (email pattern validation; _value may be or may be not the same as the Email Address; {*}used for login{*})_
 * Department
 * Active toggle (true or false)

All of the above fields are mandatory/required

*Fields to be removed:*
 * Password input
 * Re-enter password input
 * Force reset password flag
 * Locked flag
 * MultiFactor auth flag
 * MFA required flag
 * Authentication type (Will always be USM for new users)

h3. Edit User Details view

No changes here, everything remains the same, except adding new User Type called *USM* (which should behaves exactly as Azure from fields standpoint)

!image-2024-12-10-09-56-39-043.png|width=393,height=409!

 

{*}General note{*}: rename _Authentication Type_ to _User Type_ in text/label/placeholder;;;

column1: USM integration with AOMA login
column27:
h1. *Description*
h3. *AOMA system is requested to move its authentication to USM, so all Sony Music applications use single sign on mechanism.*

The Unified Session Manager is a Sony internal Single Sign On tool which acts as a proxy between SME applications and the Azure server. 
----
h1. Prerequisites to the story

_this section holds some dictionaries and other useful info to get more understanding of the story ACs_ 
{panel:title=Current AOMA auth types}
AZURE: Aoma user of type _AZURE_ which uses azure authentication to login

AOMA_INTERNAL: Aoma user of type _AOMA_INTERNAL_ which uses username and password, and google authenticator (as MFA) to login

OKTA: _not used_

LDAP: _not used_
h4. From now on, there is going be only 3 types of user in the system: AZURE, AOMA_INTERNAL and new type - USM.
h4. OKTA and LDAP will be removed. 

USM have a concept of external and internal users, it is decided by UPN domain (one of the SonyMusic domains - internal, any other - external)
{panel}
{panel:title=AOMA user and USM user are not the same}
Unified Session Manager is a general purpose SSO application which is used for different Sony Music applications, whereas AOMA is only for asset management.
So, user in USM and user in AOMA are different entities.
Based on this conclusion, there can be few cases:
 * internal user exists in AOMA but not in USM
 * internal user exists in USM but not in AOMA
 * internal user does not exists neither in both systems
 * external user exists in AOMA but not in USM
 * external user exists in USM but not AOMA
 * internal user does not exists neither in both systems{panel}
----
*New login page will support authentication for all available user types.*
h1. Acceptance criteria
h2. Internal users auth flow
h3. Existing USM internal user:

_(means: user has usm sso and is created in aoma system by another admin user)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated existing internal user with *USM* user type

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: internal user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to USM auth page to select email address

  _And:_ the USM validates credentials and redirect user back to AOMA, so home page is displayed to user.
h3. Non-existing USM internal user:

_(means: user has usm sso and has *no* account in aoma yet)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated non-existing internal user

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to USM auth page to enter credentials from USM

*3.* {_}Given{_}: internal user redirected to USM

  {_}When{_}: enters his password and MFA code from azure authenticator on the phone

  _Then:_ the USM validates credentials and redirect user back to AOMA

  _And:_ user email is synced with USM DB
h2. External users auth flow
h3. Existing USM external user:

_(means: user does not have usm sso but has account in aoma)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated existing external user with *USM* user type

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: external user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to USM auth page to enter password

*3.* {_}Given{_}: internal user redirected to USM

  {_}When{_}: enters his password and code from email (or other MFA type user has set up in USM)

  _Then:_ the USM validates credentials and redirect user back to AOMA, so home page is displayed to user.
h3. Non-existing USM external user:

_(means: user does not have usm sso nor account in aoma)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: external user not existent in AOMA (regardless if exists in USM)

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system shows an error: {color:#ff8b00}_No [email@example.com|mailto:email@example.com] user found_{color}
h2. Azure users auth flow
h3. Existing Azure user:

_(means: user has azure sso and is created in aoma system by another admin user)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated existing internal user with *Azure* user type

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to *Azure auth page* to enter credentials from Azure (same page when login to Office365 services)

*3.* {_}Given{_}: user redirected to *Azure auth page*

  {_}When{_}: enters his password and MFA code from azure authenticator on the phone

  _Then:_ the Azure validates credentials and redirect user back to AOMA, so home page is displayed to user.
h2. AOMA_INTERNAL users auth flow
h3. Existing AOMA_INTERNAL user:

_(means: user created in aoma system by another admin user)_

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated existing internal user with *Azure* user type

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to legacy *Credentials Page* to enter credentials and Google Authentication code

*3.* {_}Given{_}: user redirected to legacy *Credentials Page*

  {_}When{_}: enters his password and MFA code from Google Authenticator on the phone

  _Then:_ legacy system validates credentials and opens home page for the user.
h2. USM auth is not working (not sure if this is testable)

*1.* {_}Given{_}: any user 

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

{*}2{*}. {_}Given{_}: user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system redirects user to USM auth page

      _And_ USM page is responding with 500 or 504 status

  _Then:_ the AOMA catches that error and returns user back to new Login page *(UI should handle this)*

      _And_ AOMA shows toast notification with message: {color:#ff8b00}_Unified Session Manager is not available at the moment, please contact AOMA support for assistance._{color}
h2. Locked Account
h3. Bad credentials attempt

*1.* {_}Given{_}: any user on USM login page

  {_}When{_}: tries to enter wrong password *15* times during *30* minutes time window

  _Then:_ USM system locks his account and sends a lock email

  Then: the user has to wait 30 minutes before he gets unlocked and can login again (cannot be unlocked by an admin) 

_(Note: lock period is extended + 30 minutes from the last failed attempt)_
h3. Inactivity in AOMA for 90 days

*1.* {_}Given{_}: any user is on USM login page and has not logged in into AOMA for *90* days

  {_}When{_}: tries to enter credentials

  _Then:_ USM system shows him a message that his account is locked and he should reach out to AOMA support.

  Then: If AOMA support unlocks user (via USM admin panel or via future AUM unlock button {color:#de350b}_(yet to be implemented)_{color}), user must login into AOMA in 24 hours period or he gets locked again
h2. Inactive account

*1.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated user with marked in AOMA as *inactive*

  {_}When{_}: opens AOMA [https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/] (or by any subpath)

  _Then:_ the system shows new Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: unauthenticated user on aoma login page

  {_}When{_}: enters his email address into the _Email_ input field and clicks _Login_ button

  _Then:_ the system shows an error: {color:#ff8b00}_Your account is disabled. Please contact aoma.support@sonymusic.com if you need assistance._{color}
h2. Session timeout

*1.* {_}Given{_}: authenticated user

  {_}When{_}: user does not do any actions on any page and time since login has surpassed 4 hours ({*}240{*} minutes)

  _Then:_ AOMA system redirects user to Login page

*2.* {_}Given{_}: authenticated user logged in 210 minutes ago

  {_}When{_}: user does at least one action on any AOMA page within next 30 minutes 

  _Then:_ AOMA system extends user session (only AOMA, not USM) for another 4 hours (240 minutes) 
h2. Concurrent sessions

User is allowed to have only max 5 concurrent sessions
Session uniqueness is determined by browser and ip address (same browser and same ip - same session)

*1.* {_}Given{_}: user who is authenticated into AOMA via 5 different browsers (ex, 2 browsers from mobile, 3 browsers from laptop)

  {_}When{_}: user tries to login from new browser (ex. tablet)

  _Then:_ AOMA system shows an error: {color:#ff8b00}_You have exceeded maximum allowed sessions limit of 5... Please contact aoma.support@sonymusic.com if you need assistance._{color}
h2. Logout

*1.* {_}Given{_}: user who is authenticated into AOMA

  {_}When{_}: user click _Logout_ header menu button

  _Then:_ AOMA system does complete logout of all active sessions and redirects him to Login page

  {_}When{_}: user opens any other active tab (if has multiple browser tabs open, or in multiple browsers on any device)

  _Then:_ AOMA system shows Login page
----
h2. New Login page UI

!image-2025-04-04-17-10-11-417.png|width=645,height=412!

Login page consist of following interactive elements:
 * _Email_ input ({color:#ff8b00}required, email pattern validation{color})
 * _Login_ button

h3. Notes for UI devs

*After clicking on Login button:*
 * send GET request to BE service by path [https://aoma-auth-dev.smcdp-aws.net/authenticate?email=example@mail.com|https://aoma-auth-dev.smcdp-aws.net/authenticate?email=]
 * BE returns json response with 200 status (like _{color:#505f79}{"url": "https://uat-auth-console.sonymusic.com/oauth2/openid/v1/authorize?response_type=code&scope=openid&client_id=UDYmZmhXaDlqbj0mZiZZaG5CZDI&redirect_uri=https://aoma-auth-dev.smcdp-aws.net/validate&state=ee944d6a-de93-41f4-a0be-21c563f8e0b5&nonce=f2610cae-6a5e-433a-b593-2815e5f6dc14"}{color})_
 * Do a redirect to this url
 * No other action is required _(except handling errors from BE and potential 500* from USM)_

       BE also can return error with 400 (might 403 as well) status when business validation is failed: _{color:#505f79}like \{ "message": "No external user found with    username: example@email.com" }.{color}_ So UI should properly display these errors.

 
----
h2. Test notes
 * Regression testing is required (potential security issue might arise)
 * Concurrent sessions should be tested
 * Test with both an internal and external account
 ** Internal accounts do not have to go through secondary authentication
 ** External accounts can be set up with secondary authentication in 3 ways; they will receive a security code via:
 ### Email
 ### Phone text
 ### Authenticator (in this case, it would be the Google browser extension)
 ** To change verification method in test environments, use this URL: [https://uat-auth-console.sonymusic.com/#/login] 

 
----
h2. Notes for support
 * USM admin user will be created in USM Admin Tool for managing users, lock status, etc
More here: [https://wiki.smedigitalapps.com/wiki/display/USM/Roles]

 
----
h2. Additional notes

USM API docs: [https://wiki.smedigitalapps.com/wiki/display/USM/API+Documentation]

Secret key: *SipaeXhzV1NmV3JxVD93MmtCcTk*

Client ID: *UDYmZmhXaDlqbj0mZiZZaG5CZDI*

New Service URL: [https://aoma-auth-dev.smcdp-aws.net/authenticate?email=]

Wireframe: [^AOMA3 Login Page draft 01.pptx]

column1: [BE] Return track/asset data for LFV product details
column27:
*User Story:* As a user in AOMA3, I want to be able to see tracks and graphics associated to an LFV master so I don't have to go to AOMA2 to do so.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

_1.  Return track and asset data to UI for LFV_
 * _Trailer & Feature files_

 * 
 ** _Title_
 ** _Duration_
 ** _Dimension_
 ** _Frame Rate_
 ** _File Size_
 ** _Source Format (MPEG2 Music Video)_
 ** _Subtitles/Closed Captions_
 *** _title_
 *** _file size_
 *** _language_
 *** _subtitle type_
 *** _lyrics_
 *** _comments_
 * _Chapters still_ _(JPEG)_
 ** _image thumbnail (chapter image master)_
 *** _there can be multiple images per chapters_ 
 ** _chapter_
 ** _chapter title_
 ** _type_
 ** _start time_
 ** _duration_
 * _Poster Files (JPEG)_
 ** _image thumbnail_ 
 *** _dimensions of posters different for Amazon, etc._
 *** _language-specific posters_
 ** _title_
 ** _type_
 ** _file size_
 * _Miscellaneous files_ 
 ** _title_
 ** _type_
 *** _Cue Sheet (Excel)_
 *** _Qc Notes (PDF)_
 *** _Fingerprint (MP4)_
 ** _file size_

 

_Poster art thumbnail sizes supported:_
 * _Poster100x150_
 * _Poster1500x2250_
 * _Poster200x300_
 * _Poster300x450_
 * _Poster400x600_
 * _Poster500x750_
 * _Poster50x75_
 * _Poster600x900_

_Post art support_ - [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/poster-art/|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/poster-art/_]

column1: [UI] Verify chapter times are distinct
column27:
As a user, the start times for each chapter in a LFV product should be unique, so that chapters don't overlay over one another

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-Depending on chapter number, end time of chapter must be before a start time of the proceeding chapter (example: end time of chapter 2 will be before start time of chapter 3)

-When user inputs a start time for a chapter, verify that a chapter in the same product doesn't share the same time; if so, error message "Start time already used in chapter [number]" displays

column1: [BE] Gate ability to edit LFV chapters behind permission
column27:
*User story:* Since LFV A3 product details page is good to be rolled out to the general population of AOMA users, we need to gate the ability to edit chapters behind a permission. Non-engineers should not have this ability

*Pre-conditions:*

-User is on an A3 LFV product details page

-User has permission *AOMA3 LFV CHAPTER METADATA EDIT*

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-System should only allow a chapter on an LFV product details page to be edited if the user has permission *AOMA3 LFV CHAPTER METADATA EDIT*

-If user does not have this permission, throw error message "User account is not allowed to edit chapter metadata"

*Use cases:*
 # _Chapter edit functionality displays with permission assigned_
 # _Functionality is blocked when permission is not assigned_

column1: [UI] Allow File Download from S3 (Re-assign permission)
column27:
*User story:* Originally, downloading files in LFV was gated behind a permission, and was coming from Arvato. Now we are implementing generic logic for any file download capability for S3. This will affect current functionality LFV misc files, and we will use other permissions for gating.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User is on LFV product details page

-LFV holds Misc Files

*Acceptance Criteria:*

-WHEN user has permissions *AOMA3 EXPORT* and *EXPORT VIDEO*
AND user clicks Download icon next to Misc file
THEN Misc file is downloaded from S3

-WHEN user does not have either permission *AOMA3 EXPORT* and *EXPORT VIDEO*
THEN do not display Download icon next to Misc file
 * BE will send UI a URL which will allow user to download file from S3 when download button is clicked.

column1: [UI] Handling Poster Language for LFV's to map product data language from GRPS metadata.
column27:
*User Story:* As an AOMA user I would like to see Language of the Poster Thumbnail on top left side of the product details page as default language of the product or otherwise should have the option to select the language to be seen on the poster from a dropdown menu below the poster.

 

*Pre-Conditions:* 

Type: Long Form Video

Product should have a default language. 

Poster Thumbnail on top left side of the product details page

Note:
 * Currently the logic behind displaying the posters of LFV's is it displays first available poster image from MLIB or last registered poster under that product.
 * Most of the product default languages are English.

*Acceptance Criteria:* 
On Product details page 

Phase 1:

 
 * If the default language of product is "English", display poster of "Eng" language.
 ** Dimensions order of the poster for English Products as follows: 
 *** 3840*2160
 *** 2000*3000
 *** 1200*1600
 *** 1000*1400
 *** 584*800
 * If the default language of the product is anything else but not "English" poster should display its local default language.

Phase 2: (To be implemented later and tested later with LFV revamp project) - 

 
 * Also, should include a dropdown menu to select choice of posters registered and display that poster on top.

 

PFA

!image (2).png!

*Test Case:*

If the product is English by default then the Poster should be a English Poster.

If the product default language is anything else other than English, then local language should be displayed.

column1: [UI] Hide Download button when AMP asset key does not exist
column27:

column1: [UI] Display error message when asset is not in AMP (Download)
column27:
*User story:* When an asset id is not found in AMP, UI should throw an error message. We'll use the same as what is being said in the BE. Download from S3 functionality currently exists for LFV Misc files, but when support for all asset files are done, this should be done for all.

*Pre-conditions:*

-User has clicked Download button for a LFV Misc file

-Asset id does not exist in AMP

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user clicks Download button for a file (from S3)
AND no file is being downloaded after button click
AND Asset ID does not exist in AMP
THEN display in error modal "Asset not available in AMP with id: [id number]"
 * *DEV* test product G010003080153P
 * Error message can currently be found in errors GPS call
 * !image-2023-05-16-19-23-12-709.png|width=515,height=156!

column1: [UI] Show Qc notes for LFV
column27:
*User Story:* As a user in AOMA3, I want to be able to see and edit Qc notes in AOMA3 for LFV masters so I can record quality notes for masters/tracks.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

_1.  Qc notes fields tbd_

column1: To add secondary message to ensure engineers lock the QC Notes.
column27:
*User Story:* Users frequently forget to lock the QC notes which effects in many ways. This will cause delays in the product to be delivered. So, we would like to implement a secondary warning message which allows users to check and lock the Qc notes when the click the Save button.

*Applicable Master Types:*

Should be implemented for each master type which has QC workflow. Especially for 
|Cassette,DDP Audio,Dolby Atmos,Multi-channel 4.0,Multi-channel 5.1,Multi-channel 7.1, Shortform video (SFV), Sony 360RA, Stereo DSD,Stereo Vinyl,Stereo Wav|

*Acceptance Criteria:*
When user clicks "Save" QC notes and notes aren't locked yet, then display a secondary message (as shown below) with three options to proceed.

1) *"Continue":* Save without locking the QC Notes.

2) *"Lock QC Notes":* Save and Lock the QC notes 

3) *"Cancel":*  Doesn't save the QC notes and reverts back to editing QC notes.

*PFA*

*!image-2025-01-09-23-26-38-599.png|width=381,height=185!*
column369: 27/Jan/25 4:24 PM;shar051;[~KYRY001] Backend changes are deployed in Dev. Added a new boolean flag called saveAndLock to the existing mutation updateQCNotes.;;;

column1: Audio WAV's AQC - Validating AQCs generated & Implementation of filter based on AQC types
column27:
*User* *Story:* As an AOMA user I would like to rate the efficacy of AQC notes generated by AI tool to collect the data and train the LLM to improve its accuracy. 

*Pre-Conditions:*
 * Applicable Master types
 ** Audio Master WAV 16 Bit & Audio Master WAV 24 Bit.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Note: When user enter clicks QC notes Section via Associated Master Section or Master Details page then display AQC notes and manual QC notes by default for both users with read only access or users with edit access as well (Meaning Display Auto generated QC notes will be checked by default Current Workflow - do not change anything here).*

*Also, here user (either with read only or edit access) should have Include invalid AQC notes check box and AQC type filter options accessible if they want to see Invalid AQC notes as well and want to filter their view by AQC type.*

 

Now, we should have two buttons as following for performing changes against manual QC notes or AQC notes separately and hit Save/Cancel button to apply changes. - Only applies to user with Edit QC access. 

*Edit QC notes* (Which we already have) - Used only to edit the Manual QC notes.

*Edit AQC notes* (Which we should add beside Edit QC notes) - Used only to edit the AQC notes.

*User with Edit access only should be able see the above options. User with read only access should have these above options hidden.*

*Each AQC note should not be defaulted to yellow rather it should be defaulted to White*

*Hide the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box if user click Edit QC notes.* 

*Show and check the* *Display Auto Generated QC notes check box if user clicks Edit AQC notes* *by default* *and the Include Invalid AQC notes and filters can be displayed but unchecked and unfiltered respectively by default.*
 * *Rules for User with Read only access:*

 * Here as soon as user click on QC notes button via Associated Master section or master details page for user with only read access. 
 ** The user can use check boxes against Include Invalid AQC notes to view the desired notes (Valid + Invalid AQC notes). 
 ** User can also use AQC type filter to have filtered view on the AQC notes. 
 ** Also, user will be able to identify by the inline text against each AQC notes beside the AQC type icon indicating is it a valid AQC or an Invalid AQC note.
 ** Here we will have 3 cases for each AQC note: 
 *** Valid and Highlighted yellow 
 *** Valid and not Highlighted yellow
 *** Invalid (Not in yellow of course) and Comment icon to click and view the comments (only view comment).

 
 * *Rules for User with Edit access:*
 * Here as soon as user click on Edit AQC notes button and has permission to edit then it will be displaying 4 additional buttons called *Mark Valid, Mark Invalid, Mark Accent and Enter comments as shown* 
 * User can use checkboxes left side (given at AQC level, Track level and master level) to select one or more AQC notes and using 4 buttons top they can perform the operation they want. 
 * The system should mark valid or invalid as inline text against AQC selected as soon as user selects the Mark valid or Mark Invalid buttons up top.
 * In the case of Mark accent button, it can be used to highlight them or unhighlight them as per selected using checkboxes.

 * Enter comments can be used to enter same comment against all the selected AQC notes. By clicking enter comments button it will open a small window to enter the comment and save. (for now, we will replace the new comments entered if there are any comments existing already - we can change this as and when we feel to do so) 

 * We should also provide inline Add comment icon for the invalid ones to enter comments for individual AQC notes which will open similar kind of window to enter the comments and save on individual AQC note level.
 * Add a tooltip to comment icons to help user know about it when they mouse over the comment.

 * We can use following rules for making above 4 buttons enable. (By default, user with edit access could see only greyed out 4 buttons and as and when we select those check boxes will enable the 4 buttons based on below rules)
 ** *When* at least one checkbox is selected (may be not marked yet or already marked valid or already marked invalid) 
 ** *Then* enable both Mark Valid and Mark Invalid buttons
 ** *& if* marked valid 
 ** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as valid & enable Mark Accent button (Here user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark valid button and before hitting mark accent button if user does not want to highlight those checkboxes with yellow)
 ** *or if* marked invalid 
 ** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as invalid & enable Enter Comments button & provide inline comments option. (Here again user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark invalid button and before hitting Enter comments button if user does not want same comments to enter against those checkboxes and subsequently can use inline add comment icon to enter any different comment.
 * For both read only and Edit access modes implement *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type using drop down menu using following rules: 
 ** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display `all the valid AQC notes and Manual QC notes.
 ** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display all the AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) and Manual QC notes. **
 ** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display only AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 ** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display only valid AQC notes based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 * Reset button for resetting *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type to default. Meaning upon hitting reset button "{*}Include Invalid AQC Notes"{*} will uncheck and all the selections made from dropdown menu will be unselected.

*PFA wireframes for Read only access and Edit access.*

*Here is Current AQC Type list that can be used for the drop-down filter:*
Unexpected Bandwidth
Upconverted Bit Depth
Tick
Extraneous Start
Silence at Start
Silence in Track
Silence at End
Unexpected Transition
Gap
Gap HF
Single Channel Mono
Dual Channel Mono

*Test Cases:*

*Test for Audio Wav Masters (16 & 24 bit)* 
 * Test to see if the user enters clicks QC notes Section via Associated Master Section or Master Details page then it is displaying AQC notes and manual QC notes by default for both users with read only access or with edit access as well.
 * Test to see if the user (either with read only or edit access) should have Include invalid AQC notes check box and AQC type filter options accessible if the user has to see Invalid AQC notes as well and filter their view by AQC type.
 * Test to see if we have two buttons as following for performing changes against manual QC notes or AQC notes separately and hit Save/Cancel button to apply changes
 ** Edit QC notes
 ** Edit AQC notes
 * Test to see if User with Edit access only should be able see the above options. User with read only access should have these above options hidden.
 * Test to see if each AQC note should not be defaulted to yellow rather it should be defaulted to White until and unless they are marked accent.
 * Test to see if the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box is hidden if user click Edit QC notes. 
 * Test to see if the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box are greyed and checked if user clicks Edit AQC notes by default and the Include Invalid AQC notes and filters are displayed but unchecked and unfiltered respectively by default.
 * For User with Read only AQC notes

 * 
 ** Test to see if the user can use check boxes against Include Invalid AQC notes to view the desired notes (Valid + Invalid AQC notes) and User can also use AQC type filter to have filtered view on the AQC notes. 
 ** Test to see if the user is able to identify the inline text against each AQC notes beside the AQC type icon indicating is it a valid AQC or an Invalid AQC note.
 ** Test to see if the Valid AQC notes are either highlighted to yellow or not based on if they are marked accent and the Invalid AQC notes is white and has a comment icon to view if there are any comments entered.
 * For User with Edit access:
 ** Test to see if when user click on Edit AQC notes button and has permission to edit then it displays 4 additional greyed out buttons called Mark Valid, Mark Invalid, Mark Accent and Enter comments.
 ** Test to see if the User can use checkboxes left side (given at AQC level, Track level and master level) to select one or more AQC notes.
 ** Test to see if the inline operation of Mark valid or Mark Invalid is working as expected using dropdown (When Mark valid inline accent checkbox should enable and when mark invalid inline comments icon should be enabled)
 ** Test to see if the system marks valid or invalid as inline text against AQC selected as soon as user selects the Mark valid or Mark Invalid buttons up top.
 ** Test to see if the Mark accent button can be used to highlight the Valid AQC or unhighlight them as per selected using checkboxes.
 ** Test to see Enter comments buttons can be used to enter same comment against all the selected AQC notes. Verify if by clicking enter comments button it will open a small window to enter the comment and save.
 ** Test to see if the inline Add comment icon for the invalid ones is provided to enter comments for individual AQC notes which will open similar kind of window to enter the comments and save on individual AQC note level.
 ** Verify the following rules for making above 4 buttons enable. (By default, user with edit access should see only greyed out 4 buttons and as and when we select those check boxes it should enable the 4 buttons based on below rules)
 *** *When* at least one checkbox is selected (may be not marked yet or already marked valid or already marked invalid) 
 *** *Then* enable both Mark Valid and Mark Invalid buttons
 *** *& if* marked valid 
 *** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as valid & enable Mark Accent button (Here user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark valid button and before hitting mark accent button if user does not want to highlight those checkboxes with yellow)
 *** *or if* marked invalid 
 *** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as invalid & enable Enter Comments button & provide inline comments option. (Here again user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark invalid button and before hitting Enter comments button if user does not want same comments to enter against those checkboxes and subsequently can use inline add comment icon to enter any different comment.
 ** Verify the following rules for both read only and Edit access modes the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type using drop down menu.
 *** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display `all the valid AQC notes and Manual QC notes.
 *** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display all the AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) and Manual QC notes. **
 *** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display only AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 *** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display only valid AQC notes based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 ** Test to see if the Reset button is resetting *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type to default. Meaning upon hitting reset button "{*}Include Invalid AQC Notes"{*} will uncheck and all the selections made from dropdown menu will be unselected.
 ** Test to see if the given list of AQC type is populated in the dropdown menu of AQC filter.

22/Nov/24 10:10 PM;jpitzer;*Verified in DEV*

Initial test product - G010003331132O
Additional test product - G0100005316178

*User* *Story:* As an AOMA user I would like to rate the efficacy of AQC notes generated by AI tool to collect the data and train the LLM to improve its accuracy. 

*Pre-Conditions:*
 * Applicable Master types
 ** Audio Master WAV 16 Bit & Audio Master WAV 24 Bit.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*Note: When user enter clicks QC notes Section via Associated Master Section or Master Details page then display AQC notes and manual QC notes by default for both users with read only access or users with edit access as well (Meaning Display Auto generated QC notes will be checked by default Current Workflow - do not change anything here).*

*Also, here user (either with read only or edit access) should have Include invalid AQC notes check box and AQC type filter options accessible if they want to see Invalid AQC notes as well and want to filter their view by AQC type.*

 

Now, we should have two buttons as following for performing changes against manual QC notes or AQC notes separately and hit Save/Cancel button to apply changes. - Only applies to user with Edit QC access. 

*Edit QC notes* (Which we already have) - Used only to edit the Manual QC notes.{*}>>PASS{*}

*Edit AQC notes* (Which we should add beside Edit QC notes) - Used only to edit the AQC notes.{*}>>PASS{*}

{*}User with Edit access only should be able see the above options. User with read only access should have these above options hidden.{*}{*}>>PASS{*}

{*}Each AQC note should not be defaulted to yellow rather it should be defaulted to White{*}{*}>>PASS{*}

*Hide the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box if user click Edit QC notes.* {*}{{*}}{*}>>PASS{*}{*}{{*}}

*Show and check the* *Display Auto Generated QC notes check box if user clicks Edit AQC notes* *by default* {*}and the Include Invalid AQC notes and filters can be displayed but unchecked and unfiltered respectively by default.{*}{*}>>PASS{*}
 * *Rules for User with Read only access:*

 * Here as soon as user click on QC notes button via Associated Master section or master details page for user with only read access. 
 ** The user can use check boxes against Include Invalid AQC notes to view the desired notes (Valid + Invalid AQC notes). *>>PASS*
 ** User can also use AQC type filter to have filtered view on the AQC notes. *>>PASS*
 ** Also, user will be able to identify by the inline text against each AQC notes beside the AQC type icon indicating is it a valid AQC or an Invalid AQC note.{*}>>PASS{*}

*!image-2024-11-25-09-47-17-156.png|width=775,height=334!*
 * 
 ** Here we will have 3 cases for each AQC note: 
 *** Valid and Highlighted yellow *>>PASS*
 *** Valid and not Highlighted yellow{*}>>PASS{*}
 *** Invalid (Not in yellow of course) and Comment icon to click and view the comments (only view comment).{*}>>PASS{*}

 
 * *Rules for User with Edit access:*
 * Here as soon as user click on Edit AQC notes button and has permission to edit then it will be displaying 4 additional buttons called *Mark Valid, Mark Invalid, Mark Accent and Enter comments as shown* *>>PASS*
 * User can use checkboxes left side (given at AQC level, Track level and master level) to select one or more AQC notes and using 4 buttons top they can perform the operation they want. *>>PASS*
 * The system should mark valid or invalid as inline text against AQC selected as soon as user selects the Mark valid or Mark Invalid buttons up top.{*}>>PASS{*}
 * In the case of Mark accent button, it can be used to highlight them or unhighlight them as per selected using checkboxes.{*}>>PASS{*}

 * Enter comments can be used to enter same comment against all the selected AQC notes. By clicking enter comments button it will open a small window to enter the comment and save. (for now, we will replace the new comments entered if there are any comments existing already - we can change this as and when we feel to do so) *>>PASS*

 * We should also provide inline Add comment icon for the invalid ones to enter comments for individual AQC notes which will open similar kind of window to enter the comments and save on individual AQC note level.{*}>>PASS{*}

 * We can use following rules for making above 4 buttons enable. (By default, user with edit access could see only greyed out 4 buttons and as and when we select those check boxes will enable the 4 buttons based on below rules)
 ** *When* at least one checkbox is selected (may be not marked yet or already marked valid or already marked invalid) 
 ** *Then* enable both Mark Valid and Mark Invalid buttons{*}>>PASS{*}
 ** *& if* marked valid 
 ** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as valid & enable Mark Accent button (Here user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark valid button and before hitting mark accent button if user does not want to highlight those checkboxes with yellow){*}>>PASS{*}
 ** *or if* marked invalid 
 ** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as invalid & enable Enter Comments button & provide inline comments option. (Here again user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark invalid button and before hitting Enter comments button if user does not want same comments to enter against those checkboxes and subsequently can use inline add comment icon to enter any different comment.{*}>>PASS (NOTE - inline text only displays as Invalid in view mode, not edit mode){*}
 * For both read only and Edit access modes implement *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type using drop down menu using following rules: 
 ** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display `all the valid AQC notes and Manual QC notes.{*}>>PASS{*}
 ** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display all the AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) and Manual QC notes. {*}{{*}}{{*}}>>PASS{*}
 ** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display only AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.{*}>>PASS{*}
 ** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 ** *Then* display only valid AQC notes based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.{*}>>PASS{*}
 * Reset button for resetting *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type to default. Meaning upon hitting reset button "{*}Include Invalid AQC Notes"{*} will uncheck and all the selections made from dropdown menu will be unselected.{*}>>PASS{*}

*PFA wireframes for Read only access and Edit access.*

*Here is Current AQC Type list that can be used for the drop-down filter:*
Unexpected Bandwidth
Upconverted Bit Depth
Tick
Extraneous Start
Silence at Start
Silence in Track
Silence at End
Unexpected Transition
Gap
Gap HF
Single Channel Mono
Dual Channel Mono
 * 
 -- This is a pass, but here's the actual hiearchy shown in the dropdown:*

Unexpected Bandwidth
Upconverted Bit Depth
Unexpected Transition
Tick
Extraneous Start
Silence at Start
Silence in Track
Silence at End
Gap
Gap HF
Single Channel Mono
Dual Channel Mono

 ** Edit QC notes{*}>>PASS{*}
 ** Edit AQC notes{*}>>PASS{*}

 * Test to see if each AQC note should not be defaulted to yellow rather it should be defaulted to White until and unless they are marked accent.{*}>>PASS{*}
 * Test to see if the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box is hidden if user click Edit QC notes. *>>PASS*
 * Test to see if the Display Auto Generated QC notes check box are greyed and checked if user clicks Edit AQC notes by default and the Include Invalid AQC notes and filters are displayed but unchecked and unfiltered respectively by default.{*}>>PASS{*}
 * For User with Read only AQC notes

 * 
 ** Test to see if the user can use check boxes against Include Invalid AQC notes to view the desired notes (Valid + Invalid AQC notes) and User can also use AQC type filter to have filtered view on the AQC notes. *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the user is able to identify the inline text against each AQC notes beside the AQC type icon indicating is it a valid AQC or an Invalid AQC note.{*}>>PASS{*}
 ** Test to see if the Valid AQC notes are either highlighted to yellow or not based on if they are marked accent and the Invalid AQC notes is white and has a comment icon to view if there are any comments entered.{*}>>PASS{*}
 * For User with Edit access:
 ** Test to see if when user click on Edit AQC notes button and has permission to edit then it displays 4 additional greyed out buttons called Mark Valid, Mark Invalid, Mark Accent and Enter comments.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the User can use checkboxes left side (given at AQC level, Track level and master level) to select one or more AQC notes.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the inline operation of Mark valid or Mark Invalid is working as expected using dropdown (When Mark valid inline accent checkbox should enable and when mark invalid inline comments icon should be enabled)
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the system marks valid or invalid as inline text against AQC selected as soon as user selects the Mark valid or Mark Invalid buttons up top.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the Mark accent button can be used to highlight the Valid AQC or unhighlight them as per selected using checkboxes.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see Enter comments buttons can be used to enter same comment against all the selected AQC notes. Verify if by clicking enter comments button it will open a small window to enter the comment and save.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the inline Add comment icon for the invalid ones is provided to enter comments for individual AQC notes which will open similar kind of window to enter the comments and save on individual AQC note level.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Verify the following rules for making above 4 buttons enable. (By default, user with edit access should see only greyed out 4 buttons and as and when we select those check boxes it should enable the 4 buttons based on below rules)
 *** *When* at least one checkbox is selected (may be not marked yet or already marked valid or already marked invalid) 
 *** *Then* enable both Mark Valid and Mark Invalid buttons
 *** *>>PASS*
 *** *& if* marked valid 
 *** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as valid & enable Mark Accent button (Here user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark valid button and before hitting mark accent button if user does not want to highlight those checkboxes with yellow)
 *** *>>PASS*
 *** *or if* marked invalid 
 *** *Then* selected note(s) will display inline text as invalid & enable Enter Comments button & provide inline comments option. (Here again user will ability to deselect few checkboxes after hitting mark invalid button and before hitting Enter comments button if user does not want same comments to enter against those checkboxes and subsequently can use inline add comment icon to enter any different comment.
 *** *>>PASS*
 ** Verify the following rules for both read only and Edit access modes the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type using drop down menu.
 *** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display `all the valid AQC notes and Manual QC notes.
 *** *>>PASS*
 *** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and no AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display all the AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) and Manual QC notes. **
 *** *>>PASS*
 *** *When* user checks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display only AQC notes (Valid+Invalid) based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 *** *>>PASS*
 *** *When* user unchecks the *"Include Invalid AQC Notes" and AQC filter is applied* 
 *** *Then* display only valid AQC notes based on AQC filter type applied and no manual QC notes.
 *** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the Reset button is resetting *"Include Invalid AQC Notes"* check box and a filter based on AQC type to default. Meaning upon hitting reset button "{*}Include Invalid AQC Notes"{*} will uncheck and all the selections made from dropdown menu will be unselected.
 ** *>>PASS*
 ** Test to see if the given list of AQC type is populated in the dropdown menu of AQC filter.

column1: Master & Product Details: Display QC Notes for Virtual Masters
column27:
*User Story:* 
As an AOMA user I want to view the Track level QC notes of each track in a Virtual Master if there are any Qc notes entered for that particular track from parent master.

*Pre-Conditions:* 

Applicable for Virtual Masters where Track Only QC Notes Needs to Be Displayed (Only Display) whenever Track from parent master has track level QC notes entered. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
 * Add/Enable QC notes button for Virtual Masters on Associated Master's Tab and Master Details Page.
 * When we hit Qc notes button for virtual masters it should display QC notes based on following cases:
 ** All the tracks under the Virtual Master have Track level QC notes entered on the parent master - *Display that Track level QC notes for all the corresponding tracks along with the tracks.*
 ** Only few track(s) out of all the tracks under the Virtual Master have Track level QC notes entered on parent master - *Display only track(s) which has Track level QC notes entered on parent master along with the tracks*
 ** None of the tracks under the Virtual Master have Track level Qc notes entered on parent master - *Display this message " Track Level QC notes have not been entered for at least one track"* 

*Important:* 
QC Status and QC Header section should be hidden for all the virtual master types.

*Supported Master Types:*
*{-}MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterSideDDPBluRayDVD,{-}
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackDDPWAV16BitVideo,
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackWAV24BitVideo,
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackDSDVideo,
-MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterSideWAV24BitVinyl,-
-MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterSideWAV16BitVinyl,-
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackVideoOnly,
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackVideoScreenCapture,
MasterTypesEnum.VirtualMasterTrackImmersiveAudio*

*PFA for expected UX design.*

*Test Cases:*
 * Test to see if QC notes button is added for Virtual Masters mentioned above on Associated Master's Tab and Master Details Page.
 * Test to see if all the tracks under the Virtual Master have track level QC notes entered on the parent master, then need to *Display that Track level QC notes for all the corresponding tracks along with the tracks.*
 * Test to see if only few track(s) out of all the tracks under the Virtual Master have Track level QC notes entered on parent master, then need to *Display only track(s) which has Track level QC notes entered on parent master along with the tracks*
 * Test to see if none of the tracks under the Virtual Master have Track level Qc notes entered on parent master then need to *Display this message " QC notes do not yet exist for this product master"*

column1: [UI] QC Header Modifications for SFV, DDP, Wav16, WAV24, and DSD
column27:
*>>Note from Sergii (summary of ticket):* 

1st AC should describe removing of version desc/number from all master types qc notes

2nd should move items in columns

3rd one should describe adding duplicated action buttons in the bottom of QC edit section

 

*Business Value/Description:* As an AOMA user I would like to reformat the QC notes so that I can use it more easily and make modifications to it more easily. 

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Given the user is looking at the associated masters tab of a product

When there are QC Notes available for the master

Then the QC Notes will follow the format as the mockup below shows

And the new format will remove the "Version Number" and "Version Description" from the header 

And the "Version Number" and "Version Description" should be removed from both the Edit and Read only views

And when the user is on the "Edit QC Notes" feature of the feature then they will be able to use an additional set of  "Save", "Cancel" and "Clear QC Notes" on the bottom, identical to the existing ones on the top

-And the QC Notes section underneath the Header will have its own scroll bar so that the user may see the header "frozen" and scroll through the QC Notes section at the same time-

And the "QC Notes Comments" will display in line with the field name for the criteria

And these changes will apply to the SFV, DDP, WAV16, WAV24, DSD QC Notes

 

For SFV:

!image-2024-05-03-17-29-26-573.png|width=1044,height=320!

!image-2024-05-09-08-59-25-801.png|width=1030,height=424!

!image-2024-05-03-18-09-50-466.png|width=1011,height=354!

For WAV16, WAV24, DDP, DSD:

!image-2024-05-03-17-17-03-024.png|width=1041,height=365!

 

!image-2024-05-09-08-51-29-834.png|width=790,height=416!

!image-2024-05-09-08-49-20-996.png|width=773,height=434!

*Note:*  We will have to decide the order in which we display the sections of the QC Notes, take in to consideration the fields requested to be removed, and decide whether having an extra set of buttons at the bottom of the page or having the side scroll bar would be more convenient for the user when editing the QC Notes

 

We may not want to display the Source Format in the QC Notes at all moving forward, updates to version number (this currently has to be changed manually, would like system to do this), and may not want to display Version Description moving forward either. Would be nice to have an audit trail or history of QC notes, lower priority. Will get confirmation of these reqs form Mike.

column1: [BE] Investigation for where Track QC Lock variable is used
column27:
As a means to migrate QC Notes from parent level to track level for stereo audio (WAVs, DDPs and DSDs), we should take a look at where the relevant field is all used. We should check if other audio types besides the 3 listed will be affected.

The service which uses this is called _*assetAvailability*_

One use case we'll have to take care of is when some tracks on an audio master are locked, and others aren't

We can potentially kill A2 QC Notes for stereo audio (and maybe others, depending on the analysis)....QC Notes will be added for master only pages too, for these types
column369:
18/Mar/24 8:22 PM;shar051;1. Hot Swap is dependent on Qc notes: Original master has QC notes but new master %d does not have any QC notes. Cannot proceed with hot swap link attempt 
                                                               for published product. Original master %d has locked QC notes but new master %d does not have locked QC notes. Cannot 
                                                               proceed with hot swap link attempt for published product.
2. Qc notes lock flag is used to set CDText of a product side.
3. set qc notes email template with master details(used on the A2 qc notes interface).
4. Qc notes are used in the getQCNotes API in MasterResource.java. Clients pass the master id . So they will have to pass the track master id
5. Qc notes lock flag is checked for updating the current master status.
6.  GRPS publish info webservice checks that qc notes are locked and approved for determining if the product is ready to be published.(GrpsPublishInfoBuilder.java);;;
column370:
18/Mar/24 8:26 PM;shar051;5. EOM Sender works on parent master
6. Unregistration depends on QC notes;;;

column1: [DB] Dolby Atmos FFMpeg preview: Kafka messaging
column27:
Hi DB team,

AMSE 2 is looking to push Dolby Atmos ffmpeg preview changes in our May build; we will be able to stream referential Atmos audio for a track, on the details page. MC, MSRV and MLib changes are available on DEV and STAGE.

There was one use case where audio should be available after a user registers an Atmos via UST. I reached out to AMSE 1 and thought this would be changes on their end, but it came to my attention that its actually DB changes needed. Hence this ticket: to my understanding, Kafka messaging should be affected here. Please make necessary changes to allow us to test.

Thanks,

Manu

column1: New separate release date for immersive registered under Stereo UPC to reflect on details page
column27:
DDEX now supports immersive delivery under one UPC which can contain both stereo and immersive audio. This is in line with the Apple delivery spec. 

As a result we need to update AOMA to support direct registration of immersive assets to the same product/upc as it's stereo assets. We will no longer need separate immersive only products. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Details Page Display - Both Apple and DDEX specs will support a separate immersive and stereo release date. We will need to display these dates in the AOMA Details page.

column1: AOMA 3 Linking: Analysis of AOMA 2 full master linking for Stereo audio Vinyls
column27:
AMEBA team is ready to support Side level linking.

In this ticket we shall focus the analysis on Create link for the following Full masters:

*Audio Master Wav 16 Bit Vinyl* 

*Audio Master Wav 24 bit Vinyl*

 

This will help to find all the validations and process of A2 linking on how currently it is being handled. 
Please include all the findings in the ticket. Subsequent AMEBA and AOMA 3 UI migration tickets will be created after this analysis.

column1: A3 Product Details: Asset Availability Snapshot
column27:
*User Story:*
It will be really helpful if users could have the ability to view the quick high-level snapshot of asset availability for a product without a deep dive. This will also help new users to understand and work efficiently on a product and its assets.

Applicable Product Configs: Only Digital Product Configurations and also not for LFV. (We will figure out, if we cannot implement this)

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

The asset availability snapshot is displayed when user clicks "{*}Asset Availability Snapshot{*}" button on product details page beside AOMA 3 Linking button.

The asset availability snapshot table should start with three columns:
Side, Track and Track Title

Then other columns we can start with Audio DDP's, Wav 16bit and Wav 24bit (all fidelity's including Mfit), then all Immersive masters and last SFV, VSC and Closed caption masters

If the asset is registered under a master against a particular combination of side, Track and track title then we can display green mark (should display black apple symbol if the master is Mfit)

If the asset is registered and has QC notes entered, then Orange notes icon should be displayed beside the green mark icon

If the asset is registered and has QC notes entered and approved, then Green notes icon should be displayed beside the green mark icon

If the asset is registered and has QC notes entered and locked, then red notes icon should be displayed beside the green mark icon

 

PFA wireframe as to how this information will be presented to a user on Product Details Page:

  !image-2024-12-31-11-09-18-282.png|width=468,height=234!

column1: [DB] A3 Export/MBC: Manage Vantage CT permission
column27:
Hi DB team,

There is a permission called EXPORT VIDEO BROADCAST, which helps to manage Vantage CTs. We want to rename this to CONVERT VIDEO BROADCAST; permission ID is 281. *AMSE 1 team should be notified for UI changes.*
 * Description of CT can be "This permission gates Vantage Video CTs accordingly, for display and usage by users"

h3. CT 12196
 * Add another row/entry for MBC; {*}primary module = 4{*}, *permission ID = 281* and other column values would be as same as existing entry

h3. CT 12197, 12199 and 12202

column1: [BE] Implement "Asset Upload Job Status" Page
To change the logic of display of QC Notes Lock and Approval icons for Virtual master
column27:
*Description:*

Currently Track linked (Virtual) masters of immersive or stereo audio are not accurately capturing the QC notes from parent source master and hence the QC notes icon that we show on master details interface for virtual masters is now not in sync with the QC notes icon of the parent master of that particular track,

*Applicable Master Types:*
|Virtual Master (Track DDP/WAV 16Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track WAV 24Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track DSD/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track Immersive Audio) - All Immersive track master types|

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

For track linked masters from Stereo Wav 16 or 24 bit, DSD, Video
|Virtual Master (Track DDP/WAV 16Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track WAV 24Bit/Video)|
|Virtual Master (Track DSD/Video)|

Qc Notes available info for track(s)  should be captured from QC availability of respective track master(s)

QC Notes lock for track(s) should be captured from QC Notes lock status of the Parent source master at the header level.

Qc Notes approval for track(s) should be captured from QC notes approval status of the parent source master level.

 

For track linked masters from Immersive master i.e
|Virtual Master (Track Immersive Audio) - All Immersive track master types|

Qc Notes available info for track(s)  should be captured from QC availability of respective track master(s)

QC Notes lock for track(s) should be captured from QC notes lock status of respective track master(s) 

Qc Notes approval for track(s) should be captured from QC notes approval status of the parent source master level

column1: Ability to add tracks in Track Hot swap for immersive products
column27:
*User Story:* We got users asking to add tracks for published immersive products via Track hot swap. AOMA 2 track hot swap allows it, but AOMA 3 does not. With last build we have replaced AOMA 2 track hotswap with AOMA 3 track hotswap and users are finding it difficult to add the tracks and hence pinging AOMA support team often to do so.

 

*Applicable Master Types:*

All Immersive Virtual masters

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*FOR PUBLISHED PRODUCTS* 

*WHEN* user has permission _LINK_MODIFY_SWAP_
*AND* permission _TEMP AOMA3 TRACK LINK MODIFY SWAP_

*AND* user has Master Execute access

*AND* Master is not empty mean asset availability flag is True

We give the ability to add (Only add not delete) of tracks for immersives using Track hot swap option of virtual master.

 

*Note:* This should be tested only for Published products where we give the checkboxes to add more tracks to the virtual master.

 

PS: We are limiting this to immersive only for now and similar thing will be implemented for other after discussion with business.

Edit: After discussing with business we have got confirmation to add this functionality to other master types as well. AMSE linked. 

In addition another related AMSE is created where select users (GMP only) will be given the ability to delete/edit the links for immerisve/AMB/CC/Subtitles masters for published products.

As a pseudo video user I should have ability to generate pseudo videos for an entire album using one source image, but generating text and overlaying title/artist information on the source image, making a unique image for each track of the album including the artist/title text.

column1: [BE] Dolby QC Notes: Accent "Rejected" Attributes
column27:
*User story:* With the addition of 8 new attributes for QC Notes for Dolby masters, there is also an effort to include "rejection" logic based on partners; EOM is looking to handle this logic in the future, but for now, there is a handshake with business to not use this for e2e purposes.

In the meantime, we should highlight the "rejection" thresholds for 4 of the new attributes. 4 of these are numerical and require user digit entry. The important thing to note here is that there is a difference between the range of acceptable values (max and min as highlighted in the powerpoint), and another range within for rejection. This smaller range's logic is what we should follow

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Following below should happen on save (review with GMP).
 * Confirm what logic should be when unchecking happens, after user edits again
 * _01/10/25:_ This is a BE ticket now; can automatically auto-accent the note when value entered falls in "rejection" range

 

WHEN user selects attribute Integrated Loudness
AND user inputs value > -18 LKFs
AND value is <= 0 LFKs
THEN accent checkbox on QC Note should be auto-checked

WHEN user selects attribute True Peak Loudness
AND user inputs value > -1 dBTP
AND value is <= 20 dBTP
THEN accent checkbox on QC Note should be auto-checked

WHEN user selects attribute Stereo Alignment
AND user inputs value > 50 ms
AND value <= 60000 ms
THEN accent checkbox on QC Note should be auto-checked

WHEN user selects attribute Extraneous Silence at Tail
AND user inputs value > 2000 ms
AND value <= 60000 ms
THEN accent checkbox on QC Note should be auto-checked

 

Display blue 'i' icon on each track when attribute is selected, with rejection message:
 # _Integrated Loudness:_ "Entries > -16 LKFs can cause track to be rejected by partner"
 # _True Peak Loudness:_ "Entries > 0 dBTP can cause track to be rejected by partner"
 # _Stereo Alignment:_ "Entries > 500 ms can cause track to be rejected by partner"
 # _Extraneous Silence at Tail:_ "Entries > 2000 ms can cause track to be rejected by partner"
 # {_}Unfiltered LFE{_}{*}/{*}{_}Stereo Mismatched Musical Content{_}{*}/{*}{_}Stereo Mismatched Fade{_}{*}/{*}{_}Upmixed{_}: "Entries for these attributes can cause track to be rejected by partner"

 

*Extra use case:*
 # Edit a track QC Note which is already accented with above accepted value, put value less than "minimum" mentioned above, and track QC Note should become un-accented.

 

_*PowerPoint:*_ [https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:p:/g/personal/chris_lemonde_sonymusic_com/EYH1hne5AZREsaUCN5iguX4BnEHaULIsUryg-KiNTbjEcw?e=7GIaL4]

column1: [UI] Adding Export Destination dropdown and Submit button
column27:
If user wants to bulk export, we provide with the option of check boxes against each product to select and click the Green Submit for Export button. 
 * Below destination should be preselected by default in the drop down
 ** *Export Destination Dropdown Supported*
 *** Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES)

 * Also need to Expiration date (mm/dd/yyyy - where user can select the expiry date agianst all the selected products) in between destination dropdown and submit button

Once user selects the checkboxes and submit the export job and then if export submission succeeds (i.e. when UI displays successfully submitted toast message), those checkboxes should be unselected and submit button should be disabled until you select next round of products.
