column1: [UI] Create New Dashboard for Physical Part Orders
column27:
*User Story:* BE is ready to support the Dashboard for Physical part orders.

New Menu item *"Supply Chain Order Management (AOMA 3)"* has been created under *Asset Administration* in AOMA.

This menu item is behind the permission called *AOMA3 SUPPLY CHAIN ADMIN*

*Pre-Conditions:*

Physical Product is scheduled release for non-US territories.

GRPS first release date = null or > Current date meaning it should be a pre-release product

At least one master is registered for the product.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Apply the permission to the URL as well if in case anyone has the URL of *"Supply Chain Order Management (AOMA 3)"* and show the following message "You do not have permission to view this page" if user is not given the *AOMA3 SUPPLY CHAIN ADMIN* permission.

Create the New Dashboard:

a) Product # column along with product pop-over which shows the product meta data like we have in reg job status page. (Here is the URL for reg job status page in dev:  [AOMA|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/registration-job-status]) 

b) Master ID along with Master Type (Applicable territory code and desc) and icon for Master Pop-over which show master meta data like in Reg Job status page.

c) Local release date (in case of EU show one country local release date with other countries release date in sub icon i.e (Display first one in the alphabetical order in column and rest all countries in the icon and also display only countries which have release date not equal to blank) and also use Dots icon to display additional information. 

d) Next columns display Title, Artist, Rep Owner, Parent Rep Owner, Maintenace Owner

e) Then we should also display Security Group column with one SG in the column (Can be sorted same as alphabetical order) and any extra SGs listed in the Sub icon. Use (+) sub icon to display additional information. This icon can be found in Export Status page ([AOMA|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/export-status]) 

f) Export History column up next (any product, master and destination combination exists - return those job id or else display blank and the Job ID will go to A2 export status page if we click the job id) - JobID (Job status)

[https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/legacy-embed/9QVSGWY2JIG/servlet%7Ccom%5Esonymusic%5Eaoma%5EAOMADispatcherServlet~chain*ExportSetupAction%26productID*iinput|https://aoma-dev.smcdp-de.net/legacy-embed/9QVSGWY2JIG/servlet%7Ccom%5Esonymusic%5Eaoma%5EAOMADispatcherServlet~chain*ExportSetupAction%26productID*5634647]ProductIdHere 

BE should provide productID ({*}it's not a product number{*})

g) Then we would also like to add an individual export button which in case if user want to export individual product. This button will take user to A2 Export interface in new window.

h) Otherwise, if user wants to bulk export, we provide with the option of check boxes against each product left side to select and click the Green Submit for Export button. 

(Implementing the Green "Submit for Export" button and checkboxes, and filters and refresh button is not scope of this ticket and will be handled later.) 

*Test Cases:* 
 * Verify if user with *"Supply Chain Order Management (AOMA 3)"* URL can access it only if user has the *AOMA3 SUPPLY CHAIN ADMIN* permission and if user does not have the permission, it shows the error message if user tries to access the URL.
 * Test to see if the columns are developed as mentioned above
 ** Product # column along with product pop-over
 ** Master # column along with master pop-over, territory code & Description.
 ** Local release date with three dots icon to see additional information
 ** Next columns display Title, Artist, Rep Owner, Parent Rep Owner, Maintenace Owner
 ** Security Group col with (+) icon for any additional info.
 * Test to see if the Export History col displays job Id which takes to A2 export status page.
 * Test to see if the last col has Export button which takes to A2 Export page.
 * Test to see if the checkboxes are added to muti select the products.

column1: [DB] Create materialistic view for the complex query
column27:
HI [~sira001] 

Below is the current query for creating the materialistic view:
{code:sql}
select distinct on (p.catalog_ky,m.master_id)
p.catalog_ky as catalogKey
, lr.local_release_dt as localReleaseDt
, c1.country_nm as localReleaseCountryNm
, p.product_nm as productNm
, p.product_artist_tx as productArtist
, ro.company_name as repOwner
, pro.company_name as parentRepOwner
, mo.company_name as maintenanceOwner
, m.master_id as masterId
, mt.master_type_nm as masterType
, string_agg(distinct(sg.security_group_nm),', ') as securityGroups
, c.country_cd as countryCd
, pm.package_description_tx as packageDescription
, (select eds.export_delivery_status_id as exportId
from export_delivery_status eds
where eds.product_id=p.product_id and eds.master_id=pl.master_id and eds.status_tx not in ('FAILED')
order by eds.start_tm desc limit 1 )
from products p
join product_configurations pc on p.product_configuration_id = pc.product_configuration_id
join local_releases lr on lr.product_id = p.product_id
join product_links pl on pl.product_id = p.product_id
join countries c1 on c1.country_id=lr.country_id
join masters m on m.master_id=pl.master_id
join master_types mt on mt.master_type_id=m.master_type_id
join raas_products rp on rp.product_id = p.product_id
left join repertoire_owners ro on ro.repertoire_owner_key = rp.repertoire_owner_key
left join parent_repertoire_owners pro on pro.profit_center_parent_rep_owner_key = ro.profit_center_parent_rep_owner_key
left join maintenance_owners mo on mo.maintenance_owner_key = p.maintenance_owner_key
left join master_security_group_map msgm on msgm.master_id=m.master_id and msgm.security_group_id<>1
left join security_groups sg on sg.security_group_id=msgm.security_group_id
left join packaging_masters pm on pm.master_id=pl.master_id
left join countries c on c.country_id=pm.country_id
where p.product_configuration_id in (?1)
and (p.grps_release_dt > CURRENT_DATE or p.grps_release_dt is null)
and p.maintenance_owner_key in (?3)
and lr.country_id in (?2)
and lr.local_release_dt is not null
AND mt.master_type_id != 1
and lr.local_release_dt between CURRENT_DATE and CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '2 YEARS'
and (exists (select 1 from all_assets aa1 where aa1.master_id=pl.master_id)
or exists (select 1 from product_track_links ptl join all_assets aa2 on aa2.master_id=ptl.master_id where ptl.product_link_id=pl.product_link_id))
group by p.catalog_ky, p.product_id, pl.master_id, lr.local_release_dt, c1.country_nm, p.product_nm, p.product_artist_tx, ro.company_name, pro.company_name, mo.company_name, m.master_id
, mt.master_type_nm, c.country_cd, pm.package_description_tx
, (select eds.export_delivery_status_id
from export_delivery_status eds
where eds.product_id=p.product_id and eds.master_id=pl.master_id and eds.status_tx not in ('FAILED') order by eds.start_tm desc limit 1)
{code}


Regards,
Himanshu

column1: Physical Part Orders: AOMA Created+ GRPS generated: New Dashboard
column27:
*User Story:* As an AOMA user who fulfills the Physical Supply chain orders I want an improved workflow of fulfilling orders that are originated from GRPS or created within AOMA using an efficient and fast new dashboard.

*Pre-Conditions:*

Physical Product is scheduled release for non-US territories.

GRPS first release date = null or > Current date meaning it should be a pre-release product

At least one master is registered for the product.

*Important:*
 * *Create a new menu item in Asset Administration tab called "Supply Chain Order Management (AOMA 3)"*
 * {*}Since this project will have multiple iteration and slow rollout, we should gate it behind a permission and since this workflow is specific to only a few users, no point in displaying that menu item to everyone (to reduce clutter). here's the permission we should set up: AOMA3 SUPPLY CHAIN ADMIN{*}{*}{{*}}

 

 

*Acceptance Criteria:* 

 

 

1) Export Destination filter should come with drop down menu and for now we have only export destination set up i.e Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES) 

2) Dashboard should include following columns (PFA Image for Dashboard):

a) Product # along with product pop-over like we have in reg job status.

b) Master ID along with Master Type (Applicable territory code and desc) and icon for Master Pop-over.

c) Local release date (in case of EU show one country local release date with other countries release date in sub icon i.e (Display first one in the alphabetical order in column and rest all countries in the icon and also display only countries which have release date not equal to blank) 

d) Next columns like Title, Artist, Rep Owner, Parent Rep Owner, Maintenace Owner

e) Then we also display Security Group column with one SG (Can be sorted same as alphabetical order) and any extra SGs listed in the Sub icon

f) Export History column up next (any product, master and destination combination exist - return those job id or else display blank and the Job ID will go to A2 details page if we click the job id) - JobID (Job status)

g) Then we would also like to add an individual export button which in case if user want to export individual product. This button will take user to A2 Export interface in new window.

 

*PHASE 2 (UI & BE)*

*We should finalize the display part and tweak the query and if the users say it is good, we can work on below.*

h) Otherwise, if user wants to bulk export, we provide with the option of check boxes against each product to select and click the Green Submit for Export button. 

This is the filter

*Export Destination filter: Dropdown Supported*

Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES) 

At least one or more products should be selected for submit to be enabled.

It will call UST endpoint to submit the CES export for each of the products selected by user.

If a submit is in progress, BE should block any another export jobs.

 

I)
 * *Filter based on "Maintenance Owner" that are associated to the user.* Meaning the Dashboard should display only that particular data of products to submit export job which user is mapped to particular group of maintenance owner when that particular user log into this dashboard page i.e when user is clicking the Supply chain Order Management (AOMA 3) via Asset Administration.
 * If any user is not mapped to at least one of the maintenance owner groups display the below message for the user upon clicking Supply chain Order Management (AOMA 3) via Asset Administration.

 

*Filter 1 - Applicable Product Configurations (for now)- Dropdown supported*

12-inch Vinyl Single 78

12 Maxi-Single Vinyl

5-inch CD Single

7-inch Vinyl Single

Blu-ray Audio Longplay

Blu-Ray Video Longplay

Cassette Longplay

CD Extended Play

CD Longplay

Vinyl Longplay 33 1/3

*Filter 2- Release Territory (Europe): New end point for getting territories* - *Dropdown supported*

Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Great Britain (UK), Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, South Africa, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey

*Other Territories:*

Australia, Canada, Japan, China

 

 

*PFA* 

*!image-2024-09-26-01-09-01-512.png|width=401,height=96!*

*Test Cases:*
1) Test to see if the Export Destination has drop down menu with *Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES)* as destination.

2) Test to see if the Territories radion buttons are working as expected displaying only corresponding local release dates. 

3) Test to see if we have check boxes for bulk export and individual export button (right side) against each product to perform bulk and individual export respectively.

4) Test to see if the individual export button is opening the A2 export interface of that product in a new window.

5) Test to if the *AOMA3 SUPPLY CHAIN ADMIN* is working. Any user without this permission shouldn't be able to see the *Supply Chain Order Management (AOMA 3)* menu item via Asset Administration. 

6) Test to see if the Product and Master #'s have pop-over displaying metadata beside them.

7) Test to see if the all the columns mentioned in the AC are present.

8) Test to see if the Loca release date and Security Groups has icon displaying additional corresponding info.

9) Test to see if the check boxes can be selected against the products and can be exported using green Submit for Export button.
column369:
30/Sep/24 7:54 PM;shar051;Use the getProductConfiguration query in GPS for the product configuration dropdown. It already supports below flags for physical configurations.
*isDigital*
*isMobile*
*requiresCdText*

Use query :
 select distinct(product_configuration_nm)  from product_configurations where
 is_vinyl_configuration = 'Y' or
 is_dvd_configuration = 'Y' or 
 is_dual_disc_configuration = 'Y'
 or is_bluray_configuration = 'Y'
 or (requires_cd_text_fl ='Y' and is_dmd_config_fl = 'N') 
 order by product_configuration_nm;;;
column370:
02/Oct/24 11:42 PM;shar051;*Backend search flow:
1. Get user's maintenance owner keys
*  get security groups for user from table user_security_group_map where can_view_pre_release_audio_fl is 'Y'.
* get maintenance owner keys from the table prnt_rep_ownr_maint_ownr_sec_grp_mp for the above sec groups where for_new_release_fl is true.

2. Get the products from the products table where product configuration is in the list selected by user and maintenance owner should be in the list as in Step 1 and grps first release date should be null or greater than current date.  Also, the products should have at least 1 master with registered assets.
Also, for these products, there should be some local releases scheduled from the table local_releases where the country is as selected by user and local_release_dt is not null. 

3. For the products recieved in Step 2, we need a list of product and master combination along with some product and master metadata. 
4. Then we also need to fetch a list of export job id's from the A2 exports table where product and master match above combo and the export is completed or in progress.;;;

column1: Track Master Display + Edit: Closed Captions
column27:
*User story:* We've added track master edit capabilities for various master types. Closed Captions should also be included

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on following master type in Associated Masters section:
 * Closed Captions-SCC
 * Closed Captions-TTML
 * -Subtitles- (11/14/24 discussion)

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Display track master title and ISRC on track master level, for both Closed Caption types, after Track Master ID column

*WHEN* user has permission MASTER MODIFY
*AND* user has execute access on master
THEN allow Track Title and ISRC field to be editable

!image-2024-11-15-11-44-09-211.png|width=597,height=121!

 

{color:#172b4d}*WHEN* user clicks on _Confirm_ button{color}{color:#172b4d}
*AND* user edited/changed an ISRC{color}

{color:#172b4d}*THEN* system checks if affected master is linked to multiple products{color}
 * {color:#172b4d}*WHEN* modified master is linked to multiple products
*THEN* display warning message: "{color}{color:#172b4d}The following product(s) will be affected by your track ISRC edit, as master [master No] is linked to them. Would you still like to change the ISRC? (Display linked products as list, as well as those product ISRC's){color}{color:#172b4d}"{color}
 * 
 ** User can acknowledge/override this warning and proceed with the Confirm action or cancel
 *** *WHEN* user chooses to override warning and Confirm
*THEN* system _saves edited fields and makes the fields uneditable_
*AND* system shows toast notification with message ({_}Successfully updated master track data for master [master ID]){_} and auto-refreshes fields values

+_For BE:_+ Master Event History and EOM messages must be sent/checked

column1: PKGF - A3 Previews and Regenerate preview support
column27:
*User Story:* As a user I would like to view the preview of the PKGF entire printer spread PDF without needing to download the asset into my local computer along with option to regenerate the preview on demand from UI if the preview of the PKGF is unavailable 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

The Preview feature of PKGF Printer spreads and Reader spreads (all the PDF's) should exactly mimic the DBKS preview support
 * Given the user has AOMA3 Export and Download permission

When a user clicks the thumbnail image (click the magnifying glass on center of the PKGF file similar to DBK) on the details page(assoc master section and master details page), they would like the pdf to open directly in a new tab in their web browser from which they can view or have the option to download.  (Similar to how we have on the DBKS master)

Example in stage where it has both Printer Spreads and Reader Spreads PDF:
[AOMA|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/product/88697586012/associated-masters/master-details?languageId=104&masterId=5697170&masterTypeId=6]
 * Given the user has ALLOW_PREVIEW_GENERATION permission

Like other masters we should provide on demand Regenerate preview option where user can select the checkbox and the to regenerate the preview.

Checkboxes should be provided at file and component level.

Once the preview generation is initiated we should display broken image and Red border around it with a message "Preview generation in progress".

column1: A3 Export: PKGF support for Direct Mail Delivery
column27:
*User story:* To help migrate over PKGF Exports from A2 to A3, DMD support has become more important. This ticket will handle the PKGF to DMD workflow. 
 * {color:#172b4d}Business/Angelina Capodanno confirmed she is ok with this{color}

*Pre-conditions:*

User is on product details page, whose config can link to PKGF masters

*Acceptance Criteria:*

+_UI tasks_+

Gate A3 Export button behind AOMA3 EXPORT permission and proper view/execute sec group access

New destination "{color:#4c9aff}*Direct Mail Delivery (Physical Masters)*{color}" should be displayed in A3 Export modal (no permission gating)

In Export interface, display 3 PKGF choices for user selection: Collect for File Output (Open Files), Printer and Reader Spreads
 * Display Territory Name and Master ID for PKGF master
 * CFO includes 2 options, so display these accordingly (will post legacy screenshot)
 ** -manifest.txt- ({_}*10/2/24:*{_} Decision after internal discussion is to exclude this in A3...so don't include this)
 ** CFO zip
 *** Since zip files can't be previewed, there will be no preview in Ci
 ** filelist.txt
 * Printer and Reader Spreads are different sections, with the file's subtype displayable
 ** Printer and Reader Spreads can display at first as collapsible like how we do for audio master types; sometimes, there can be a multitude of files. Side display is also applicable here.
 * Sort files lexi-graphically/alphabetically
 * _*01/22/2025:*_ There are use cases where a product can be linked to a DDP and a PKGF; in this case, for now, selecting above destination should show PKGF options. User should still be able to select other destinations ('Digital' Direct Mail Delivery, Sony Ci, etc) with DDP available.
 * +*Wireframe*+
 ** !image-2025-03-13-16-27-41-907.png|width=553,height=331!
 ** !image-2025-03-13-16-28-29-384.png|width=560,height=309!
 ** STAGE product 88691922552 for reference/testing
 ** Include Direct Mail Delivery Email Settings
 ** !image-2025-03-14-03-42-52-654.png|width=517,height=195!
 ** Set Subject field with current existing logic; Product No, Title, etc.

 

+_BE tasks:_+
 * Handle packager on AOMA side (using same as what we did for Sony Ci)
 * Post-{_}*04/02/2025*{_} call:
 ** BE to try and consolidate AOMA notif and email e-cards into a single email, with a pre-signed URL for asset. This will bypass Delivery and Promo
 *** If we go with this, Delivery to add flag in schema to note that they need to generate XML; {color:#de350b}*AOMA will send this flag accordingly*{color}
 ** {color:#de350b}*If the above AC/bullet point does not work, THEN BE to do the following:*{color} {+}_After discussion with Delivery on *03/27/2025*_{+}{_},{_} zipping and uploading to S3 bucket should still happen on AOMA's end. DMD output is an e-card with the zipped folder, so zipping is required here. But, XML generation needs to happen on Delivery's side
 * Naming scheme (same as for Ci, from earlier implementation):
 ** *Top parent folder:* _productArtist_ + _productTitle_ + {_}productNo ({_}Ex: DJKhaled_MajorKey_889853554812)
 *** *{color:#4c9aff}In case of master-centric Export:{color}* Replace above parent folder naming scheme with below PKGF specific sub-folder naming scheme; delete below folder so that it doesn't duplicate twice. Allow access to CFO folders, Press Ready folders and RS files (keep file-naming schemes intact for those files).
 ** *---> PKGF specific sub-folder:* _"PhysicalArtworkPackaging" + pkgfTerritory + pkgfMasterID_ (Ex: PhysicalArtworkPackaging_US_000009511155)
 *** ---> *CFO zip folder:* _"GFX" + pkgfMasterID + CFO.zip_
 *** *_--->_* *CFO zip filelist:* _"GFX" + pkgfMasterID + CFO.zip.fileList.txt_
 *** ---> *Press Ready Folder:* "PRESS_READY"
 **** ---> *Press Ready File:* registered filename with full subtype
 **** Ex: Label_PS_01_02_01_001001.pdf
 *** ---> *Reader Spread File:* registered filename with full subtype
 **** Ex: Jacket_RS_01_01_01_001001.pdf
 *** _*Supp. info:*_ The digits after the Spread type in the file-naming exs above, refer to Version, desc type, etc. More information here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/packaging-graphics/] 
 *** For PS and RS files, legacy AOMA uses an abbreviation; we should expand to full PKGF sub-type name
 *** When user unzips the CFO, it should adopt the new filenaming scheme above
 *** STAGE test product: 88691922552
 * Generate/include md5 hashes with each file, with same exact naming (extension excluded, as it will .md5; BE to check with AMP if they already generate these; *_Ex:_* abc.pdf and abc.pdf.md5)
 * Only CT being sent is 4202; no other CTs are selected for PKGFs
 * Email notification (legacy example below)
 ** Include Asset Root in Export Status section of email
 ** PKGF Exports have a separate section altogether (The Label Information is based on Package Printing Specs option, from QC Metadata menu item)
 *** !image-2025-03-13-16-45-52-917.png|width=509,height=348!
 *** !image-2025-03-13-16-46-38-526.png|width=529,height=493!
 *** The extra info in email is present in table mmb_packaging_metadata (linked to packaging_masters via master)
 ** Status URL at end of email should redirect to A3 Export Job Details page, for that particular Job ID
 ** Export Status Job page should reflect new DMD destination
 ** Successful email with Label information: [^AOMA Export 88875137959 - CantaJuego - Pack (Volumen 1 - PACKAGEGRAPHIC - INITIAL ORDER - Status DELIVERY_SUCCESSFUL.msg]
 ** Remove zipping instructions from the email

DMD output is an e-card with the zipped folder, so zipping is required here. But, XML generation needs to happen on Delivery's side
 * Naming scheme (same as for Ci, from earlier implementation):
 ** *Top parent folder:* _productArtist_ + _productTitle_ + {_}productNo ({_}Ex: DJKhaled_MajorKey_889853554812)
 *** *{color:#4c9aff}In case of master-centric Export:{color}* Replace above parent folder naming scheme with below PKGF specific sub-folder naming scheme; delete below folder so that it doesn't duplicate twice. Allow access to CFO folders, Press Ready folders and RS files (keep file-naming schemes intact for those files).
 ** *---> PKGF specific sub-folder:* _"PhysicalArtworkPackaging" + pkgfTerritory + pkgfMasterID_ (Ex: PhysicalArtworkPackaging_US_000009511155)
 *** ---> *CFO zip folder:* _"GFX" + pkgfMasterID + CFO.zip_
 *** *_--->_* *CFO zip filelist:* _"GFX" + pkgfMasterID + CFO.zip.fileList.txt_
 *** ---> *Press Ready Folder:* "PRESS_READY"
 **** ---> *Press Ready File:* registered filename with full subtype
 **** Ex: Label_PS_01_02_01_001001.pdf
 *** ---> *Reader Spread File:* registered filename with full subtype
 **** Ex: Jacket_RS_01_01_01_001001.pdf
 *** _*Supp. info:*_ The digits after the Spread type in the file-naming exs above, refer to Version, desc type, etc. More information here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/graphics/packaging-graphics/] 
 *** For PS and RS files, legacy AOMA uses an abbreviation; we should expand to full PKGF sub-type name
 *** When user unzips the CFO, it should adopt the new filenaming scheme above
 *** STAGE test product: 88691922552
 * Generate/include md5 hashes with each file, with same exact naming (extension excluded, as it will .md5; BE to check with AMP if they already generate these; *_Ex:_* abc.pdf and abc.pdf.md5)
 * Only CT being sent is 4202; no other CTs are selected for PKGFs
 * Email notification (legacy example below)
 ** Include Asset Root in Export Status section of email
 ** PKGF Exports have a separate section altogether (The Label Information is based on Package Printing Specs option, from QC Metadata menu item)
 *** !image-2025-03-13-16-45-52-917.png|width=509,height=348!

 ** Status URL at end of email should redirect to A3 Export Job Details page, for that particular Job ID
 ** Export Status Job page should reflect new DMD destination
 ** Successful email with Label information: [^AOMA Export 88875137959 - CantaJuego - Pack (Volumen 1 - PACKAGEGRAPHIC - INITIAL ORDER - Status DELIVERY_SUCCESSFUL.msg]

column1: [UI] A3 Export: Remove Product Config check
column27:
*User story:* In Export, we implemented a product config check early on, to distinguish between when A3 Export should be available or not. Now that we're working on physical masters/the last phase of Export, and that all product configs are opening in A3 details pgs, we are OK to reveal A3 Export button on all master types (even if its not supported yet).

 

*Pre-conditions:*

User has permission AOMA3 EXPORT

User has execute access on at least one security group(s) for master

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

Remove product config check for A3 Export
 * Aoma3ExportConfigurationsConstant = [  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDExtendedPlay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.EnhancedCDLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.EnhancedMaxiCD,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.FiveMaxiSingleCD,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.ThreeInchCDSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDRom,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDSampler,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.FiveInchCDSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CassetteSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioTrack,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.MiniDiscLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.SuperAudioCD,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.VHSLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDVideo,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoTrack,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.EnhancedCDExtendedPlay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.MusicVideo,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.SuperAudioCDHybrid,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioExtendedPlay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DualDiscLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.MemoryCard,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoExtendedPlay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioBundle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoBundle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalAudioSnippet,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoSnippet,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.Wallpaper,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.ConnectedSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DoublePlayCassette,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.EnhancedCDSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.BurnOnDemand,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.PreloadedUSBDevice,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.ThreeInchEnhancedCDSingle,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.ConnectedAlbum,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.PrepaidCardLongplay,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.PromotionalMaterial,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.CDROMAudio,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.PDF,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.EmbedProduct,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.Cocktail,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.TShirt,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.DigitalVideoCompilation,  ProductConfigurationsEnum.PhysicalBook,];

 

+_For Jack/testing:_+

This will require a lot of regression testing, on multiple product configs and scenarios. Combinations of master types should also be checked to see if correct destinations are coming. Outputs as well.

Remove permission check AOMA3 EXPORT PHYSICAL SUPPLY CHAIN for destination "{_}Direct Mail Delivery (Physical Masters){_}"

Also remove product config check for A3 Export (expose A3 Export button on all details pages, even if master type is not supported)

Test PKGF Export to DMD (Physical Masters)

column1: [BE] Download: Whole master capability on Details pages
[UI] Download: Whole master capability on Details pages
[UI/BE] Download All: Full master capability on Details pages
column27:
*User story:* Adding Download option on details pages for a whole master. Nelson's wireframe is in Attachments.

UST counterpart ticket is also linked

*Pre-conditions:*

User has AOMA3 EXPORT or AOMA3 EXPORT UNAPPROVED MASTER permission

User is on Associated Masters section of Product Details OR{color:#de350b} on{color} {color:#172b4d}Master Details page{color}

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT
AND user has selected a master from Associated Masters section
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display "Download All (.zip)" -and "Download Selected (.zip)"- button in dark gray header, next to master ID, with cloud icon
 * Nelson was thinking that the buttons should be uniform with the single cloud icon, hence why they're all the way on the right, but I'll let UI team determine what they think is better
 * !image-2025-06-09-09-51-31-964.png|width=595,height=78!

 

WHEN master is unapproved
AND user has permission AOMA3 EXPORT UNAPPROVED MASTER
AND user has selected a master from Associated Masters section
AND user has execute access on at least one of master's security group
AND master has at least one file available for download ({_}UI to use assetAvailability flag here{_})
THEN display "Download All (.zip)" and -"Download Selected (.zip)"- button in dark gray header, next to master ID, with cloud icon

 

Vinyls may not have dark gray header; add accordingly

 

_*07/16/2025:*_ Do not display button for LFV master type
 * We can continue to display for SFV, as Jack and Himanshu were able to download no problems. Atmos and 360 RA is ok too. Confirmed on 7/18 retrospective.

 

Apply above ACs for Master Details pages, on header level blue button on Information tab (no dark gray header available, so display will be a bit different)
 * !image-2025-06-23-12-41-28-856.png|width=574,height=55!

 

WHEN user clicks "Download All"
THEN all master's listed files should be downloaded in a single .zip folder
 * *User should not need to check any box for this*

 

-WHEN user checks any number of folder, or file, or component(s)-
-AND user clicks "Download Selected"-
-THEN download selected files in a single .zip folder-
 * -Is it possible to have logic where clicking any of the download icons and buttons will just download selected files? That way user won't have to scroll for a 100+ track product. See below screenshot and bottom suggestion by Nelson-
 * _*06/12/2025 Refinement:*_ we decided not to go with Selected for now, and just implement "All"
 * !image-2025-06-09-09-53-07-493.png|width=577,height=293!
 * -Button should be grayed out until a file, component or folder is selected-
 * -In order for this to work for PKGFs, we'll need to add checkboxes on each Component, folder and file in the Associated Masters section. Discuss this-

 

Keep Reason modal from single file download, but exclude the Short and Long name options from modal when "All" download button is selected. User should only enter Reason.
 * +*For BE:*+ The naming convention should be the filename as how the master is registered (per internal Refinement discussion with Rohit)
 ** In the future, users MAY ask for better naming. IF that happens, we can try to implement the Export naming convention(s) before the zipping happens. Since this is a full master as opposed to a track one, the current Export filenaming can be implemented with track information excluded. Current Export file-naming scheme is in Attachments as an Excel
 *** If we go with this, the naming convention is different for Master Exports, so adjust accordingly for Master Detail downloads
 * +*For UI:*+ The naming options are not applicable for PKGFs, for now...so you can exclude the options on modal when its PKGF. For QAs/Jack, when the test is run here for PKGFs, only the reason entry is expected to show.

!image-2025-03-26-14-33-41-664.png!

 

There will be a single event for a whole master download in Master Event History (in the desc, indicate this is a "full master download")
 * Whether it is a single file or a full master, the event history should have one entry for each
 * Event type should be HTTP Download, like previous download events
 * Like for LFV and AMB "sub-types", implement the same on PKGF master (has PDFs, labels, docs, zip text docs, etc, all with different master IDs)

 

Single email notification to be sent (track master information needed in the email can be called from the table that PKGF notification email uses. As this is coming from the Associated Masters section, product information should also be there)
 * For full master download email, there is also a certain table in UST which has information; this table can be used in the email to display the tracks

 

*Test cases:*
 # PKGF (One of 2 most important cases, as this will help to reduce A2 DMD traffic)
 # WAV (The other of the 2, to reduce A2 digital Export traffic. Also verify file-naming is good from Product and Master perspective)
 # Cover (A 3rd most important case, to reduce A2 digital Export traffic. Also verify file-naming is good from Product and Master perspective)
 # 360 RA (Object folders are utilized here)
 # Atmos
 # SFV (Also verify file-naming is good from Product and Master perspective)
 # VSC (Also verify file-naming is good from Product and Master perspective)
 # Regression test: single track download

column1: Master Details - Support for DBKS Master Type
column27:
*User Story:*
As an AOMA user to use A3 master details page it should start supporting it for following master type.

*Applicable Master types:*

DBKS 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

**

Master details page for DBKS master's should start supporting to open A3 master details page.

These master details pages should work as expected just like how they work on prod details page (associated master tab) and also should not throw any error when no product is linked to master (Standalone Master).

Permission check should be identical to what we have on product details page under associated master section.

(Note: Generate Preview button for DBKS master type on master details page is out of scope for this ticket and will be handled in separate ticket in here: [https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA3-2468]) 

*Test cases:* 

*Test for both Standalone and productized masters*

 

Test to see if for the DBKS Master's is opening A3 master details page.

Test to see if the master details page is displaying same information as it displays on associated masters tab on product details page

Test to see if the similar permission check is applied to what we on associated master tab on product details page

Verify for standalone master and user does not have view prerelease access should not be able to open the master details page.

Verify if expanded preview permission on master details page works similar as it works now product details page.

column1: To add cover thumbnails to AMB column in AMB batch linking interface
column27:
*Description:* Batch linking for AMB masters is now supported when users can link the AMB master to multiple products in a single attempt.

An additional request has been made to add the Cover thumbnails to AMB column in the batch linking interface as users who are trying to link the AMB in batch would also like to what/if a cover is also associated to those fetched products.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

*For AMB Batch Linking only*

The column name should be replaced from *AMB* to *AMB/Cover (For reference)* 

If the fetched product has AMB or Cover master already linked or registered we show AMB and Cover thumbnails in this column

Important note is we are displaying the cover thumbnails here only for reference purposes only and it will not affect the cover master in any manner. It is provided to help user understand about the cover master already linked or registered while performing batch linking for AMB master.

column1: To fix a bug in the Edit Security group when all Security groups are selected and to make import security group button available through Edit security group button
column27:
*User Story 1:*  In the Edit Security Group interface (navigate from Security Group button or from 3 dots menu) 

Irrespective of we apply security group changes to one master or multiple masters when we select all security groups by mistake there is no option to take them back to available. This should be fixed. " <<" option should be available to take unselect the security groups back.  


!image-2025-06-25-14-19-45-399.png|width=263,height=194!

!image-2025-06-25-14-20-12-023.png|width=356,height=231!


*User Story* 2:
3dots menu beside master >> Edit Security Group >> We have option of Import security group option

but for the same master when we navigate through Security Group button >> Edit Security Group button. There is no Import security group button. We should give import security group button here as well.

column1: AOMA 3 Linking - To link multiple masters in one action - Full Master linking
column27:
*User Story:* Currently a user is only able to commit one full master link at a time even if from the same product number. The ability to multi-select and commit multiple full master links in one step has been requested.  This will increase efficiency and cut down on the time to link from one product to another significantly. 

*Applicable Masters:* 

We should support this functionality for all the masters that we currently support AOMA 3 full master linking. Below is the list. And as and when other masters are migrated to AOMA3 full master linking then we can extend this support to those masters. 

List of masters that we need to support:

SFV, VSC, CC (SCC and TTML), Stereo Audio (Wav 16bit and 24 bit), Audio DDP, Audio DSD, Cover, AMB, Immersive and PKGF master. 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
Applicable on AOMA3 full master linking interface when user fetch masters by inserting the Product ID.

 

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

THEN list all the masters in collapsed version with checkboxes against each master to multiselect the masters to be able to link in one action *PFA* 

we have to show a warning (yellow) indicators for masters that have duration or ISRC mismatches to make user  to check deep for any mismatch warnings. 

AND in the expanded version we show all the information that we currently show when fetch the master in linking interface. *PFA*
*!image-2025-05-14-21-50-16-790.png|width=573,height=275!*

 

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

AND if any master(s) is not supported to link to the product configuration type 

THEN the master(s) should be disabled and should show a red message underneath the master *"Product not found"*

AND if all the masters fetched are not supported to link to the product configuration type 

THEN all the masters should be disabled and should show a red message underneath the master {*}"Product not found"{*}and DISABLE THE COMMIT LINK BUTTON

 

 

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

AND if any of the master type is already linked to the product 

THEN we disable the master type to block user to select any of those master(s) and display a message in red text as we do now. (Full master swap use case was brought up business here to give user an option to swap if necessary instead of blocking. We will address this in phase 2) *PFA*
*!image-2025-05-14-21-41-32-244.png|width=285,height=136!*

 

*If when multiple masters are linked in one action and we need to consolidate the all error(s) to show in one single message*

*After warnings modal window if no errors are popp up then the link should be successfully done for all the selected masters*

*Warnings*  *Display:* 

For bulk linking of master types we shall display warnings in one single width extended modal window. 

The modal window will be opened in collapsed version (with first one expanded) with all the masters to show the master level warnings in separate sections that are selected to commit the link along with one section for general warnings with showing indicators of warning.

 

**
Since the master types above mentioned are supported by AMEBA the bulk linking of these masters should also be supported by AMEBA

We shall create separate entries in master event history for each master that was part of the bulk linking. This should be tested.

Separate notification emails will be sent out for each master type as we do for individual linking of the master types. This also should be tested
column370:
07/Jul/25 7:16 PM;kori002;Applicable on AOMA3 full master linking interface when user fetch masters by inserting the Product ID.

 

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

THEN list all the masters in collapsed version with checkboxes against each master to multiselect the masters to be able to link in one action *PFA*  >> *PASS*

we have to show a warning (yellow) indicators for masters that have duration or ISRC mismatches to make user  to check deep for any mismatch warnings.  *PASS*

AND in the expanded version we show all the information that we currently show when fetch the master in linking interface. *PFA*

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

AND if any master(s) is not supported to link to the product configuration type 

THEN the master(s) should be disabled and should show a red message underneath the master *"Not available for selection as this master cannot be linked to product configuration of type [X]"* 

AND if all the masters fetched are not supported to link to the product configuration type 

THEN all the masters should be disabled and should show a red message underneath the master *"Not available for selection as this master cannot be linked to product configuration of type [X]"* and DISABLE THE COMMIT LINK BUTTON

 

 

WHEN the product is inserted to fetch the associated masters 

AND if any of the master type is already linked to the product 

THEN we disable the master type to block user to select any of those master(s) and display a message in red text as we do now. (Full master swap use case was brought up business here to give user an option to swap if necessary instead of blocking. We will address this in phase 2) >> *PASS*

*!image-2025-07-07-13-11-08-750.png|width=451,height=370!*

 

*If when multiple masters are linked in one action and we need to consolidate the all error(s) to show in one single message*
*>> PASS*

*After warnings modal window if no errors are popp up then the link should be successfully done for all the selected masters*

*Warnings*  *Display:* 

For bulk linking of master types we shall display warnings in one single width extended modal window. 

The modal window will be opened in collapsed version (with first one expanded) with all the masters to show the master level warnings in separate sections that are selected to commit the link along with one section for general warnings with showing indicators of warning.

 

!image-2025-07-07-13-11-55-158.png|width=475,height=233!

**
Since the master types above mentioned are supported by AMEBA the bulk linking of these masters should also be supported by AMEBA

We shall create separate entries in master event history for each master that was part of the bulk linking. This should be tested.

Separate notification emails will be sent out for each master type as we do for individual linking of the master types. This also should be tested;;;

column1: To fix the display behavior of Preview of DDPQ and DDMS files for Audio DDP masters
column27:
With June build we planned to remove the DDP Descriptor Editor interface from Engineering menu tab in AOMA which is gated by a permission called AUDIO_DESCRIPTOR_FILE_VIEW. We have revoked the access by removing all the users/Roles from this permission to hide the the menu item.

But now later figured out that this permission also gates the Preview of PQ and MS files on details page. We should remove this dependency as we are planning to kill the interface and the permission with July build. We can provide the preview access to all the users who have security level access.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

The Preview eye icon is little distorted (probably from Angular upgrade) which should be fixed.

The preview eye icon should be any permission independent and user should be able to view the previews of those files until and unless they have security group access. 

!image-2025-06-18-13-48-56-690.png|width=468,height=276!

Also, Download of PQ/MS files is throwing an error currently which also should be fixed. 
!image-2025-06-18-13-50-16-241.png|width=499,height=279!
column369:
23/Jun/25 9:14 PM;kori002;Hey [~jpitzer]  Please test this in stage.

We should remove this dependency as we are planning to kill the interface and the permission with July build. We can provide the preview access to all the users who have security level access.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

The Preview eye icon is little distorted (probably from Angular upgrade) which should be fixed.>>Pass -icon displaying correctly:
!image-2025-06-23-16-31-18-435.png!

The preview eye icon should be any permission independent and user should be able to view the previews of those files until and unless they have security group access. *>>PASS*

*Previews displaying :*

*DDPPQ*
*!image-2025-06-23-16-32-17-243.png|width=638,height=432!*
*DDPMS*

!image-2025-06-23-16-32-51-380.png|width=902,height=362!

Also, Download of PQ/MS files is throwing an error currently which also should be fixed. *>>PASS*
*!image-2025-06-23-16-35-05-673.png!*

*DDPPQ*
*!image-2025-06-23-16-36-50-882.png!*

column1: AQC - Provide the ability to run the AQC on demand
column27:
*Applicable Masters:* Stereo Audio (Wav 16 and 24bit)

*User Story:*
After previous build we now need to provide user the ability to request the AQC on demand based on their selection from checkboxes against tracks.

 

*Acceptance Criteria:*

WHEN user has permission TEMP WAV SYSTEM QC CHECK (Please note that this permission is assigned BASIC USER role as well)

and User has Execute access 

and master has at least one track with AQC status as errored out or has not run yet 

THEN we should provide checkboxes at left side against track(s) (also select all checkbox at top at component level) 

and when at least one checkbox is selected then we should enable the "RUN AQC" button

and "In progress" icons should be displayed for the selected tracks after user Run the AQC.

After few minutes AQC should run on those tracks and should be giving AQC (Purple icon) or no AQC (green icon)

 

*Note:* Checkboxes will be at track level on QC notes interface and AQC Status col will be either blank or error indicator in these cases.

 

*Testing* should be limited UST registered products. We get error when we RUN AQC on simple/direct upload registered products.

 

 

 

Note: PFA find the attached wireframe. We shall nor have any indicator for tracks which AQC hasn't run at all (ignore the Grey icon in the wireframe)

column1: [DB] To bring in Audio and Video Encoding field from GRPS to AOMA
column27:
Hello DB team,

GRPS has Audio Encoding and Video Encoding fields mapped to ISRC in which it identifies what master type of  ISRC the track is. 

This information is not currently in AOMA and hence it would be super helpful if we have this flowed into ISRC table that we have. 
We can use this information to simplify our logic of identifying the track master type from ISRC especially for Immersive avoiding the complex logic that we have now to identify from related ISRC and related products.
column369:
24/Jun/25 8:25 PM;sira001;[~kori002] ,

The following are the changes. This is present in dev and stage.
 # New lookup tables audio_encoding_formats and video_encoding_formats. Data imported from GRPS.
 # New columns in performances table. src_audio_encoding_key (lookup table audio_encoding_formats) and src_video_encoding_key (lookup table video_encoding_formats)
 # MI code changes are complete to populate the new columns in performances table.
 # I will share the Data backfill plan soon.

Regards,

Vinodhan;;;

column1: AOMA3 - QC notes lock icon color change
column27:
For Stereo audio (Wav 16 and 24bit), Audio DDP, DSD, Vinyls, SFV VSC and Immersive (360 RA, Dolby, Quad and Surround 5.1 and 7.1) 

With May Build we have added QC notes icon on master details interface in associated master section. 

*Currently:* 

Red Lock icon is for QC notes which are locked

Green icon is for QC notes is locked and approved

Orange unlock icon is for QC notes which are entered but not locked 

*Acceptance Criteria:*
GMP wants to change to below from current situation.

Red Unlock icon should be for QC notes which are entered but not locked (Hover over message should be - {*}QC Notes Available{*})

Orange lock icon should be for QC notes which are locked  (Hover over message should be - {*}QC Notes Locked{*})

Green icon is for QC notes is locked and approved (Green icon stays as is)

 

Please find the attached file of updated color of icons with PNG and SVG versions.
